{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"You’re about to get even more from your Office 365 Home or Personal subscription!","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/you-re-about-to-get-even-more-from-your-office-365-home-or/ba-p/234907","description":"<P>\n Today I’m pleased to share three exciting changes to Office 365 consumer subscriptions.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  &nbsp;\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Office on all your devices\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n The Office 365 Home and Office 365 Personal subscriptions currently include device install limits. Home limits subscribers to 10 devices in total (across five users) and Personal limits subscribers to one PC or Mac and one tablet.&nbsp; Starting October 2, subscribers can install Office on an unlimited number of devices—and be signed into their accounts on up to five of those devices at the same time.&nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Six licenses rather than five\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n The Office 365 Home subscription is already an incredible deal. For just $99.99 a year, five people can get their own licenses to Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and OneNote—plus 1 TB of OneDrive cloud storage and other valuable apps and services. Starting October 2, we’re increasing the number of licenses in a Home subscription from 5 to 6. That’s right: we’re adding an additional person to the subscription with no change in price. To be clear, that’s 6 people with their own license and 1 TB of OneDrive cloud storage each—for a total of 6 TB. We’re also integrating the Home subscription more deeply into the Microsoft family service, so your subscription will automatically be shared with the people you’ve set up as members of your family.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Everything you need in one place\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Since launching the Office 365 consumer subscriptions in 2014, Office.com/MyAccount has been the starting point for all account management. We’re pleased to announce that&nbsp;y\n <SPAN>\n  ou can now manage your Office 365 subscription directly on the \n  <A href=\"https://account.microsoft.com/services/office/overview\" target=\"_blank\">\n   Microsoft Account portal\n  </A>.\n </SPAN>&nbsp;—the single place to manage all your Microsoft subscriptions, redeem your Microsoft Rewards, and access other Microsoft benefits.&nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n If you’re already an Office 365 subscriber—thank you! Your subscription is about to get even more valuable. And if you’re not, \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/GetOffice365/JS\" target=\"_blank\">\n  buy today\n </A>!&nbsp;&nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  For more information about these changes, please see our \n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2010181\" target=\"_blank\">\n    detailed FAQ\n   </A>\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n   or our \n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  <U>\n   <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2009023\" target=\"_blank\">\n    updated terms and conditions\n   </A>\n  </U>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  .&nbsp;&nbsp;\n +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"6a181b4e2bf680a549803894317002ed","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Jared Spataro","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639102},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Announcing the new cloud-based policy management service for Office 365 ProPlus","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/announcing-the-new-cloud-based-policy-management-service-for/ba-p/310405","description":"<P>Today we are pleased to announce the preview of the Office cloud policy service to help administrators manage policies for all Office 365 ProPlus users in their organization, from an easy-to-use, Internet-based <SPAN><A href=\"http://aka.ms/o365clientmgmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">portal focused on Office 365 ProPlus management</A></SPAN>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Office 365 ProPlus allows users to access full Office experiences from multiple Windows devices. These may be managed or MDM-enrolled devices, but are often also personally-owned and unmanaged. Now with the Office cloud policy service, you can define and enforce Office policies without the infrastructure or MDM services traditionally required.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The <SPAN><A href=\"http://aka.ms/o365clientmgmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office cloud policy service</A></SPAN> allows administrators to define policies for Office 365 ProPlus and assign these policies to users via Azure Active Directory security groups.&nbsp; Once defined, these Office policies are automatically enforced as users sign in and use Office 365 ProPlus.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Build a policy configuration</STRONG> that includes the policies you want to enforce, configured as needed for your organization’s needs. &nbsp;The service is always up to date and includes the latest policies as they are released.&nbsp;</LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Target a group of users</STRONG> by assigning the policy configuration to a specific AAD security group.&nbsp;</LI>\n</UL>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Policies automatically enforced</STRONG> as users sign into Office 365 ProPlus.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"policies.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/64923i4513ACBA5B482C7D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"policies.png\" alt=\"policies.png\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>This service is now available as a preview for all organizations with Office 365 ProPlus.</STRONG>&nbsp; If you are an administrator, you can start using this service by signing into the <SPAN><A href=\"http://aka.ms/o365clientmgmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office client management portal</A></SPAN> and creating Office cloud policy configurations.&nbsp; As you evaluate this preview, please provide feedback using the feedback button (in the upper right corner) to help us improve the service.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For a guided walk-though of this new service, take a look at a this <SPAN><A href=\"https://youtu.be/xa8a424L62g\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">video</A></SPAN> which also includes a deep dive into the Office Customization Tool.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<CENTER><IFRAME width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/xa8a424L62g\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\"></IFRAME></CENTER>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><I></I>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For additional documentation on how to use this new policy service and its capabilities take a look at this <SPAN><A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=2010017\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">document</A></SPAN>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>FAQ:</H2>\n<P><STRONG>Does the Office cloud policy service replace Group Policy management options?</STRONG><BR />No, this service complements Group Policy-based management as another option. Group Policy management enforces policies on Windows PCs joined to an Active Directory domain, while the Office cloud policy service only requires Azure Active Directory sign-in as part of Office 365 ProPlus.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>What are primary differences between the types of policies I can enforce using Office cloud policy service compared to Group Policy?</STRONG><BR />Office cloud policy service manages user-based policies for Office 365 ProPlus. Group Policy can manage both user-based and machine-based policies.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>How does the Office cloud policy service compare with the Office Customization Tool for Click-to-Run’s application preferences settings?<BR /></STRONG>The settings configured as part of Office installation using the Office Customization Tool for Click-to-Run – as well as previous OCT versions – are based on ‘preferences’, meaning that a user can change them. Office cloud policy service settings are enforced, similar to Group Policy enforcement.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Is an Intune subscription required?</STRONG></P>\n<P>No.&nbsp; It is not required that the tenant have an Intune subscription.&nbsp; This is a feature of Office 365 ProPlus and only requires that the tenant have a&nbsp;subscription that includes Office 365 ProPlus.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Does this work with all Office Click-to-Run products?</STRONG></P>\n<P>No.&nbsp; This is a feature of Office 365 ProPlus and only works with the Office apps that are deployed as a part of the Office 365 ProPlus suite.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Does this new policy service support all the policies from the Office ADMX templates?</STRONG></P>\n<P>No.&nbsp; Currently this preview is limited to a subset of the user based policies defined in the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=49030\" target=\"_self\">ADMX templates</A>.&nbsp; All machine based policies are not included.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Which admin roles are allowed access to configure policies?</STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN>Only the Global Admin, Security Admin or Desktop Analytics Admin (private preview) roles are allowed access to create or view policy configurations.</SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 20 Mar 2019 19:39:02 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/64923i4513ACBA5B482C7D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"b1216b2f7b32a87dbc39b9817a4f5c25","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn58@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-50-39-866_4c5aaef820217e69.webp","destWidth":998,"destHeight":675,"sourceBytes":204415,"destBytes":41562,"author":"Chris Hopkins","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/64923i4513ACBA5B482C7D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn58@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-50-39-866_4c5aaef820217e69.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639100},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"What’s new for OneNote in October 2018","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/what-s-new-for-onenote-in-october-2018/ba-p/274625","description":"<P>Today, we’re excited to share the latest updates for OneNote across <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/onenote/9wzdncrfhvjl\" target=\"_blank\">Windows 10</A>, <A href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-onenote/id784801555\" target=\"_blank\">Mac</A> and <A href=\"https://www.onenote.com/\" target=\"_blank\">online</A>. From cloud file attachments, tag search, to Emoji keyboard and customizable autocorrect, we will be rolling out these updates in the coming weeks, so read on to find out more.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Keep your work in sync with OneNote</H2>\n<P>Ever wonder if you’re looking at the latest version of a file? When you attach a file stored in the cloud (i.e. on your OneDrive) to your OneNote page, you won’t have to wonder anymore because your file will be synced with the latest changes through OneDrive. You can attach cloud files simply by enabling it in Settings and clicking Insert &gt; File. Once your cloud attachment is on the page, OneNote will upload the file into OneDrive, which makes real-time editing and collaborating on the file easy. Your notebook will display a live preview if it is an Office document, so you can see changes made to the file in real time. For all other document types, the attachment will display a link, but because the files are uploaded to OneDrive, the link will always display the latest version of the file. Cloud file attachments are coming to OneNote for Windows 10 and Mac in the next few weeks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"cloud attachements.jpg\" style=\"width: 899px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/57631i92D7F55A8313D244/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"cloud attachements.jpg\" alt=\"cloud attachements.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Find what you need, when you need it</H2>\n<P>Based on your feedback (thank you!), we’re rolling out the ability to search for tags in the OneNote for Windows 10 and Mac over the next few weeks. Tag search helps you to stay organized and keep track of subjects that may span multiple pages, sections, and even notebooks. You can search for tags by clicking the magnifying glass next to the notebook name in the left-had navigation pane. Type in your search query and choose to search all notebooks or the current notebook, section, or page.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"search for tags.png\" style=\"width: 641px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/57627i60B2E5B1D717DC24/image-dimensions/641x714?v=1.0\" width=\"641\" height=\"714\" title=\"search for tags.png\" alt=\"search for tags.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Create, express yourself and collaborate in OneNote Online</H2>\n<P>OneNote for Windows 10 and Mac aren’t the only platforms to receive updates this month! Personalize and collaborate in OneNote Online with the features below – they are currently rolling out and will be available for all OneNote Online users to try in the coming weeks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Insert pictures from camera</STRONG><BR />Use the new insert picture from camera feature to create pages with more context and clarity. Click Insert&gt;Camera to select camera mode. Snap a picture and click insert to add it to your page. You may have to enable camera support in your browser to use this feature. It’s really that easy.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CameraDemoGif (1).gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/57630iA9A3AEDE90351C25/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"CameraDemoGif (1).gif\" alt=\"CameraDemoGif (1).gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Personalize with Emoji Keyboard</STRONG><BR />This fun feature allows you to browse and insert the appropriate emoji to your notebooks. Click Insert&gt;Emoji to see a sample of available emojis. To browse the whole collection, click “More Emojis” and the emoji keyboard will open for more ways to add flair to your content.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Emojis in OneNote.gif\" style=\"width: 699px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/57617iE41C36EB75EE1368/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Emojis in OneNote.gif\" alt=\"Emojis in OneNote.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Customize AutoCorrect options</STRONG><BR />OneNote Online is giving you control of your autocorrect options. To access them, click on Home&gt;Spelling&gt;AutoCorrect Options to choose how you want OneNote Online to handle each of the displayed options. Fun fact: autocorrect can convert punctuation smileys to emojis :)</img>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"autocorrect.gif\" style=\"width: 699px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/57618iEDD4A3663D2A7C80/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"autocorrect.gif\" alt=\"autocorrect.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Copy and share link to section</STRONG><BR />Easily share notebook sections for more collaboration: Right-click on a section you’d like to share and click “Copy Link to Section.” This copies a link that will render the section name when pasted into a OneNote Online document.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Copy Share link to section.gif\" style=\"width: 699px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/57619i6691602F25372F44/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Copy Share link to section.gif\" alt=\"Copy Share link to section.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We hope you love the latest updates to hit OneNote for Windows 10, Mac and online. Nothnagel","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639088},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"What’s new in Office Lens – October Update","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/what-s-new-in-office-lens-october-update/ba-p/271532","description":"<P>Today we are pleased to announce some exciting new features available in Office Lens this month.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Immersive reader for Android</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Immersive reader is a popular feature on various Microsoft apps on across platforms, including Windows, web, and iOS. We’re excited to bring Immersive reader directly into Office Lens for Android. Immersive reader will be available for English content only.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Immersive reader helps users easily scan and read content, not only making a digital copy of the content, but also creating a more accessible content capture experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><EM>Read aloud</EM> allows users to have text read out loud while highlighting each word. This feature of Immersive reader improves text decoding, fluency and comprehension while sustaining focus and attention.</LI>\n<LI>Increase or decrease the <EM>font size</EM> for better visibility of text.</LI>\n<LI><EM>Wide text spacing</EM> optimizes font spacing in a narrow column view to aid reading fluency for users with visual crowding issues.</LI>\n<LI><EM>Rewind and forward</EM> — Allows the user to move backwards and forwards in the content.</LI>\n<LI>Control the <EM>speaking rate</EM> of the voice reading aloud the text.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><VIDEO poster=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/ImmersiveReader.PNG\" preload=\"none\" controls=\"controls\" width=\"70%\" height=\"75%\"> <SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/Immersive%20Reader%20Final%20Promo%20Video.mp4\"> </SOURCE></VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Tap to Select for Android</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>When you tap the camera screen to focus, Office Lens will attempt to find the document boundary around the tapped area to lock it in. This feature is especially helpful when there are multiple document-like objects in the camera view and you want to select a particular one to scan.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><VIDEO poster=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/TapToSelect.PNG\" preload=\"none\" controls=\"controls\" width=\"70%\" height=\"75%\"> <SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/TapToSelect.mp4\"> </SOURCE></VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Snap to Edge for Android</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Removing the background from documents is now easier. When scanning a document, move the crop handles and the cropping boundary will snap to the nearest document edge.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><VIDEO poster=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/STE_promo.PNG\" preload=\"none\" controls=\"controls\" width=\"70%\" height=\"75%\"> <SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/STE_promo.mp4\"> </SOURCE></VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Text annotations for iOS</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Previously released on Android, you can now annotate photos with text of different styles and colors after they’ve been taken with Office Lens.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Office Lens.png\" style=\"width: 699px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/56429i3021AFFED3C7BFA5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Office Lens.png\" alt=\"Office Lens.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To get the latest Office Lens features, update your app on <A href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.office.officelens\" target=\"_blank\">Google Play</A> or <A href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/in/app/office-lens/id975925059?mt=8\" target=\"_blank\">App store</A> now. Do comment below and let us know how you like to use Office Lens in your day!</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 15 Oct 2018 19:11:09 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/56429i3021AFFED3C7BFA5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"b80368d9e62754d4890bf39b59822c17","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn61@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-50-40-522_3f7c3b6a812fb6b8.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":191023,"destBytes":33640,"author":"Mitali Jain","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/56429i3021AFFED3C7BFA5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn61@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-50-40-522_3f7c3b6a812fb6b8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639102},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"The best version of OneNote on Windows","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/the-best-version-of-onenote-on-windows/ba-p/183974","description":"<P style=\"border: 3px; border-style: solid; border-color: #FF0000; padding: 1em;\"><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>The below article is out of date as of Nov 4<SUP>th</SUP> 2019. Please check out <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Your-OneNote/ba-p/954922\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this article</A> for the latest OneNote announcement.</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We’re incredibly lucky to have millions of passionate OneNote users around the globe, and we love learning how we can help you remember, think, and organize better. In spending time with you, we heard a recurring theme: you want a single version of OneNote on Windows that combines all the benefits of the modern Windows 10 app with the depth and breadth of capabilities in the older OneNote 2016. We took that feedback to heart, and over the last few years we’ve been focused on making OneNote for Windows 10 the best version of OneNote on Windows.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Beginning with the launch of Office 2019 later this year, OneNote for Windows 10 will replace OneNote 2016 as the default OneNote experience for both Office 365 and Office 2019. Why OneNote for Windows 10? The app has improved performance and reliability, and it’s powered by a brand new sync engine (which we’re also bringing to web, Mac, iOS, and Android). You don’t need to worry about being on the latest version since it’s always up-to-date via the Microsoft Store, and it lets us deliver updates faster than ever before. In fact, over the last year and a half we've added more than 100 of your favorite OneNote 2016 features based on your feedback (thank you!), with more improvements on the way including tags and better integration with Office documents.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We’d love for you to start using OneNote for Windows 10 today, however we know some of you might not be ready yet. Maybe you rely on a feature we don’t yet support on Windows 10 (please let us know using the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/store/productId/9NBLGGH4R32N\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Feedback Hub</A>), or you don’t want to store your notebooks in the cloud. If so, you’re more than welcome to continue using OneNote 2016.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>What’s happening to OneNote 2016?</H1>\n<P>While we’re no longer adding new features to OneNote 2016, it’ll still be there if you need it. OneNote 2016 is optionally available for anyone with Office 365 or Office 2019, but it will no longer be installed by default. If you currently use OneNote 2016, you won’t notice any changes when you update to Office 2019. We’ll continue to offer support, bug fixes, and security updates for OneNote 2016 for the duration of the <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/search\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 2016 support lifecycle</A>, which runs through October 2020 for mainstream support and October 2025 for extended support. For more details, please refer to <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/6582c7ae-2ec6-408d-8b7a-3ed71a3c2103\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this FAQ</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>A preview of what’s to come</H1>\n<P>We've been listening to your feedback about what you like—and what you don't—and working hard to address it in the product. Your opinions, feature requests, and, yes, complaints have been critical in helping us shape the current experience. Today, we’d like to walk you through some of the work we’ve done to bring your favorite features from OneNote 2016 to OneNote for Windows 10, highlight some of the capabilities that are only available in the Windows 10 app, and give you a sneak peek at a few of the improvements coming this year.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<H2>Your favorite features, improved</H2>\n<P>OneNote for Windows 10 was designed to feel natural with any input method, from mouse and keyboard to pen and touch, and it contains numerous improvements under the hood for better performance, reliability, and battery life. It also has <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/a624e692-b78b-4c09-b07f-46181958118f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a number of new features not available in OneNote 2016</A>, including ink effects* and dramatically improved ink-to-text (check it out—it’ll even preserve your ink color, size, and highlights!), Researcher*, a notification center, deep integration with Windows 10, and much more.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><VIDEO controls=\"controls\" width=\"55%\" height=\"400\">\n  <SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/Ink%20to%20Text%20(video).mp4\" type=\"video/mp4\"></SOURCE>\nYour browser does not support the video tag.</VIDEO></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For many of you, shifting our focus to the Windows 10 app won’t come as a surprise. Aside from a handful of targeted improvements, we haven’t added any new features to OneNote 2016 in some time. Instead we’ve been focusing on consistency, ensuring that nearly all your favorite features in OneNote 2016 are also available in OneNote for Windows 10. We’re almost there, and in the coming months we’ll be adding even more top-requested features.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Top-requested features coming soon to OneNote for Windows 10</H2>\n<P>Here's what you can expect later this summer:<BR /><BR /></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>\n<P><STRONG>Insert and search for tags</STRONG>: OneNote 2016’s popular tags feature is coming to OneNote for Windows 10! Soon you’ll be able to insert, create, and search for custom tags, making it easy to mark key information and find it later. Tags you create will now roam with you to across your devices, and OneNote will even show you tags other people have used in a shared notebook so you don’t have to recreate them yourself. The new tags experience was designed based on your feedback, and it will be available later this summer.</P>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Tags.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/32490i988DB3A941DF77C0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tags.png\" alt=\"Tags.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>\n<P><STRONG>View and edit files:</STRONG> See live previews of Office files in OneNote, work together on attached documents, and save space in your notebooks with cloud files. You’ll get all the benefits of saving a file on OneDrive with the context and convenience of an attachment or preview on a OneNote page.</P>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Cloud Files.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/32491i6E8E8677119C437B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Cloud Files.png\" alt=\"Cloud Files.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>\n<P><STRONG>Additional Class Notebook features:</STRONG> The full slate of Class Notebook features available in the add-on for OneNote 2016 will be available in OneNote for Windows 10 this summer. Best of all, you no longer need to install a separate add-in—it's all built-in!</P>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>These are just a few of the improvements coming soon to OneNote for Windows 10. The app is updated every month with new functionality, and we have a lot of cool stuff in the works—including page templates. Stay tuned for more <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/build\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">exciting announcements</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>An improved sync experience</H2>\n<P>We've been hard at work making sync faster and more reliable on OneNote for Windows 10, as well as on Mac, iOS, Android, and web. Since a picture is worth a thousand words, here's a look at the new sync engine in action:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><VIDEO controls=\"controls\" width=\"55%\" height=\"400\">\n  <SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/Modern%20Sync%20(video).mp4\" type=\"video/mp4\"></SOURCE>\nYour browser does not support the video tag.</VIDEO></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You can try the first set of improvements today by opening a OneDrive notebook in&nbsp;OneNote for Windows 10, Mac, iOS, or Android. These improvements&nbsp;will be rolled out to OneNote Online in the coming months, as well as notebooks on OneDrive for Business and SharePoint.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Improving the user experience</H2>\n<P>Last year, we unveiled a <A href=\"https://blogs.office.com/en-us/2017/05/18/note-taking-made-easier-for-everyone-redesigning-onenote/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">new look and feel for OneNote</A> on Windows 10, Mac, iOS, Android, and OneNote Online that aligned the disparate designs into a single, unified interface. In addition to bringing consistency to our apps, the new user experience scales much better for large notebooks and significantly improves accessibility for those who rely on assistive technologies. To learn more about the new design, check out our <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/ab84fcc2-f845-41ac-9c29-89b0720c8eb3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">help article</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Navigation.png\" style=\"width: 891px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/32492i70F144DDBB8BB56C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Navigation.png\" alt=\"Navigation.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>This is just a quick look at OneNote for Windows 10, but we’re not done yet. We'll continue listening to your feedback and incorporating it into our future plans, so leave us a comment below or add your feature request using the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/store/productId/9NBLGGH4R32N\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Feedback Hub</A>. You can also <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/52eef684-5c9a-4fb3-80f6-cbec801f805d\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">join the Office Insider program</A> for early access to the latest updates. And before we sign off, we want to say a huge thank you for your support. We really hope you love the new OneNote for Windows!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>—OneNote Team</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT color=\"#808080\"><EM>*Requires Office 365 /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><SPAN>Traditional </SPAN><SPAN>enterprise network architecture revolves around the </SPAN><SPAN>pre</SPAN><SPAN>-</SPAN><SPAN>cloud</SPAN><SPAN> world. A world where data, services and applications </SPAN><SPAN>generally </SPAN><SPAN>liv</SPAN><SPAN>e</SPAN><SPAN> within the corporate walled garden and </SPAN><SPAN>thus </SPAN><SPAN>connectivity </SPAN><SPAN>is</SPAN><SPAN> simply from the user locations to where the data/services/applications are</SPAN><SPAN> hosted</SPAN><SPAN>. </SPAN><SPAN>To exit t</SPAN><SPAN>his </SPAN><SPAN>network</SPAN><SPAN> we have a centralized, strict security stack to protect the corporate environment from the unknown, untrusted exte</SPAN><SPAN>rnal world.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335551550&quot;:6,&quot;335551620&quot;:6,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335551550&quot;:6,&quot;335551620&quot;:6,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><SPAN>As t</SPAN><SPAN>he </SPAN><SPAN>data</SPAN><SPAN> &amp; egress </SPAN><SPAN>creates latency and a </SPAN><SPAN>leads</SPAN><SPAN> to a poor end user experience</SPAN> <SPAN>and additional cost for enterprises.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335551550&quot;:6,&quot;335551620&quot;:6,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335551550&quot;:6,&quot;335551620&quot;:6,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><SPAN>This Pre-Day course is being hosted by Microsoft’s network architecture </SPAN><SPAN>team </SPAN><SPAN>and consists of</SPAN><SPAN> hands-on labs on how to optimize network connectivity </SPAN><SPAN>in the cloud era, with a specific focus </SPAN><SPAN>on </SPAN><SPAN>Office 365. You will hear the pros and cons of each connectivity model (Proxied, Direct and ExpressRoute), </SPAN><SPAN>how </SPAN><SPAN>Office 365 workloads connect, steps to improve network connectivity and performance</SPAN><SPAN> by transforming the network model to the cloud era.</SPAN><SPAN> We’ll also look </SPAN><SPAN>in detail </SPAN><SPAN>at the </SPAN><SPAN>new method </SPAN><SPAN>due to go live in October which Microsoft will use to publish the URLs/IPs for the service, allowing for greater automation and simplified </SPAN><SPAN>u</SPAN><SPAN>sage</SPAN><SPAN>.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335551550&quot;:6,&quot;335551620&quot;:6,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\"> The day includes various labs of the topics discussed so you can gain first hand experience of what you're learning.</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><STRONG><SPAN>Topics include:</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"•\" data-font=\"Arial\" data-listid=\"2\" data-aria-posinset=\"1\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN>Office 365 Connectivity Principles</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"•\" data-font=\"Arial\" data-listid=\"2\" data-aria-posinset=\"2\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN>Datacenter Infrastructure &amp; your data</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"•\" data-font=\"Arial\" data-listid=\"2\" data-aria-posinset=\"2\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN>Connecting to Microsoft’s network infrastructure</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"•\" data-font=\"Arial\" data-listid=\"2\" data-aria-posinset=\"2\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN>Understanding &amp; Troubleshooting Routing</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"•\" data-font=\"Arial\" data-listid=\"2\" data-aria-posinset=\"2\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN>Understanding &amp; Troubleshooting Latency&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"•\" data-font=\"Arial\" data-listid=\"2\" data-aria-posinset=\"2\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN>Enterprise Connectivity Options</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><SPAN> Connecting via a Proxy</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>Direct Connectivity&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>ExpressRoute</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN>Bandwidth Planning &amp; collaboration across Microsoft 365. With Office 365 Groups, a group of people can access and share a collection of collaboration resources, such as a&nbsp;shared Outlook inbox,&nbsp;calendar,&nbsp;SharePoint document library, a&nbsp;Planner, a Team, and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Recently, at <A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Ignite 2019</A> in Orlando, FL, the Office 365 Groups team delivered several session that included announcements of enhancements and new innovations for Office 365 Groups, such as new <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/User-Activity-based-Expiration-Policy-for-Office-365-groups-is/ba-p/942877\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">user activity-based expiration policy for Office 365 Groups</A>, and the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Groups/Introducing-the-Groups-Admin-Role/m-p/978995\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Groups Admin role</A>, and best practices, such as <A href=\"https://aka.ms/GroupsGP\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">creating a governance plan</A>, <A href=\"https://aka.ms/GroupsSS\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">enabling self-service</A>, and <A href=\"https://aka.ms/UsageAnalytics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">leveraging analytics to understand usage</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The Office 365 Groups breakout sessions highlighted innovations across Outlook Mobile, Outlook Desktop, Outlook on the Web, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft 365 admin center, SharePoint Site URL Rename, Identity Governance, Yammer, and more. 269px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159216i5213568AC45F9911/image-dimensions/269x208?v=1.0\" width=\"269\" height=\"208\" title=\"clipboard_image_1.jpeg\" alt=\"clipboard_image_1.jpeg\" /></span></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 27 Nov 2019 20:18:07 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159223iEE7BB894C73803E8/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400","linkMd5":"4f421d89bbfedcd14339e0f75eccfa2f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-41-334_38db0a766546a989.webp","destWidth":250,"destHeight":219,"sourceBytes":15620,"destBytes":7220,"author":"Scott Schnoll","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159223iEE7BB894C73803E8/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-41-334_38db0a766546a989.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/159216i5213568AC45F9911/image-dimensions/269x208?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn83@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-42-484_5d90f314abeba033.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639095},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Configuring Office 365 ProPlus updates for remote workers using VPN","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/configuring-office-365-proplus-updates-for-remote-workers-using/ba-p/1253491","description":"<P>Due to the dynamic situation with COVID-19 many IT pros are being challenged to assess ways to configure Office 365 Client to update directly from Microsoft CDN. Today, the majority of customers I engage with manage updates using Configuration Manager (ConfigMgr), predominately on-premises. The objective of this posting is how to minimize internet egress through customer VPN network for Office updates.&nbsp; We also have guidance for initial <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/deploy-office-365-proplus-to-remote-workers/ba-p/1258514\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote install</A> and <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/fieldnotes/build-dynamic-lean-universal-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">second installs (e.g. Visio/Project)</A> of Office.&nbsp; Further, we offer additional <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-secure-your-remote-workers-with-office-cloud-policy/ba-p/1308579\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">free security layer</A> to protect machines whether they are&nbsp; on-premises or remote regardless if machine is \"managed\" or not.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2 class=\"lia-align-center\"><STRONG>Network considerations</STRONG></H2>\n<P>There are an infinite number of ways customers configure network access, no two customers are identical in configuration.&nbsp; Speaking generally, the VPN client needs to support split tunneling or be configured so network traffic destined for Office 365 are directed to internet and are not required to pass through VPN Server.&nbsp; Microsoft provides a list of all Office 365 URLs and IP address ranges in the following <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/urls-and-ip-address-ranges\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">document</A>.&nbsp; Some customers have VPN clients dynamically aware of Office 365 Services using Microsoft Graph API, some support URLs and others only support IP exclusions.&nbsp; You’ll notice item(s) 90 and 92 which provide specific URLs used by the Office 365 Client to perform updates.</P>\n<TABLE width=\"96%\">\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\" style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 10.06px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">90</FONT></P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">Default</FONT><BR /><FONT size=\"1\">Required</FONT></P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">mrodevicemgr.officeapps.live.com (Description: Device Management Service (DMS) is used to advertise the C2R builds to the machines which are non-admin managed based on the meta data passed by the machine.)</FONT></P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\"><STRONG>TCP: </STRONG>443</FONT></P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">92</FONT></P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">Default</FONT><BR /><FONT size=\"1\">Required</FONT></P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">officecdn.microsoft.com, officecdn.microsoft.com.edgesuite.net (Description: Office CDN where content is downloaded)</FONT></P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\"><STRONG>TCP:</STRONG> 443, 80</FONT></P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Concerning Office updates, one challenge is that the CNAME officecdn.microsoft.com doesn't belong to the \"optimize\" category.&nbsp; Therefore, the IP addresses which may be defined for VPN Forced Tunnel with exceptions won't include OfficeCDN IP addresses (hosted by Akamai) so Office updates will be directed to the VPN tunnel and back to corporate.&nbsp; If you have VPN Selective Tunnel implemented, then all network traffic for Office updates will go directly to the internet.&nbsp; Reviewing <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/office-365-vpn-implement-split-tunnel#common-vpn-scenarios\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">common VPN scenarios</A> and comparing it to your environment is an important first step.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Tip: Please review blog posting&nbsp;<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-quickly-optimize-office-365-traffic-for-remote-staff-amp/ba-p/1214571\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><FONT face=\"SegoeUI,Lato,&quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">How to quickly optimize Office 365 traffic for remote staff &amp; reduce the load on your infrastructure</FONT></A></P>\n<P><FONT face=\"SegoeUI,Lato,&quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Tip: Please review blog posting&nbsp;<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/configuration-manager-blog/managing-remote-machines-with-cloud-management-gateway-in/ba-p/1233895\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Managing remote machines with cloud management gateway in Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager </A></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2 class=\"lia-align-center\"><STRONG>Background on how Office 365 Client works by default</STRONG></H2>\n<P>Office 365 ProPlus is designed by default to update from CDN.&nbsp; A scheduled task called “Office Automatic Updates 2.0” uses a trigger to routinely check for updates as advertised by DMS service.&nbsp; The Office client will always move to the latest version\\build available by assigned channel documented <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/officeupdates/update-history-office365-proplus-by-date\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.&nbsp; <SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">Documentation around what to expect from a user experience when updates are delivered from CDN can be found </SPAN><A style=\"background-color: transparent; box-sizing: border-box; color: #146cac; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: underline; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/end-user-update-notifications-for-office-365-proplus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here.</A><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">&nbsp; If ConfigMgr Office 365 Client Management integration is enabled by Configuration.xml during initial installation, ConfigMgr Client settings, or Domain Policy, the scheduled task will continue to execute but will only perform software updates from ConfigMgr.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2 class=\"lia-align-center\" style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: inherit; font-family: inherit; font-size: 24px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.2; margin-bottom: 12px; margin-top: 24px; orphans: 2; text-align: center; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\"><STRONG>Options available to update from CDN</STRONG></H2>\n<P><STRONG>Option 1: Cloud managed</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Steps:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Disable OfficeMgmtCOM (required if previously ConfigMgr managed)\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">On the next restart of Microsoft Office Click-to-Run Service, Office COM application will de-registered.&nbsp; </SPAN>Allows Office Client to do its thing and get updates from the CDN. &nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>This can be done by changing client settings in ConfigMgr or by Group Policy.</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI>Set UpdatesEnabled GPO to True (optional)\n<UL>\n<LI>Allows the client to resume normal update checks from the CDN</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI>UpdateDeadline GPO as an integer (optional) in days (ex. 12) to ensure the client is updated to ensure compliance.&nbsp; Using an integer value allows the admin to not have to continually change the date to a future date/time for every update.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Option 2: SCCM managed but offload content distribution</STRONG></P>\n<P>Use normal deploy software updates wizard within ConfigMgr console selecting deploy option. When completing deployment package screen, it is important to select option <STRONG>“No deployment package”</STRONG>. In this way, clients will download content directly from CDN but keep existing controls and user experience during software update workflow.</P>\n<P><STRONG>Steps:</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Deploy1.png\" style=\"width: 531px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179481iC9E166104E9ED1CD/image-dimensions/531x191?v=1.0\" width=\"531\" height=\"191\" title=\"Deploy1.png\" alt=\"Deploy1.png\" /></span></STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"NoDeployPackage.png\" style=\"width: 528px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179482i95D9423F81C68871/image-dimensions/528x468?v=1.0\" width=\"528\" height=\"468\" title=\"NoDeployPackage.png\" alt=\"NoDeployPackage.png\" /></span></STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>FAQ:</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>How can I verify ConfigMgr integration is disabled?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Start -&gt; Run -&gt;<FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">dcomcnfg</FONT>.exe and look for presence of OfficeC2Rcom application.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"COMEnabled.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179483iEBF62DA4616C55C3/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"COMEnabled.png\" alt=\"COMEnabled.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"COMDisabled.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179484iB58176B9F8DBBB08/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"COMDisabled.png\" alt=\"COMDisabled.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Where in the Office logs can I confirm Office updates are coming from CDN?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Use&nbsp;<A href=\"http://aka.ms/office365logcollector\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://aka.ms/office365logcollector</A> to collect Office logs or search for files in C:\\windows\\temp which have your NetBIOS name like&nbsp;<FONT face=\"SegoeUI,Lato,&quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">MININT-314VFT4-20200318-0857.log.&nbsp; (There will be a bunch of them).&nbsp; Use your favorite text editor to search for strings like 'officecdn.microsoft.com' or the build number you deployed.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT face=\"SegoeUI,Lato,&quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Starting with version 1902, <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/configmgr/core/servers/deploy/configure/boundary-groups#bkmk_bgoptions4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">'Prefer cloud based sources over on-premise sources'</A></FONT> allows IT Pro to prioritize Cloud content.&nbsp; Does this feature extend\\support Office 365 Client updates?</STRONG></P>\n<P><EM><STRONG><FONT color=\"#000000\"><U>**Updated 4/22/2020**&nbsp;</U></FONT></STRONG></EM></P>\n<P>The fix for has been&nbsp;<FONT face=\"SegoeUI,Lato,&quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">addressed with the MECM 2002 Upgrade ( Slow-Ring, Pre-check &amp; Download after 10 of April, MECM build 5.00.8969.1000).</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT face=\"SegoeUI,Lato,&quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Important: For early adopters upgrading to MECM 2002 in the Fast-Ring it wasn’t included ( MECM build 5.00.8968.1000) and must wait for next rollup to catch up.<BR /></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>[original statement below]</P>\n<P>No, this appears to be a bug which is under investigation.&nbsp; Workaround is to ensure Distribution Points used by VPN clients do not host Office 365 Client updates resulting in error 404.&nbsp; If the software deployment has selection&nbsp;<FONT face=\"SegoeUI,Lato,&quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">‘If software updates are not available on distribution point in current, neighbor or site boundary groups, download content from Microsoft Updates', this should allow new location of CDN fallback to be used.&nbsp; I will update this item with updates when available.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2 id=\"toc-hId-1941579500\" style=\"box-sizing: border-box; font-family: SegoeUI, Lato, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; line-height: 1.2; color: #333333; margin: 0px; font-size: 24px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;\"><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"box-sizing: border-box;\">The Authors</FONT></H2>\n<P style=\"box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px; font-family: SegoeUI, Lato, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #333333; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; brought to you by Dave Guenthner and Martin Nothnagel, two ProPlus Rangers at Microsoft.&nbsp; We’re looking forward to your questions and feedback in the comments most loved scanner app - Office Lens.</P>\n<P><EM>On Office Lens for Android, you are now </EM><EM>able to annotate photos with text of </EM><EM>different styles and colors</EM>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><VIDEO poster=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/Office%20Lens.png\" preload=\"none\" controls=\"controls\" </SOURCE></VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Want to add text highlight to a part of the document which needs attention? Want to add watermark of your brand text on the photo before sharing it? Want to add a caption that stays intact with the image wherever it goes and communicates your idea to your colleague? Tap on the ‘T’ icon and easily add text while on the go and in the moment – pick the style you prefer, and the color of your choice and you are good to go!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><U>Other updates</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In Android and iOS, we also have larger and improved previews of your scans in My Files. You can quickly find your scans by visually searching through them allowing for an easy recall experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Text annotations.png\" style=\"width: 355px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43472i85D76841AE0E00CA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Text annotations.png\" alt=\"Text annotations.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To get the latest Office Lens features, update your app now on <SPAN><A href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.office.officelens\" target=\"_blank\">Google Play</A></SPAN> or <SPAN><A href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/in/app/office-lens/id975925059?mt=8\" target=\"_blank\">App store</A></SPAN>. <SPAN>Do comment below and let us know how you would use these features in your daily lives.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 11 Dec 2018 17:33:09 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43472i85D76841AE0E00CA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"dc32557f7fc2d8a90a5c2047a55b3841","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn88@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-40-426_d2af0582733f83bd.webp","destWidth":355,"destHeight":733,"sourceBytes":141593,"destBytes":25732,"author":"Mitali Jain","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43472i85D76841AE0E00CA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn88@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-40-426_d2af0582733f83bd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639101},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Boost security of your remote workers with confidence using Security Policy Advisor","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/boost-security-of-your-remote-workers-with-confidence-using/ba-p/1552909","description":"<P>When it comes to securing the Microsoft 365 Apps using policies, IT Pros often face a challenge: You want to tighten security as much as possible to keep the bad guys out, but at the same time you do not want to impact your user’s productivity. And you would like to be able to evaluate the potential impact of a security config change before fully enforcing it. Sounds familiar? Then this blog post is for you!</P>\n<P><BR />This post will show you how to leverage the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/deployoffice/overview-of-security-policy-advisor\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Security Policy Advisor</A> (SPA) to identify slack in your security configuration, make changes to your policy settings and validate the new config first before enforcing them, reducing the risk to impact user productivity. The data-driven service allows you to make decisions based on facts like actual feature usage or if your users are already under attack by e.g. malicious Office documents being sent to them, rather than just guessing what the impact of a change might be.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Overview</H2>\n<P>With more people working from home, traditional security layers like working on a trusted network or trusted device are going away. It becomes more important to meet the user where they are and providing a secure setup without affecting their productivity. The Security Policy Advisor (SPA) is a service&nbsp;hosted in your tenant, so you can put it to work within minutes. No need for any on-prem infrastructure.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>SPA uses the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-office-cloud-policy-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office cloud policy service</A> (OCPS) to enforce security policies in the Office applications. Such policies are bound to the AzureAD user identity, independent from the actual device used or how this device is managed (if at all). When a user signs into an Office application using their work credentials, SPA and OCPS will ensure that the policies are applied, at home or at work, on corporate and personal devices.</P>\n<P><BR />SPA currently <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/deployoffice/overview-of-security-policy-advisor#how-security-policy-advisor-creates-recommendations\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">supports several security policies</A>, but in the following article we will focus on one policy which can drastically reduce your exposure to attacks targeting Office: <A href=\"https://getadmx.com/?Category=Office2016&amp;Policy=word16.Office.Microsoft.Policies.Windows::L_VBAWarningsPolicy&amp;Language=en-us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">VBA Macro Notification Settings</A>. If you are an Office Desktop Admin, it is likely that you have had to deal with this dilemma: Restrict macro execution to protect your users and enterprise from malware attacks like this <A href=\"https://www.zdnet.com/article/emotet-botnet-returns-after-a-five-month-absence/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">one</A> or leave it enabled so you don’t risk impacting users productivity? Sounds familiar? OK, let's look at an example on how you could tackle this challenge.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 1 – Review requirements and create policy configurations</H2>\n<P>There are only two requirements for using <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/deployoffice/overview-of-security-policy-advisor#requirements-for-using-security-policy-advisor\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Security Policy Advisor</A>:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Devices must run at least version 1908 of Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise.</LI>\n<LI>Apps must be allowed to send required service data for Office.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Use the Office cloud policy service (OCPS) to create a policy configuration. You are not required to configure any policies in this configuration to receive recommendations. Have a look at our <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-secure-your-remote-workers-with-office-cloud-policy/ba-p/1308579\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OCPS walkthrough guide</A>&nbsp;for further guidance on using OCPS.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 2 – Enable Security Policy Advisor</H2>\n<P>Next step is to enable SPA. Navigate to <A href=\"https://config.office.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">config.office.com</A>, sign in with Global Administrator, Security Administrator, or Office Apps Admin permissions and click on <STRONG>Security</STRONG>. Toggle the switch to <STRONG>On</STRONG>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA1a.png\" style=\"width: 718px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208757i1EC87A0F5DC4858A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA1a.png\" alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA1a.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>That’s it. If you have policy configurations created in OCPS, SPA will now start generating recommendations for those. This happens quickly, typically within minutes. You can also create a policy configuration from Security Policy Advisor using the <STRONG>Create a policy configuration</STRONG> button.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 3 – Review recommendations and tighten up security</H2>\n<P>Once Security Policy Advisor has finished analyzing data, it will inform you of new recommendations. You can click through the policies and see a full list of settings to consider:<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA5.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208758iD2DA45350915B941/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA5.PNG\" alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA5.PNG\" /></span><BR />For each policy you can review more details by clicking on it. It will give you more information on how many users have actually used the feature and for specific settings (macros) also data on any attacks through this vector targeted at users in the group. Here’s an example of how the data might look like for the VBA Macro Notification Settings policy recommendation.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA6.PNG\" style=\"width: 616px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208759i2EE3D890BB35CA01/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA6.PNG\" alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA6.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>So in this case, you can see that no user has actually opened Excel documents with macros (Total users), but all users have been targeted by malicious macros. So there is a big opportunity to boost security without impacting the user’s productivity. SPA provides you the information you need to justify this change and take it through a change management process.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>That’s one of two features which give you confidence when using SPA: You will get historical data based on the actual usage of the Office apps as well as any attacks detected by <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/office-365-atp?view=o365-worldwide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection</A> (ATP). No more guessing if a certain user group is actually using a feature and is at risk by not restricting it. You get actionable data and should act on it.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Perhaps you still have reservation acting on these recommendations and data. This is where the second feature comes in handy: You can set a policy, but allow the user to override it. The above example strongly suggests to disable VBA notifications as users are not using this feature and are under attack. But we might want to flight this new setting to users first and monitor impact.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>So in this example you would review the data for each of the VBA Notifications settings (there is one per application), accept the recommendation to disable VBA macros, but set <STRONG>Override</STRONG> to <STRONG>Enabled</STRONG>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA7.PNG\" style=\"width: 213px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208760iB75F9FA00C4751E9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA7.PNG\" alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA7.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>After clicking <STRONG>Apply</STRONG>, the new policy is set and will disable VBA macros for all targeted users. In case a user opens a document with macros embedded, a notification is shown that the VBA macro was disabled. In addition, the user is given an option to override this policy and still enable macros. When they do, this information is captured and surfaced back to you in the admin portal.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA11.PNG\" style=\"width: 903px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208761i8A809FE955A2C1BE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA11.PNG\" alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA11.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>This approach combines the power of having insights into historical data, but also safely try out a more restrictive security configuration.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 4 – Monitor productivity impact and adjust configuration</H2>\n<P>After a given time, e.g. two weeks, you can review how often users have actually used the option to override the setting. Log into the SPA UI, select the policy and switch to the <STRONG>Applied policies</STRONG> tab. Clicking on the individual setting will bring up the policy details and you can review how many users have overridden the setting.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA12a.png\" style=\"width: 378px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208774i4A1D52837E065110/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA12a.png\" alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA12a.png\" /></span><BR />In the above example, you could go forward with confidence and disable the override to boost overall app security. You first must <STRONG>roll back</STRONG> the policy, select the policy from the <STRONG>recommendations</STRONG> tab again and re-deploy with <STRONG>user override disabled</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In case users opted to override the setting, you might want to move these users to another Azure AD security group and targeted them with a less strict security configuration using OCPS.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 5 – Iterate</H2>\n<P>A common statement in IT security is “Security is not a one-time activity, it is a process” and this is also true when it comes to securing Office applications. After deploying the VBA notification setting, you should start looking at the other available policies like:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Block macros in Office files from the internet</LI>\n<LI>Disable All ActiveX</LI>\n<LI>Check ActiveX objects</LI>\n<LI>Blocking legacy file formats</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>We recommend that you first check if there are any recorded attack attempts for the <STRONG>Block macros in Office files from the internet</STRONG> settings. If yes, you might want to focus on these first to quickly reduce your attack surface. Then work your way through the list over time. This will boost your security stance step-by-step by removing any slack. Revisit the dashboard on a regular base to monitor impact and adjust policies where needed.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>By default, we will show recommendations with a low productivity impact first. You can switch the <STRONG>Show all recommendations</STRONG> toggle to get a full view:</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA13.png\" style=\"width: 977px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208763i2CF3E55176EBF464/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA13.png\" alt=\"Tighten_Security_w_SPA13.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>It is key to find the right balance between being restrictive and still allowing people to do their job. If security is too restrictive, users often start to work around these limitations and this might be a greater impact to your security posture then having a configuration which is not cranked up to the maximum.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>About the Authors</H2>\n<P>For this blog post the Microsoft 365 Apps Ranger Team at Microsoft partnered with the engineering team behind Security Policy Advisor. Feel free to share your questions in the comment section. For feedback on SPA, please use the feedback functionality in the <A href=\"https://config.office.com\" target=\"_self\">config.office.com</A> portal, it will get routed directly to the SPA team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>FAQ</H2>\n<P><STRONG>Q: SPA is not generating any recommendations, what could be wrong?</STRONG><BR />A: Double check if required diagnostic data is enabled in your environment and devices can upload the data to the required endpoints.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Q: Required diagnostic data is enabled, still nothing. What else could be the cause be?</STRONG><BR />A: SPA needs a certain share of users to report data back to generate recommendations per group. Double-check if most users in a targeted group are active Microsoft 365 Apps users and have diagnostic data enabled.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Jul 2020 12:15:38 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208757i1EC87A0F5DC4858A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"6c5021f6f2f5565e003881440f9f803d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn24@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-50-40-878_d4fadb2646b15d6b.webp","destWidth":718,"destHeight":249,"sourceBytes":19473,"destBytes":12756,"author":"Martin
