08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Part 4: Promote Microsoft 365 awareness and enable end users with training","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/part-4-promote-microsoft-365-awareness-and-enable-end-users-with/ba-p/123629","description":"<P><EM>This blog series is written by Cyril Belikoff, Senior Director of Office Marketing</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This is the fourth and final post from our blog series on&nbsp;the four success factors for driving Microsoft 365 adoption.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Four-Success-Factors-for-Driving-Microsoft-365-Adoption/bc-p/130559#M292\" target=\"_blank\">Part 1: Enable your business stakeholders with a successful Microsoft 365 adoption</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Part-2-Recruit-key-stakeholders-to-help-with-your-adoption/ba-p/123604/jump-to/first-unread-message\" target=\"_blank\">Part 2: Recruit key stakeholders to help with your adoption</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Part-3-Identify-business-needs-and-prioritize-Microsoft-365/ba-p/123620/\" target=\"_blank\">Part 3: Identify business needs and prioritize Microsoft 365 scenarios</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In this blog post I will focus on the last two success factors – Awareness and Training, outlining best practices and available resources.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Utilizing a combination of internal communication campaigns and training to promote awareness and ensure end user readiness is crucial in overcoming the typical apathy that awaits new technology rollouts. Awareness and training really do have a big impact. According to research, high usage Office 365 customers were more likely to have implemented awareness and training activities as part of their adoption plan when compared to customers with lower usage.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>Setting the stage for effective awareness and training</EM></P>\n<P>We are all too familiar with how hard it is to get people to change. Let’s face it, most people approach change from a selfish perspective. Therefore, it’s important your communication and training efforts are positioned in the context of what your end users care about most – what’s in it for them. Also, your training must go beyond the procedural “how-to” information for performing tasks with Microsoft 365. Let your end users know why the change is happening and what’s in it for them. An effective way of doing this is to tailor your communications and training around the scenarios you identified and prioritized earlier in your planning efforts. &nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Like any change, it’s important to reinforce it to ensure end users sustain their adoption of Microsoft 365 and the new culture of work it brings. Don’t think of your awareness and training execution as a one-time event, rather it should cover pre-launch, launch, and post-launch.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>Create internal awareness and excitement</EM></P>\n<P>To drive sustained adoption, users must be aware of and excited for Microsoft 365.&nbsp; This means doing internal communications to promote Office 365 and engagement events. Use the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/AwarenessTemplates\" target=\"_blank\">resources</A> we’ve made available, including email, poster, and tips and tricks templates you can customize for your rollout. Have a senior leader in the business be the face of your awareness campaign to validate the importance of the organization adopting Microsoft 365 and getting everyone onboard.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<DIV>\n<P>&nbsp;“We knew we had to be crystal clear with employees about how Office 365 would make their lives easier and help them do their jobs better. So, we branded it as four things: Work Anywhere, Work Anytime You Like, Work Together, and Work on Any Device.”</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: right;\"><STRONG><SPAN style=\"font-size: 10.0pt;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"text-align: right;\"><STRONG><SPAN style=\"font-size: 10.0pt;\">Joe Kamara </SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"text-align: right;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 10.0pt;\">Nec Group, Lead Change Manager</SPAN></P>\n</DIV>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>&nbsp;</EM></P>\n<P><EM>&nbsp;</EM></P>\n<P><EM>Enable end users to be successful with Microsoft 365 </EM></P>\n<P>Given the diversity of people in any organization you’ll likely have multiple audiences to serve with your training program. In preparing your plan it’s important to consider:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>What are the different user types in your organization? What is their comfort level with new technology?</LI>\n<LI>What is their role in the organization? What are some of the tasks they perform?</LI>\n<LI>Where do users perform these tasks? On a mobile device? In the office using a workstation?</LI>\n<LI>How might organizational policies be affected by the integration of the new tool set – e.g., sharing documents, storing files, collaborating with external partners, using email attachments?</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Training end users should take on multiple forms to accommodate different learning styles, geographical barriers, and any constraints you face. To get started with your training, take advantage of the available resources from Microsoft, including the <A href=\"https://support.office.com/office-training-center?wt.mc_id=AID573689_QSG_184686\" target=\"_blank\">Office Training Center</A> and <A href=\"https://aka.ms/win10quickstartguides\" target=\"_blank\">Windows 10 Quick Start Guides</A>. Use your <A href=\"https://fasttrack.microsoft.com/office/champion\" target=\"_blank\">champions</A> to help supplement your training plan, they are very effective at helping ready your end users.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>Next steps</EM></P>\n<P>Now that we’ve reviewed all four of the success factors for driving Microsoft 365 adoption – Stakeholders, Scenarios, Awareness and Training – your question may be what’s next? It’s time to start planning how you are going to ensure these success factors are in place for your adoption. I’d suggest getting your stakeholders and project team members onboard. Work with <A href=\"https://fasttrack.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft FastTrack</A>, our customer success service, and a Microsoft partner to build your Success Plan and get further guidance and resources to help you implement these four success factors.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Reach out to us and your peers who are also on this journey by checking out the <A href=\"http://aka.ms/driveadoption\" target=\"_blank\">Drive Adoption community</A>. We look forward to hearing about <STRONG><U>your</U></STRONG> Microsoft 365 success story!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 29 Nov 2017 17:09:43 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"dc348e86c13e946bf0a5d22c1afed9d5","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Cyril Belikoff","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639107},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Edit your content faster with OneNote","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/edit-your-content-faster-with-onenote/ba-p/493520","description":"<P>In April, we want to be short and sweet for our <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/onenote/9wzdncrfhvjl?activetab=pivot:overviewtab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneNote for Windows 10</A> users: you can now edit content more efficiently with the Mini toolbar that will provide contextually relevant formatting and editing tools. Read on to find out more about it!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Edit faster with the Mini toolbar</H1>\n<P>The new Mini toolbar in OneNote for Windows 10 helps you edit content faster while you’re working. Instead of having to pick out which tool you need in the ribbon at the top of your screen, you can now highlight the text or content you want to edit and choose a tool from the Mini toolbar that appears. The Mini toolbar contains contextually relevant tools, from font adjustments to text and table formatting, depending on what you’ve selected to edit. Click on the icon with three dots on the far right to expand the Mini toolbar and view more tools for editing your content. With this update, editing is faster with the relevant tools right at your finger (or mouse) tips.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Mini Toolbar.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/110861iA9FC1B9841113ABB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Mini Toolbar.gif\" alt=\"Mini Toolbar.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The Mini toolbar is currently rolling out to Insiders and will be generally available to all users in the coming weeks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We hope you enjoy this update on OneNote for Windows 10 and look forward to hearing your feedback. It is now possible to make the installation of a C2R product dependent on the previous presence of an MSI-based product. As it works for all products, it is especially helpful when deploying Project and/or Visio to users which had it previously. The feature is known as <STRONG>MSI Condition</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\" /><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">In order to use the new feature, the following prerequisites apply:</SPAN><BR style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\" /><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">• Office Deployment Tool </SPAN><STRONG style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: bold; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">16.0.11901.20022</STRONG><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\"> or newer</SPAN><BR style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\" /><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">• The feature is intended to be used when an Admin wants to migrate the user from Office/Project/Visio in one pass with one XML.</SPAN><BR style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\" /><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">• If you are not using the Office CDN as an installation source, make sure to have the matching source files in your specified source path.</SPAN><BR style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\" /><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">• MSI Condition will detect 2010/2013/2016 MSI products.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Scenario</STRONG><BR />Since the release of <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/upgrade-from-msi-version\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">RemoveMSI</A> we’ve had the capability for your “first install” to match the MSI version of Office and replace with Office 365 ProPlus. MSI Condition allows an admin to specify a list of MSI Product ID’s along with a <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/troubleshoot/administration/product-ids-supported-office-deployment-click-to-run\" target=\"_self\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Product ID</A> for a Click-to-Run install such as Subscription, Standard Perpetual and Professional Perpetual.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>How to use</STRONG><BR />To use this feature simply add the MSICondition attribute to the Product node as shown in the example below. Once you have created the XML run setup.exe /configure like you would with any other installation process and that’s it</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Benefit</STRONG><BR />In the past customers created very complex scripting to detect and replace Office products, in some cases running the install up to three times based on the number of previous products detected. We have even seen customers simply ignore Project and Visio and remove everything, then wait for helpdesk to get a call and replace it with the version the end user requested. MSI Condition makes your migration from MSI to C2R flow smoothly with one XML for your deployment which dynamically adjusts to the task at hand.</P>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorclipboard_image_0\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MSIcondition.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/126615i9E3B3B6DEFF52B1E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MSIcondition.jpg\" alt=\"MSIcondition.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\"><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">Please note that the above picture shows a simplified XML(in the image) to just show the concept behind it. For a fully working XML, please refer to the next section.</SPAN></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Sample XML</STRONG><BR />The following XML will <BR />• install Office 365 ProPlus from Monthly channel, and match the previously installed languages <BR />• install Visio Pro on machines that already have any older MSI version of Visio Pro<BR />• install Project Pro on machines that already have any older MSI version of Project Pro <BR />• remove all older MSI versions of Office, Project and Visio</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"markup\">&lt;Configuration&gt;\n\t&lt;Add Channel=\"Monthly\" OfficeClientEdition=\"64\"&gt;\n\n\t\t&lt;Product ID=\"O365ProPlusRetail\"&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"en-us\"/&gt;\n                        &lt;Language ID=\"MatchPreviousMSI\"/&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\"/&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"OneNote\"/&gt;\n\t&lt;/Product&gt;\n\n\t\t&lt;Product ID=\"VisioProRetail\" MSICondition=\"VisPro,VisProR\"&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"en-us\"/&gt;\n                        &lt;Language ID=\"MatchPreviousMSI\"/&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\"/&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/Product&gt;\n\n\t\t&lt;Product ID=\"ProjectProRetail\" MSICondition=\"PrjPro,PrjProR\"&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"en-us\"/&gt;\n                        &lt;Language ID=\"MatchPreviousMSI\"/&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\"/&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/Product&gt;\n\n\t&lt;/Add&gt;\n\t&lt;RemoveMSI/&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Is this limited to Visio and Project?</STRONG><BR />No, it is not. The feature will accept any valid product ID for Click-To-Run and any MSI code as a condition. So, you can mix and match to your specific needs you could also build a deployment which installs e.g. Access Runtime for existing users of it:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"markup\">&lt;Configuration&gt;\n\t&lt;Add&gt;\n\t\t&lt;Product ID=\"O365ProPlusRetail\"&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"en-us\"/&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"MatchPreviousMSI\"/&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Access\"/&gt;&lt;\n\t\t&lt;/Product&gt;\n\t\t&lt;Product ID=\"AccessRuntimeRetail\" MSICondition=\"AccessRT\"&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"en-us\"/&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"MatchPreviousMSI\"/&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/Product&gt;\n\t&lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>The Authors</STRONG><BR />This blog post is brought to you by&nbsp;<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/51895\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@Matt Philipenko (OFFICE PFE)</A>&nbsp; and <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/6347\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@Martin Nothnagel</A>&nbsp;, two senior ProPlus deployment experts at Microsoft from the Services organization. We’re looking forward to your questions, feedback and comments below.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 13 Aug 2019 14:16:53 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/126615i9E3B3B6DEFF52B1E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"0c70426637031cbe273cb2ad2401a13d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn94@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-50-40-095_b646894c152f2381.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":269,"sourceBytes":43165,"destBytes":34526,"author":"Matt Philipenko (PROPLUS-RANGER)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/126615i9E3B3B6DEFF52B1E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn94@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-50-40-095_b646894c152f2381.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639097},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Announcing intelligent event capabilities in Microsoft 365","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/announcing-intelligent-event-capabilities-in-microsoft-365/ba-p/214061","description":"<P>You can now produce live and on-demand events for teams and across the organization. Live events enable producers to curate and control the content that is broadcast to an audience. Attendees can participate in real time, with high-definition (HD) video and interactive discussion, or catch up later with powerful AI features that unlock the content of the event recording.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You can <STRONG>create a live event in Microsoft Stream, Microsoft Teams or Yammer</STRONG>—wherever your audience, team, or community resides. The event can be as simple or as sophisticated as you’d like. For casual presentations and panels, you can use <STRONG>webcams, content and screen sharing</STRONG>.&nbsp; For more formal events, you can <STRONG>stream a studio-quality production</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Attendees get <STRONG>event notifications</STRONG> and can join the event across devices, on mobile or web. While watching the live event, you can <STRONG>participate in discussion</STRONG> with other attendees and presenters and use to express yourself in the language of your choice. During the event, producers can monitor <STRONG>views and engagement</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>After the event, in the video on demand, with intelligent features including:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Speaker timeline</STRONG> uses facial detection to identify who is talking, so you can easily jump to a particular speaker in the recording.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Speech-to-text and closed captions </STRONG></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Transcript search and timecodes </STRONG>let you quickly find moments that matter in a video.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Live events, integrated with Microsoft 365, enable <STRONG>new scenarios for employee engagement and communications</STRONG>. For example, at the <SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/Employee-Engagement-Event-Resources\" target=\"_blank\">Employee Engagement Summit</A></SPAN><U>,</U> we shared how Microsoft<U> </U>uses technology to drive transformation at scale, by connecting employees worldwide with our leadership team, who conducts monthly company-wide “Q&amp;A” events, and fosters sustained engagement and dialogue in Yammer.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Live event capabilities will be <STRONG>available for preview beginning in the coming weeks</STRONG>. During the preview, these capabilities will be rolled out to Stream, Yammer, and Microsoft Teams, we will improve the richness and robustness of the capabilities based on customer feedback, towards general availability later this year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You can learn more about <A title=\"live events in Stream\" href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Stream-Blog/Microsoft-Stream-powers-live-events-and-brings-intelligent-video/ba-p/214672\" target=\"_blank\">live events in Stream</A>,&nbsp;<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Yammer-Blog/Announcing-intelligent-event-capabilities-for-Yammer-in-Office/ba-p/214532\" target=\"_blank\">live events in Yammer</A>, and <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Live-events-in-Microsoft-Teams/ba-p/214955\" target=\"_blank\">live events in Teams</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This video gives you a technical overview of live events and other recent innovations in Stream.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;<LI-VIDEO height=\"113\" width=\"200\" align=\"center\" size=\"small\" vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XWvnKmQPw8g&amp;feature=youtu.be\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XWvnKmQPw8g/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 12 Jul 2018 20:48:09 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"c54cadb5f210b1c9facc991ec7f84787","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Dan Holme","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639103},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"How to Optimize Stream & Live Events traffic in a VPN scenario","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-optimize-stream-amp-live-events-traffic-in-a-vpn-scenario/ba-p/1439767","description":"<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">During this current COVID-19 crisis, many organizations have had to rapidly implement a work-from-home model for the majority of their users. For many, this means an enormous increase in load to the VPN infrastructure as all traffic is traditionally sent via this path that was invariably not designed for the volume or type of traffic now reliant on it.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">To improve performance, and also reduce load on the VPN infrastructure, many customers have achieved significant results by following the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/office-365-vpn-implement-split-tunnel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft guidance to implement split tunneling</A>&nbsp;(or forced tunnel exceptions to use the correct technical term) on the Optimize-marked Office 365 endpoints. This traffic is high-volume and latency-sensitive traffic, and thus sending it directly to the service solves the problems outlined above and is also the designed best practice for these endpoints.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 Live Events (Teams-produced live events and those produced with an external encoder via Teams, Stream, and Yammer) and on-demand Stream traffic are not currently listed within the Optimize category with the endpoints listed in the ‘Default’ category in the Office 365 URL/IP service. The endpoints are located in this category as they are hosted on CDNs that may also be used by other services, and as such customers generally prefer to proxy this type of traffic and apply any security elements normally done on diverse endpoints such as these.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">In most organizations the traffic is internally routed via a network path that is designed to cope with the load and provide latency at a level that doesn’t impact service quality. With the switch to large scale remote working, many customers have asked for the information required to connect their users to Stream/Live Events directly from their local internet connection, rather than route the high-volume and latency-sensitive traffic via an overloaded VPN infrastructure. Typically, this is not possible without both dedicated namespaces and accurate IP information for the endpoints, which is not provided for the Default marked Office 365 endpoints.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">Microsoft is working to provide more-defined and service-specific URL/IP data to help simplify connectivity to the service for the VPN connection model but as you can imagine for a global SaaS service like Office 365, this is not something which can be achieved overnight. Therefore, in the interim we've been working on interim methods to meet customer demand for this information. As a result of some changes we were able to perform relatively quickly, we are able to provide the following steps to allow for direct connectivity for the service from a client using a forced tunnel VPN.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">This is slightly more complex than normal to implement (requiring an extra function in the PAC file) but should provide a solution to this challenge until such time as we can rearchitect the endpoints so as to simplify connectivity requirements.&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">Please note, there may be service elements which don't resolve to the IP addresses provided and thus traverse the VPN, but the bulk of high volume traffic (eg streaming data) should do. There also may be other service elements outside the scope of Live Events/Stream such as PowerApps which get caught by this offload but these should be rare as they have to meet both the FQDN <EM>and</EM> the IP match before going direct.&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">As noted, this is intended to be a temporary solution to provide customers some level of relief to use at their discretion whilst we work through engineering changes to simplify and scope this traffic optimization.&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">To implement the Forced tunnel exception for Teams Live Events and Stream, the following steps should be applied:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><U>1. External DNS resolution.</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">The client needs external, recursive DNS resolution to be available for the following FQDNs so they can resolve host names to IPs.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>*.streaming.mediaservices.windows.net</LI>\n<LI>*.azureedge.net</LI>\n<LI>*.media.azure.net</LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">It is important to note, it is not advised to just use these URLs to configure VPN offload even if technically possible in your VPN solution (eg if it works at the FQDN rather than IP). This is due to the fact some of these endpoints are shared with other elements outside of Stream/Live Events and as such the IPs provided below are not comprehensive for that FQDN, but are for Teams Live Events/Stream. (Note FQDNs are not required in the VPN configuration, they are purely for use in PAC files in combination with the IPs to send the relevant traffic direct).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><U>2. PAC file changes (Where required)</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">In most organizations, a PAC file will be used in a VPN scenario to configure the client to send traffic either direct, or via the internal proxy server. Normally this is achieved using FQDNs. However, with Stream/Live Events, the namespace provided currently includes wildcards such as *.azureedge.net, which also encompasses other elements for which it is not possible to provide full IP listings. Thus, if the wildcard is sent direct, traffic to these endpoints will be blocked as there is no route via the direct path for it in step 3.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">To solve this, we’re able to provide the following IPs and use them in combination with the FQDNs in section 1 for Stream/Live Events in an example PAC file. The PAC file checks if the URL matches those used for Stream/Live Events and then if it does, it then also checks to see if the IP returned from a DNS lookup matches those provided for the service. If <EM><STRONG>both</STRONG> </EM>match, then the traffic is routed direct. If either element (FQDN/IP) doesn’t match then the traffic is sent to the proxy. This way we ensure anything which resolves to an IP outside of the scope of Stream/Live Events will traverse the proxy via the VPN as normal.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>Table 1: IP addresses for Live Events &amp; Stream</STRONG></U></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<TABLE>\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P>IPv4</P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P>IPv6</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P>72.21.81.200</P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P>2606:2800:011F:17A5:191A:18D5:0537:22F9</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P>152.199.19.161</P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P>2606:2800:133:206E:1315:22A5:2006:24FD</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P>117.18.232.200</P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P>2606:2800:0147:120F:030C:1BA0:0FC6:265A</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P>192.16.48.200</P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P>2606:2800:0157:1508:1539:0174:1A75:1191</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P>93.184.215.201</P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P>2606:2800:11F:7DE:D31:7DB:168F:1225</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P>68.232.34.200</P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P>2606:2800:133:F17:19E8:2356:251B:02A9</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>\n<P>192.229.232.200</P>\n</TD>\n<TD>\n<P>2606:2800:0147:0FF8:129B:22EB:020B:1347</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">To implement this in a PAC file you can use the following example which sends the Office 365 Optimize traffic direct (which is recommended best practice) via FQDN, and the critical Stream/Live Events traffic direct via a combination of the FQDN and also the returned IP address. <EM>Contoso </EM>would need to be edited to your specific tenant name where <EM>contoso</EM> is from contoso.onmicrosoft.com</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>Example PAC file</STRONG></U></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">function FindProxyForURL(url, host)</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">{</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; var direct = \"DIRECT\";</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; var proxyServer = \"PROXY 10.1.2.3:8081\";</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp; //Office 365 Optimize endpoints direct</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp; if(shExpMatch(host, \"outlook.office.com\")</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp; || shExpMatch(host, \"outlook.office365.com\")</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp; || shExpMatch(host, \"contoso.sharepoint.com\")</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp; || shExpMatch(host, \"contoso-my.sharepoint.com\"))</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">{</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp; return direct;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">}</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;/* Don't proxy Stream/Live Events traffic*/</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;if(shExpMatch(host, \"*.streaming.mediaservices.windows.net\")</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;|| shExpMatch(host, \"*.azureedge.net\")</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;|| shExpMatch(host, \"*.media.azure.net\"))</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">{</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;var resolved_ip = dnsResolve(host);</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">if (isInNet(resolved_ip, '72.21.81.200', '255.255.255.255') ||</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">isInNet(resolved_ip, '152.199.19.161', '255.255.255.255') ||</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">isInNet(resolved_ip, '117.18.232.200', '255.255.255.255') ||</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">isInNet(resolved_ip, '192.16.48.200', '255.255.255.255') ||</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">isInNet(resolved_ip, '93.184.215.201', '255.255.255.255') ||</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">isInNet(resolved_ip, '68.232.34.200', '255.255.255.255') ||</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">isInNet(resolved_ip, '192.229.232.200', '255.255.255.255'))</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">{</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;return direct;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">}</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">}</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">// Default Traffic Forwarding.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">return proxyServer;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">}</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>It’s worth stressing again, it is not advised to attempt to perform the VPN offload using just the FQDNs, utilizing both the FQDNs and the IPs in the function helps scope the use of this offload to just Stream/Live Events. The way the function is structured means that only if the FQDN matches those listed, do we perform a DNS lookup for it i.e DNS does not have to be performed for all namespaces used by the client.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><U>3. Configure routing on the VPN to enable direct egress </U></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The final element is to add a direct route for the Live Event IPs in Table 1 into the VPN configuration to ensure the traffic is not sent via the forced tunnel into the VPN. Detailed information on how to do this for the Office 365 Optimize endpoints can be <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/office-365-vpn-implement-split-tunnel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">found in this article</A><SPAN>,</SPAN> and the process is exactly the same for the Stream/Live Events IPs listed in this document. Note only the IPs (not FQDNs) published above should be used for VPN configuration.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><U>FAQ:</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Question:&nbsp; Will this send all my traffic for the service direct?</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Answer</STRONG>:&nbsp; &nbsp; No, this will send the latency-sensitive streaming traffic for a Live Event or Stream video direct, any other traffic will continue to use the VPN tunnel if they do not resolve to the IPs published.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Question:&nbsp; Do I need to use the IPv6 Addresses? </STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Answer</STRONG>:&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;No, the connectivity can be IPv4 only if required.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Question:&nbsp; Why are these IPs not published in the Office 365 URL/IP service?</STRONG></P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\"><STRONG>Answer</STRONG>:&nbsp; &nbsp; Microsoft has strict controls around the format and type of information that is in the service to ensure customers can reliably use the information to implement secure and optimal routing based on endpoint category.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The default endpoint category has no IP information provided for numerous reasons, such as it being outside of the control of Microsoft, is too large, or changes too frequently, or is in blocks shared with other elements. For this reason Default marked endpoints are designed to be sent via FQDN to an inspecting proxy, like normal web traffic.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In this case, the above endpoints are CDNs that may be used by other elements other than Live Events or Stream, and thus sending the traffic direct will also mean anything else which resolves to these IPs will also be sent direct from the client. Due to the unique nature of the current global crisis and to meet the short-term needs of our customers, Microsoft has provided the information above for customers to use as they see fit.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft is working to reconfigure the Live Events endpoints to allow them to be included in the Allow/Optimize endpoint categories at a later date.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Question:&nbsp; &nbsp;Do I only need to allow access to these IPs?&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Answer</STRONG>:&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;No, access to all of the ‘Required’ marked endpoints in <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/office365/enterprise/urls-and-ip-address-ranges?redirectSourcePath=%252farticle%252fOffice-365-URLs-and-IP-address-ranges-8548a211-3fe7-47cb-abb1-355ea5aa88a2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the URL/IP service</A> is essential for the service to operate. In addition, any Optional endpoint marked for Stream (ID 41-45)&nbsp;are&nbsp;required.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Question:&nbsp; &nbsp;What scenarios will this advice cover?</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Answer:&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>1. Live events produced within the Teams App</P>\n<P>2. Viewing Stream hosted content</P>\n<P>3. External device (encoder) produced events</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Question:&nbsp; &nbsp;Does this advice cover presenter traffic</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Answer:&nbsp;</STRONG> It does not, the advice above is purely for those consuming the service. Presenting from within Teams will see the presenter's traffic flowing to the Optimize marked UDP endpoints listed in URL/IP service row 11 with detailed VPN offload advice outlined <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/office-365-vpn-implement-split-tunnel\" target=\"_self\">here</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 11 Jun 2020 14:59:21 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"618338d3037abe8ec3abead945a02c08","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Paul Collinge","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639089},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Part 3: Identify business needs and prioritize Microsoft 365 scenarios","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/part-3-identify-business-needs-and-prioritize-microsoft-365/ba-p/123620","description":"<P><EM>This blog series is written by Cyril Belikoff, Senior Director of Office Marketing</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This is the third post from our blog series on the four success factors for driving Microsoft 365 adoption. <BR /> <BR />Check out the other posts part of this series:</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Four-Success-Factors-for-Driving-Microsoft-365-Adoption/ba-p/125098\" target=\"_blank\">Part 1: Enable your business stakeholders with a successful Microsoft 365 adoption</A><BR /><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Part-2-Recruit-key-stakeholders-to-help-with-your-adoption/ba-p/123604\" target=\"_blank\">Part 2: Recruit key stakeholders to help with your adoption</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In this blog post I will focus on the second success factor – Scenarios, and how to identify and prioritize them, while measuring their impact on your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The true measure of success for your Microsoft 365 adoption, like any change or new technology, will be the value realized by your organization from its investment. Your opportunity with Microsoft 365 is to enable the different Lines of Business (LoBs) and departments in your organization to realize important business outcomes. This requires identifying and prioritizing scenarios – which are the different ways people and teams in your organization can use the capabilities of Microsoft 365 to achieve their goals.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>Get started with early wins and build on that success </EM></P>\n<P><BR />Our most successful customers typically start their journey with more <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-US/microsoft-365/success/productivitylibrary?Products=Office%20365%20Basics\" target=\"_blank\">basic scenarios</A> that have universal appeal across the organization:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Employee Engagement &amp; Communication:</STRONG> Create a sustainable, consistent way for senior leaders to connect with employees, using Yammer as a community to share and engage, and Skype Meeting Broadcast for companywide meetings.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Bring Campaigns to Market Faster:</STRONG> Enable marketers to collaborate with people inside and outside the organization using Microsoft Teams as their shared workspace for communicating and sharing with team members.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Increase Sales Productivity and Grow Revenue:</STRONG> Provide sales teams with a centralized hub with Microsoft Teams for sales planning, real time collaboration on proposals and RFPs, and for managing their monthly, quarterly, and annual business reviews.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Streamline Business Reviews:</STRONG> Help finance move beyond gathering and cleaning data to be able to analyze data with Power BI, and collaborate together on the data in one place with Microsoft Teams.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Once you’ve delivered value with these more basic scenarios, you have more credibility to engage your business stakeholders for custom scenarios that deliver unique value. Think of this value realization motion as a flywheel – score some early wins with cross organization scenarios, and then move on to more ambitious areas of impact for each LoB or department. As you provide more and more impact to the business, more stakeholders will get engaged and the momentum of the flywheel builds and builds.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>So, how can you work with your business stakeholders to identify relevant scenarios for their teams to adopt? At it’s most basic level it’s about identifying what the team wants to accomplish, how they can use the technology to accomplish their goal, and what the expected impact of the Scenario is. To help you get started, check out the Microsoft 365 productivity library, where you can discover new scenarios based on your industry and different functional departments.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The IT team leading the Microsoft 365 adoption at Standard Bank - Africa’s largest banking group, has done a great job engaging with the business to identify scenarios that are helping different stakeholders accomplish their goals. Standard Bank dedicated an adoption team within IT to engage with each business unit and functional department to realize unique value with Microsoft 365 in a consistent manner – i) conduct an “art of the possible” session with the team so they can start to envision relevant Microsoft 365 scenarios, ii) workshop scenarios by mapping Microsoft 365 capabilities to the team’s challenges and goals, iii) prototyping and implementing prioritized scenarios, and iv) enabling the business unit to be self-sustainable in their adoption of scenarios and evolving the solutions to suit their needs.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>“You don’t need a large team and budget to get going. Dedicate some resources who are passionate about improving the business, who can get in where the work is happening and can assist business users in making the bridge between their day to day challenges and friction points, and the enabling technology that comes with Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>A great resource to help with this is the Microsoft 365 Productivity Library, we’ve used it to help our business discover scenarios and use cases that are relevant to them. Once they see that they can bring different components of the suite together to respond to different needs, they get it.”</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Ian Doyle</STRONG><BR /><EM>Standard Bank, IT Executive</EM></P>\n<P><BR />To avoid overwhelming end users with too many scenarios at the same time it’s important to prioritize your scenarios based on expected impact and difficulty of implementing. This prioritized list will determine what scenarios get rolled out when.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>Measure and share success</EM></P>\n<P><BR />To <A href=\"https://view.officeapps.live.com/op/view.aspx?src=https://fto365dev.blob.core.windows.net/media/Default/DocResources/en-us/Adoption/Measuring_Success_Guide.pptx\" target=\"_blank\">measure the success </A>of your Microsoft 365 rollout, it’s critical to develop a set of criteria to evaluate the different scenarios you and your team have implemented. Identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that you expect will improve based on adopting your scenarios. Evaluate where you are before implementing Microsoft 365 and measure your ongoing progress post implementation. While it’s important to measure and showcase the business value you are providing the organization with your Microsoft 365 implementation, monitoring and reporting on usage helps demonstrate overall adoption levels and areas where improvement is required. The <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Office-365-Adoption-Content-Pack-77ff780d-ab19-4553-adea-09cb65ad0f1f\" target=\"_blank\">Office 365 adoption content pack</A> is available to gain insights on how your organization is adopting the various services within Office 365.</P>\n<P>Success stories are often just as valuable as quantitative measures when demonstrating Microsoft 365 success. Encourage your project team members and champions to identify examples of people and teams using Microsoft 365 to accomplish their goals and everyday tasks. Make sure you share these success stories through Yammer or other internal channels.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Now that you have identified and prioritized your scenarios, it’s time to create internal excitement about the scenarios and ready end users to successfully adopt them. Stay tuned for the next blog post where I will cover the final two success factors for driving Microsoft 365 adoption – Awareness and Training.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 21 Nov 2017 17:53:14 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"8ee8015d78cfecc18c21dbde7de46884","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Cyril Belikoff","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639107},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Office 365 Client Licensing and Activation Improvements","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/office-365-client-licensing-and-activation-improvements/ba-p/763694","description":"<P>Edit: July 30, Availability dates updated to reflect schedule.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Over the years, we’ve heard feedback from customers and IT Admins about the difficulty in managing Office activation for subscription-based Office clients, such as Office 365 ProPlus. We’re excited to announce&nbsp;upcoming changes to Office that will help simplify activation management and streamline the Office activation experience for users.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In August, we’ll start slowly rolling out these changes to commercial customers on Monthly Channel. The roll-out will continue to Semi-Annual Channel (Targeted) in January 2020.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For your users, here’s what stays the same:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Sign in to activate Office</STRONG>: Users will continue to sign in to activate Office on their devices. When single sign-on is enabled, Office detects the user’s credentials and activates Office automatically.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Sign-in limits</STRONG>: Users can sign in to activate Office on five desktops, five tablets, and five mobile devices.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Here are the changes that your users may notice:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>No more prompts to deactivate</STRONG>: Users can install Office on a new device without being prompted to deactivate Office on another device.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Automatic sign out</STRONG>: When a user reaches the sign-in limit, instead of being prompted to deactivate, the user will be automatically signed out of Office on the device where Office has been least recently used. The next time the user starts Office on that device, the user will be prompted to sign in to activate Office.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Here are the changes that you as an admin may notice when managing devices where Office is installed:<BR /><BR /></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Improved device reallocation: </STRONG>Previously, users who received reallocated devices could receive an error if the previous user deactivated the device from the portal or if you removed the Office 365 license from the previous user. Going forward, users will not receive the error because the activation and deactivation is user specific.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Improved activation reporting:</STRONG> Previously, when one user activated Office on a device and a second user later signed on to that device, the second activation was not displayed in the Admin Center’s Activation Reports. Going forward, both activations will be identified and displayed in the Activation Report.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P>Keep an eye out for these improvements as we start to slowly roll them out for our commercial customers. <SPAN>No additional action is required on your part.</SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 31 Jul 2019 20:10:30 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"dcb2844473578b9d6a19f57be9945c54","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Shubham Gupta (LICENSING)","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639107},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Whiteboard in Teams meetings integration, ink grab and ink beautification are here!","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/whiteboard-in-teams-meetings-integration-ink-grab-and-ink/ba-p/376979","description":"<P><STRONG>Microsoft Whiteboard</STRONG> continues to evolve rapidly. This month we are introducing Whiteboard integration into Teams meetings and two intelligent inking features. Whether you choose to participate from the meeting room or remotely, <A href=\"http://msft.social/Yhebx4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Microsoft Whiteboard in Teams Meetings</STRONG></A> (commercial preview) empowers meeting attendees from the same tenant to participate in the conversation, regardless of the device used. For quick and easy collaboration, the board is automatically shared with all meeting attendees. To enable Whiteboard in a Teams meeting, please turn on the Whiteboard web preview <A href=\"https://aka.ms/whiteboard-in-teams-meetings-faq\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>here</STRONG></A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"104115_WHITEBOARD_IN_TEAMS_V07.gif\" style=\"width: 704px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100338i6FDB2284F9F6078E/image-dimensions/704x485?v=1.0\" width=\"704\" height=\"485\" title=\"104115_WHITEBOARD_IN_TEAMS_V07.gif\" alt=\"104115_WHITEBOARD_IN_TEAMS_V07.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Ink grab</STRONG>, enables you to take a picture of your notes scribbled on a physical whiteboard and convert them into digital ink on the Whiteboard App. You don’t have to recreate your board from scratch and all of the information is captured. If you start an ad-hoc brainstorm session on the physical whiteboard, you can easily continue on the digital whiteboard and include remote collaborators in the conversation. Simply take a picture of the content and use ink grab to transform them into digital ink.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Bad handwriting? Don’t worry! <STRONG>Ink beautification</STRONG> increases the readability of quickly-jotted notes in the Whiteboard canvas, which analyzes handwriting and automatically replaces it with more legible strokes. &nbsp;&nbsp;This feature increases collaboration, learning and ideation by addressing common reasons users tell us they find it difficult to use pen or ink.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"109995_INK_BEAUTIFICATION_FOR_WHITEBOARD_V03.gif\" style=\"width: 706px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100339i563D2C41B99F2000/image-dimensions/706x488?v=1.0\" width=\"706\" height=\"488\" title=\"109995_INK_BEAUTIFICATION_FOR_WHITEBOARD_V03.gif\" alt=\"109995_INK_BEAUTIFICATION_FOR_WHITEBOARD_V03.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Together, these intelligent inking features reduce the friction associated with collaboration.&nbsp;With the magic wand, your collaborators will be able to easily collaborate with you on your inking creations.&nbsp; Ink grab and ink beautification are available in Win10 app, and ink beautification will roll out in the next iOS app update.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Provide your team with an infinite digital canvas by downloading <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-whiteboard/digital-whiteboard-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Microsoft Whiteboard</STRONG></A> today.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 28 Mar 2019 19:00:00 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100338i6FDB2284F9F6078E/image-dimensions/704x485?v=1.0","linkMd5":"0ef68f47902a97ba50e02c9bc6182c17","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-45-112_23793172da9ef466.webp","destWidth":703,"destHeight":485,"sourceBytes":386019,"destBytes":146404,"author":"Itai Almog","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100338i6FDB2284F9F6078E/image-dimensions/704x485?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-45-112_23793172da9ef466.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100339i563D2C41B99F2000/image-dimensions/706x488?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn8@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-46-576_940e8c1eb2341c1f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639100},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Understanding Office 365 ProPlus Updates for IT Pros (CDN vs SCCM)","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/understanding-office-365-proplus-updates-for-it-pros-cdn-vs-sccm/ba-p/795728","description":"<P>In supporting customers in the field, we receive many questions about Office 365 ProPlus update process. The objective of this blog is to provide context around end user behavior during update scenario and clarify when and how Office updates are applied.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Office ProPlus was designed to be a cloud first product…. What does that mean?&nbsp; It means that by default, Microsoft recommends you update Office 365 ProPlus directly from Microsoft Content Delivery Network (CDN).&nbsp; While IT Pros are always in control,&nbsp; Office 365 ProPlus is automatically kept up-to-date via evergreen model.&nbsp; IT Pros can offload servicing aspect of Office 365 ProPlus to Microsoft so they can focus on other duties removing repetitive tasks.&nbsp; At present, while we lead with CDN as our recommendation, the vast majority of Enterprise customers I work with prefer to manage updates from System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) for a variety of reasons. (too many to list here such as network, governing process or political etc.)</P>\n<P>Let’s compare and contrast both scenarios below to see which approach is best to address your business requirements.&nbsp; Regardless, the goal is to ensure Office 365 ProPlus is serviced <U>every month</U> to address security and deliver features based on cadence suitable for our customers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Quick refresher of Office ProPlus channel cadence -<EM>Simplified&nbsp;</EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Current Channel:</STRONG> Provide users with the newest features of Office as soon as they're available.&nbsp; This could be three or four builds per Month. (Updates should be delivered by CDN)</P>\n<P><STRONG>Monthly Enterprise Channel:&nbsp;</STRONG><SPAN>Provide your users with new Office features only once a month and on a predictable schedule. (Updates can be delivered by CDN or ConfigMgr)</SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG>Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview): </STRONG>Provide pilot users and application compatibility testers the opportunity to test the next Semi-Annual Channel.&nbsp; Features\\fixes delivered every six months, in March and September</P>\n<P><STRONG>Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel: </STRONG>Provide users with new features of Office only a few times a year. Features\\fixes delivered every six months, in January and July <SPAN>(Updates can be delivered by CDN or ConfigMgr)</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><EM>(Official Link is here&nbsp;<A title=\"Overview of update channels\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-of-update-channels-for-office-365-proplus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Overview of update channels</A>)</EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The point of the channels is to define the timing when those cumulative builds include features and fixes in addition to security. If you would like more information about channel management please see my other posting for more information called <A title=\"How to manage Office 365 ProPlus Channels for IT Pros\" href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-ProPlus/How-to-manage-Office-365-ProPlus-Channels-for-IT-Pros/m-p/775602#M716\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">How to manage Office 365 ProPlus Channels for IT Pros</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>*This blog will focus primarily on update process.&nbsp; Deployment of Office 365 ProPlus is out of scope and will assume Office 365 ProPlus is already installed on the machine.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Update from CDN</H2>\n<P>Prerequisites</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Automatic Updates is by default Enabled (equivalent GPO is “Enabled Automatic Updates”). If disabled, Office 365 ProPlus will <U>never update</U>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<H2>Benefits</H2>\n<UL>\n<LI>Admins don’t have to spend time developing processes to duplicate CDN content on-premises.</LI>\n<LI>Admins don’t have to build processes to target software updates to collections. Each machine will pull updates on it’s own.</LI>\n<LI>Aligns with “Modern Desktop” motion where machines are increasingly managed by Mobile device management (MDM) rather than on-premises solutions without requirement for any infrastructure.</LI>\n<LI>CDN supports a variety of advanced policies to control updates at granular level such as “delay downloading and installing updates for Office”, “prioritize BITS”, “Target Version”, “Update Channel”, “Update Deadline”. IT Pros can control updates effectively without the need for on-premises software.</LI>\n<LI>Leverages inbox task scheduler \\Microsoft\\Office\\Office Automatic Updates 2.0 to perform updates based on trigger mechanism (Weekly, At log on, On idle)</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Note: <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/taskschd/task-idle-conditions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">On idle</A> is very interesting trigger condition in that it can check for criteria such as user absence and lack of resource consumption to determine opportunistic time to retry updates (no reboots required when Office applications are closed).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Reference Links for next section: <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/officeupdates/update-history-office365-proplus-by-date\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Update history for Office 365 ProPlus (listed by date)</A> and <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/officeupdates/download-sizes-office365-proplus-updates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Download sizes for updates to Office 365 ProPlus</A></P>\n<H2>&nbsp;</H2>\n<H2>User Experience when updating from CDN</H2>\n<P>Let’s imagine Office 365 ProPlus has June 2019 build installed which is Version 1808 (Build 10730.20348).&nbsp; “Patch Tuesday” rolls around and on July 9<SUP>th</SUP>&nbsp;2019 July build is released which is Version 1902 (Build 11328.20368).&nbsp; Based on the trigger assigned the scheduled task “Office Automatic Updates 2.0” will detect a newer build applicable.&nbsp; Upon initial release to CDN, a new build is temporary throttled until signals are received ensuring highest quality release have been verified.&nbsp; As a result, IT Pros may observe updates may not occur on Day 0 to all machines but rather over a period of days.&nbsp; Alternatively, IT Pros can intervene and enable policy “delay downloading and installing updates for Office” and simply define installing update based on number of days. (*GPO is still subject to throttle)&nbsp; This mirrors servicing plans feature in SCCM for delivering Windows Feature Updates and makes it easy to build rings as long as the delay defined isn't shorter than throttle.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Since the build installed is most recent version we can leverage a feature called binary delta compression to help reduce the size of the files further.&nbsp; Therefore, keeping Office ProPlus up-to-date is friendlier on network.&nbsp; Office will download deltas and will stage in C:\\Program Files\\Microsoft Office\\Updates\\Download.&nbsp; After download Office Automatic Updates 2.0 will attempt to update Office 365 ProPlus.&nbsp; If no Office applications are open, it will update.&nbsp; If Office applications were open at the time of update request a series of notifications will occur of period of days. (<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/end-user-update-notifications-for-office-365-proplus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Officially documented here</A>)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We receive frequent questions around deadlines and delivery of end user notifications.&nbsp; While the CDN only experience doesn't include Configuration Manager, the dialogs from Office overlap with Configuration Manager scenario 2 below.&nbsp; Therefore, examples of the Office notifications (the white dialogs which say \"Office will update in X minutes\" can be found below in a single place of reference.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>When Office stages a build for installation, in app notifications within Office will occur in the following manner:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Without OfficeMgmtCom enabled (CDN):<BR />Business bar shown after 6 days&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>With OfficeMgmtCom enabled (ConfigMgr):<BR />If update not applied, display business bar immediately upon next launch of Office app.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>*Business bar is defined as the yellow in app notification which says \"Update now\".&nbsp; See picture below in scenario 2.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Notifications and Countdown Dialogs</STRONG></P>\n<P>Toast notifications (system tray \"Office Updates Available\") delivered by Office and their potential timing</P>\n<P>24hrs<BR />12hrs<BR />6hr<BR />2hr<BR />30mins</P>\n<P>Countdown dialogs (Office delivered white countdown dialogs )</P>\n<P>30mins + postpone (2hrs)<BR />30mins + postpone (2hrs)<BR />30mins + enforced</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>User Experience when updating from SCCM</H2>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Prerequisites</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>SCCM Current Branch with Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) 4.0, you can't use WSUS by itself to deploy these updates. You need to use WSUS in conjunction with Configuration Manager</LI>\n<LI>The hierarchy's top level WSUS server and the top level Configuration Manager site server must have access to the following URLs: *.microsoft.com, *.msocdn.com, *.office.com, *.office.net, *.onmicrosoft.com, officecdn.microsoft.com, officecdn.microsoft.com.edgesuite.net.</LI>\n<LI>Office 365 Client product must be selected from products tab under Software Update Point Component Properties and synchronize software updates after change. Once complete, you should see Office 365 Client Updates populate the Office 365 Updates node under Office 365 Client Management within Software Library tab in SCCM Console.</LI>\n<LI>Office 365 Client Management must be enabled on the client. This can be configured in multiple ways such as adding OfficeMgmtCOM=\"TRUE\" in configuration.xml during installation, enable domain policy “Office 365 Client Management” and finally by toggling “Enable management of the Office 365 Client Agent” to Yes from within SCCM Client settings under Software Updates.&nbsp; You can verify by launching dcomcnfg.exe on the client computer and confirming OfficeC2RCom application is registered.&nbsp; <STRONG><EM>Only one is required</EM></STRONG>, where policy overrides and take priority over all other methods.&nbsp; The purpose of the COM application is to allow Office 365 ProPlus to interop with SCCM to pull updates from distribution points rather than CDN</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OfficeC2R.png\" style=\"width: 369px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124721i6413001CE283992D/image-dimensions/369x131?v=1.0\" width=\"369\" height=\"131\" title=\"OfficeC2R.png\" alt=\"Example of running dcomcnfg.exe\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Example of running dcomcnfg.exe</span></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-left\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 76px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124729iDAD8474C191EB30C/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"Note about PREVIEW feature using Delivery Optimization for Office 365 ProPlus install\\updates\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Note about PREVIEW feature using Delivery Optimization for Office 365 ProPlus install\\updates</span></span></P>\n<P>Overwhelming majority of enterprise customers use SCCM to deliver Office 365 Client updates for compliance and distribute content from Distribution Points.&nbsp; Microsoft is always working hard to provide customers additional options including the new feature&nbsp;<A title=\"Delivery Optimization and Office 365 ProPlus which is now in Preview\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/delivery-optimization\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Delivery Optimization and Office 365 ProPlus which is now in (Preview).</A>&nbsp; Please read article for full details but one-liner is customers will be able to install AND update Office 365 ProPlus sourcing content from peers without infrastructure requirements which we're super excited about. (no more \"thick packages\" or distributing loads of content to support a simple language pack).&nbsp; If you enabled OfficeMgmtCom for SCCM integration, this action must be <U>reversed</U> in order to use Delivery Optimization (DO). The Microsoft Office Click-to-Run Service is responsible for registering and unregistering OfficeC2RCom (OfficeMgmtCOM) application during service startup.&nbsp; Changing domain policy or SCCM client settings for Office 365 Client Management from ‘Enabled’ to ‘Not configured’ <U>is not enough</U>.&nbsp; Domain Policy or SCCM Client settings require explicit ‘Disable’ selection for OfficeC2RCom to be successfully deregistered and restore default configuration. Further, any custom update path configuration must also be removed.</P>\n<H2>Benefits</H2>\n<UL>\n<LI>Office 365 ProPlus updates can easily be included in the same software deployment as monthly Windows patch process. As a result, all existing business processes and change control can be aligned in the same manner as legacy MSI Office products.</LI>\n<LI>Clients will only pull down what's needed to update themselves from Distribution Point.</LI>\n<LI>SCCM Administrators can download cumulative build one time from the internet and than deploy to all distribution points so clients pull updates from intranet sources.</LI>\n<LI>Administrators can make deployment Available (optional where user is notified update)</LI>\n<LI>Administrators can make deployment Available for a period of time prior to Installation Deadline. In this scenario, Office 365 Client using OfficeMgmtCOM will pull deltas from distribution point prior to Installation Deadline and give user a chance to “Update now” via BizBar discussed above at a time which is convenient for them.&nbsp; This is especially important in a ever mobile world where machines are mobile and not powered on all the time.&nbsp; Further, IT Pros can get some early production validation as some subset of their population will update prior to Installation Deadline giving them advanced notification of any problems prior to broad deployment.</LI>\n<LI>Administrators can make deployment Available time and Installation Deadline the same time. SCCM will ensure update is downloaded and installed at Deadline. (additional details on user experience below)</LI>\n<LI>Administrators can enable SCCM features such as Peer Cache so clients can share content among themselves further reducing network WAN traffic. (<A title=\"Peer cache for Configuration Manager clients\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sccm/core/plan-design/hierarchy/client-peer-cache\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Peer cache for Configuration Manager clients</A>)</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>User Experience when updating from SCCM</H2>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 76px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124732i962D88B56FDB12C6/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"Frequency of toast notifications from SCCM are configurable within &quot;Client Settings&quot; under &quot;Computer Agent&quot;. This configuration is applicable to all software deployments not just Office 365 Client\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Frequency of toast notifications from SCCM are configurable within \"Client Settings\" under \"Computer Agent\". This configuration is applicable to all software deployments not just Office 365 Client</span></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Notifications.png\" style=\"width: 494px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/132410iBD09E263508ECAE1/image-dimensions/494x208?v=1.0\" width=\"494\" height=\"208\" title=\"Notifications.png\" alt=\"Can be found within SCCM console under client settings\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Can be found within SCCM console under client settings</span></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SCCMSoftwareChangesRequired.png\" style=\"width: 223px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124723iD2AF836A14223C16/image-dimensions/223x68?v=1.0\" width=\"223\" height=\"68\" title=\"SCCMSoftwareChangesRequired.png\" alt=\"SCCMSoftwareChangesRequired.png\" /></span></P>\n<H2>SCCM Deployment Scenarios</H2>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H3>Scenario 1 - Available only</H3>\n<P>If the deployment is Available only, the user will only see a toast notification in the system tray for a few seconds, Office update will never be deployed automatically.&nbsp; The problem is this notification isn’t context sensitive so it simply takes end user to Software Center and it also doesn’t ensure security compliance.&nbsp; Therefore, approach isn’t used often in my experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H3>Scenario 2 - Available with future Installation Deadline</H3>\n<P>This scenario is a good fit for customers who desire faster compliance, no Windows reboots for Office 365 ProPlus updates and are comfortable with additional Office 365 ProPlus end user toast notifications, also&nbsp;in app notifications as well as Office 365 ProPlus countdown dialog leading up to deadline.&nbsp;&nbsp;<SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">If the SCCM deployment is Available with future Installation Deadline, Office 365 ProPlus working with OfficeC2RCom application will download the necessary Office build pieces (not the entire build) and stage for installation pulling content from Distribution Point.&nbsp; When content is prestaged, there are a number of potential notifications, p</SPAN>lease review bullet items in blue from page&nbsp;<A title=\"Manage Office 365 ProPlus with Configuration Manager\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sccm/sum/deploy-use/manage-office-365-proplus-updates#restart-behavior-and-client-notifications-for-office-365-updates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Manage Office 365 ProPlus with Configuration Manager</A> to review all details as there are many or reference the list from CDN section above.</P>\n<P>For example:</P>\n<P>\"BusBar\"</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"bizbar.png\" style=\"width: 672px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124722iA7BE0149DA76B563/image-dimensions/672x113?v=1.0\" width=\"672\" height=\"113\" title=\"bizbar.png\" alt=\"Business Bar\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Business Bar</span></span></P>\n<P>Once build is staged, a toast notification might not display until the user clicks the icon in the notification area which is easy to miss.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SystrayReminder.png\" style=\"width: 281px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/133042i262DFC7E8DD3FE79/image-dimensions/281x143?v=1.0\" width=\"281\" height=\"143\" title=\"SystrayReminder.png\" alt=\"&quot;Basic notification&quot; which sometimes be hidden under task bar chevron\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">\"Basic notification\" which sometimes be hidden under task bar chevron</span></span>&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SystrayReminder2.png\" style=\"width: 297px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/133043i5DCF3515D8EF0947/image-dimensions/297x94?v=1.0\" width=\"297\" height=\"94\" title=\"SystrayReminder2.png\" alt=\"SystrayReminder2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Examples of \"Countdown dialogs\"</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"minu.png\" style=\"width: 231px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135159i38EC1DB3E250F808/image-dimensions/231x141?v=1.0\" width=\"231\" height=\"141\" title=\"minu.png\" alt=\"Minute countdown\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Minute countdown</span></span>&nbsp;<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"sec.png\" style=\"width: 229px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135160iEB7A54989D0B748D/image-dimensions/229x140?v=1.0\" width=\"229\" height=\"140\" title=\"sec.png\" alt=\"Second countdown\"
