/><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Second countdown</span></span><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"installed.png\" style=\"width: 249px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135161i2B7A587B876E1D74/image-dimensions/249x152?v=1.0\" width=\"249\" height=\"152\" title=\"installed.png\" alt=\"Updates Installed\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Updates Installed</span></span></P>\n<P>Important to note, countdown from SCCM and Office countdown are not synchronized in any way, they work on separate timers.&nbsp; Specifically, SCCM will stamp in the Office side of the registry the deadline date and time.&nbsp; From that point on, Office and SCCM notifications will in effect work independently based on deadline defined in Software Update Group.&nbsp; For pre-stage scenario its normal for Office to attempt to apply updates before the SCCM defined deadline or allow user to temporarily extend beyond deadline based on countdown dialog section above.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"prestage and deadline has passed.png\" style=\"width: 224px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135466iA4CBA56EA74B1815/image-dimensions/224x136?v=1.0\" width=\"224\" height=\"136\" title=\"prestage and deadline has passed.png\" alt=\"prestage and deadline has passed.png\" /></span></P>\n<H3>Scenario 3 - Available and Required Installation Deadline have same date</H3>\n<P>This scenario is best for IT Pros who want to minimize notifications to end user unless deadline has been reached.(Office content is not pre-staged)&nbsp; If the software deployment Available time and Installation Deadline have the same date, SCCM Client will determine that deadline has been missed and therefore make the deployment immediate.&nbsp; Typical notification workflow will be presented to user.&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SCCMSoftwareChangesRequired.png\" style=\"width: 279px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124723iD2AF836A14223C16/image-dimensions/279x85?v=1.0\" width=\"279\" height=\"85\" title=\"SCCMSoftwareChangesRequired.png\" alt=\"SCCMSoftwareChangesRequired.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>In this case since deadline has passed, download will begin automatically.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"downloadinginstalling.png\" style=\"width: 283px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124724i2AA16B99F71FB196/image-dimensions/283x61?v=1.0\" width=\"283\" height=\"61\" title=\"downloadinginstalling.png\" alt=\"downloadinginstalling.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Once content has been downloaded, SCCM will immediately initiate Office update with following logic:&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>If all Office applications are closed, update will occur with no reboot.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>If any Office application are open standard SCCM reboot workflow occurs.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"restartwindow.png\" style=\"width: 260px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124725i6D1E4D8D2DF82C51/image-dimensions/260x99?v=1.0\" width=\"260\" height=\"99\" title=\"restartwindow.png\" alt=\"restartwindow.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>The end user will begin to see SCCM “Restart Window” below which shows countdown until restart is forced.&nbsp; The countdown frequency of notification are controlled solely by SCCM Client and can be configured within Client Settings node within SCCM Console.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SCCMRestartWindow.png\" style=\"width: 302px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124726iEC2B7DB3E552C622/image-dimensions/302x172?v=1.0\" width=\"302\" height=\"172\" title=\"SCCMRestartWindow.png\" alt=\"SCCMRestartWindow.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>FAQ:</P>\n<P><STRONG>Is there a simple way to hide all notifications in Office such as the “Biz Bar” with button “Update Now?”</STRONG></P>\n<P>Yes. Use “Hide Update Notifications” GPO or registry</P>\n<PRE>HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Policies\\Microsoft\\office\\16.0\\common\\officeupdate<BR />\"hideupdatenotifications\"=dword:00000001</PRE>\n<P><STRONG><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-left\" image-alt=\"Warning.png\" style=\"width: 59px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/133083iF7EB795BA75E362F/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"Warning.png\" alt=\"This registry setting doesn't apply to deadline notifications such as the large white splash screen with countdown.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">This registry setting doesn't apply to deadline notifications such as the large white splash screen with countdown.</span></span></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Is there an Microsoft official page which talks about this topic?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Yes. <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sccm/sum/deploy-use/manage-office-365-proplus-updates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Manage Office 365 ProPlus with Configuration Manager</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>If the download is supposed to only contain deltas and stage to C:\\Program Files\\Microsoft Office\\Updates\\Download, why in my environment is it staged in C:\\Windows\\ccmcache and full build? (~2GB)</STRONG></P>\n<P>This means SCCM “Peer Cache” feature is enabled and content is available to be shared with other peers.&nbsp; Windows is leveraging a NTFS feature called <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/fileio/sparse-files\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">“Sparse Files”</A>.&nbsp; Looking closely at size on disk details, you can compare the differences between the full data and the one on the right using peer cache. (Peer cache really only downloaded 80 MB.)</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Peercache.jpg\" style=\"width: 511px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124727i8E68FB0F29068A84/image-dimensions/511x350?v=1.0\" width=\"511\" height=\"350\" title=\"Peercache.jpg\" alt=\"Peercache.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>I’ve done everything I can think of and OfficeC2RCom application never shows within MMC console.&nbsp; In fact, when I browse COM applications from within dcomconfg.exe, My Computer has a red down arrow?</STRONG></P>\n<P>This means COM, part of .NET may be corrupted on machine.&nbsp; Office cannot register application as COM itself is broken.&nbsp; Typically this is edge case and requires rebuild of Windows :(</img></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>You mentioned&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/taskschd/task-idle-conditions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">On idle</A>&nbsp;update feature in CDN section but was omitted for SCCM, why?</STRONG></P>\n<P>\"By design\", feature is enabled only for CDN scenario.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Users who launch Office immediately after logon receive message \"Updating Office, please wait a moment\".&nbsp; Why?</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"UpdatingOfficeWait.jpg\" style=\"width: 294px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124794iA173D637E80F7715/image-dimensions/294x182?v=1.0\" width=\"294\" height=\"182\" title=\"UpdatingOfficeWait.jpg\" alt=\"UpdatingOfficeWait.jpg\" /></span></STRONG></P>\n<P>This means Office update was attempted while applications were open which cannot succeed.&nbsp; Therefore, build was staged to retry update by <FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Office Click-to-Run Service on Windows startup.&nbsp; In this edge case, the user was able to access desktop and launch a Office application while Office update process is in progress.&nbsp; If easily reproducible, this is often a reflection of slow boot process and Windows startup performance.&nbsp; Best to troubleshoot by removing 3rd party filter drivers and or startup items.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">I've tried everything and Software Center never shows Office 365 Client build applicable to my machine?</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Review how Office 365 ProPlus determines priority:</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<PRE><STRONG>1st Priority</STRONG> : GPO \"UpdatePath\" - HKLM\\software\\policies\\microsoft\\office\\16.0\\common\\officeupdate!updatepath<BR /><STRONG>2nd Priority</STRONG> : GPO \"UpdateChannel\" - HKLM\\software\\policies\\microsoft\\office\\16.0\\common\\officeupdate!updatebranch<BR /><STRONG>3rd Priority</STRONG> : \"UpdateURL\" or UpdatePath=\"\\\\Server\\Share\" under HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration<BR /><STRONG>4th Priority</STRONG> : \"CDNBaseURL\" - HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration\\CDNBaseUrl</PRE>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Reflecting on priority list above, have you intentionally or unintentionally set a GPO <FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff; box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">\"UpdatePath\" - HKLM\\software\\policies\\microsoft\\office\\16.0\\common\\officeupdate!updatepath </FONT>or included an element inside configuration.xml during initial installation for UpdatePath HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration\\UpdatePath=\"\\\\Server\\Share\"? This in effect breaks native updates via SCCM as they take precedence.&nbsp; To resolve, remove these values and reset&nbsp;<FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff; box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration</FONT> UpdateChannelChanged to False, run Automatic Updates 2.0 scheduled task manually (or be patient and allow it to run) and then perform Software Updates Deployment Evaluation Cycle from SCCM Control Panel Applet.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">You didn't mention updating from on-premises file share, why?</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Updating Office 365 ProPlus from File Shares has been&nbsp;deemphasized as a strategy.&nbsp; Initially Office 365 ProPlus didn't support update workflows such as SCCM or Delivery Optimization and therefore customers used this approach.&nbsp; However, this is resolved with SCCM Current Branch and modern versions of Windows 10 this is no longer necessary. (still supported just less adopted)</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Change log:</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">08/14/2020 Added&nbsp;Notifications and Countdown Dialogs section for more detail.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>The Author</H2>\n<P>This blog post is brought to you by Dave Guenthner, a Senior Premier Field Engineer and “ProPlus Ranger” at Microsoft. Feel free to share your questions and feedback in the comments below.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 19 Aug 2020 13:57:08 46-251_19c99101672b3493.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135160iEB7A54989D0B748D/image-dimensions/229x140?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn44@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-42-070_27d44a76d27568e7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135161i2B7A587B876E1D74/image-dimensions/249x152?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn92@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-40-764_e9d8f972cb699856.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135466iA4CBA56EA74B1815/image-dimensions/224x136?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn79@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-45-103_38105c9bb76f987b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124723iD2AF836A14223C16/image-dimensions/279x85?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn59@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-46-908_355fcb36397718d8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124724i2AA16B99F71FB196/image-dimensions/283x61?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn96@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-40-746_c645db369784643b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124725i6D1E4D8D2DF82C51/image-dimensions/260x99?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn12@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-45-844_66994af790f812f8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124726iEC2B7DB3E552C622/image-dimensions/302x172?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn100@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-52-42-151_8b783caa35b88359.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/133083iF7EB795BA75E362F/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn32@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-40-745_efcf04aa194ef86c.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124727i8E68FB0F29068A84/image-dimensions/511x350?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn48@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-43-788_0dd3eeda0db21e4f.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124794iA173D637E80F7715/image-dimensions/294x182?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn8@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-42-530_dab9f45ce656c384.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639082},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Data protection beyond backup and recovery with Office 365","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/data-protection-beyond-backup-and-recovery-with-office-365/ba-p/142871","description":"<P>\n Protecting your data against file corruption , data loss, and malicious intent is a top priority for Microsoft, and an integral part of the Office 365 service. Our approach to data protection goes beyond high availability and disaster recovery scenarios. Resiliency and recoverability are built into the service.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Even if a traditional backup solution provides recovery options to address file corruption, deletion, and malicious attacks, it won’t necessarily help you recover quickly from such incidents. Research shows that it can take months to detect the presence of an attacker an organization’s network. Given this, a backup and restore solution could be a potential area of attack, and could further broaden the scope of attack into your disaster recovery environment. Additionally, all backup data would need to be throuroughly cleansed before it could be leveraged as a viable restore option. Gartner predicts that by 2020, 30% of organizations targeted by major cyberattacks will spend more than two months cleansing backup systems and data, resulting in delayed recoveries.\n <EM>\n  <FONT color=\"#808080\">\n   [i]\n  </FONT>\n </EM>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n With this in mind, Office 365 has moved beyond the backup and restore solutions that were first established in on-premises environments. Microsoft invests deeply in providing a holistic in-place solution that both keeps multiple copies of your data across multiple locations, and enables you to develop upfront policies for prevention and detection. These policies can be enforced manually and automatically at multiple levels of granularity, including via intelligent location-based classification, patterns, or sensitive types of content.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n In addition to the inherent versioning and recycling capabilities provided by applications like Exchange, SharePoint, and OneDrive, Office 365 provides comprehensive solutions to help keep your data safe from both human error as well as malicious attacks:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Data Loss Prevention\n  </STRONG> helps customers to identify, monitor and protect sensitive data through deep content analysis.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Exchange Online Protection\n  </STRONG> provides robust email protection against spam, known viruses and malware.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Advanced Threat Protection\n  </STRONG> extends Exchange Online Protection by safeguarding your Office 365 environment (email, Word, Excel, Powerpoint, SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams) from today’s most sophisticated unknown threats leveraging behavioral analysis and machine learning techniques to mitigate malicious content. ATP also provides real time, time-of-click protection against malicious URLs, and rich reporting and tracking capabilities, so you can gain critical insights into who is being targeted in your organization and the category, volume, and frequency of attacks you are facing.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Threat Intelligence\n  </STRONG> provides interactive tools to analyze prevalence and severity of threats in near real-time, real-time and customizable threat alert notifications, and remediation capabilities for suspicious content.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Auditing \n  </STRONG>helps monitor and investigate actions taken on your data, intelligently identify risks, contain and respond to threats, and protect valuable intellectual property.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Advanced Data Governance\n  </STRONG> provides smart policy recommendations and automatic data classifications that allow you to take actions on data- such as retention and deletion -throughout its lifecycle. Built-in and custom alerts help you identify data governance risks like unusual volumes of file deletion.\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n The multiple built-in security capabilities of Office 365 in combination with the above services and controls help ensure your data is protected in-place and incidents like file corruption, deletion, and malicious intent are minimized at all times.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n More information:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/trustcenter/guidance/protect-data\" target=\"_blank\">\n   Data Protection on the Microsoft Trust Center\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"http://download.microsoft.com/download/A/0/7/A07FF75D-1FDC-4642-897F-9F390978E759/Data%20Resiliency%20in%20Office%20365.pdf\" policies\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <EM>\n  <FONT color=\"#808080\">\n   <A name=\"_edn1\" Foundational Research: Prepare for and Respond to a Business Disruption After an Aggressive Cyberattack, ID: G00275607\n  </FONT>\n </EM>\n</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 10 Hopkins","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/33134iB6D0FD3AA71B7722/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn41@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-40-309_f437e42a7a6d2a91.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639103},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Save your files to the cloud more easily","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/save-your-files-to-the-cloud-more-easily/ba-p/325133","description":"<P>To protect against device loss or damage and to provide anywhere access to files, we recommend storing them in Office 365. Last June we announced <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TechCommunity/KFM\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Known Folder Move</A> (KFM) in OneDrive for customers on Windows 7, 8.1 and Windows 10. Known Folder Move provides an easy way to redirect your desktop documents and folders to OneDrive, making OneDrive the default location for those files. With KFM, your content is automatically synced to OneDrive with no disruption to productivity.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today we are announcing a new capability that makes it easier for you to create and save your Word, Excel, or PowerPoint document directly to the cloud. When you go to save an Office365 document using Ctrl+S (Windows), Cmd+S (macOS), or the Save button, the new dialog box will default to OneDrive or SharePoint Online. And if you forget to save a new document before exiting, you will also see this updated save experience.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/93168_SAVE_DOCS_TO_CLOUD_GIF_EXIT_WITHOUT_SAVING_V03.gif\" border=\"0\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Once a document is saved in the cloud, you can easily rename the file and change the location from the title bar. This ability to save your document to the cloud directly from Word, Excel, or PowerPoint will roll out to Office 365 on Windows and Mac beginning in February.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/93168_SAVE_DOCS_TO_CLOUD_GIF_MAC_V03.gif\" border=\"0\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>These features, along with <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TechCommunity/OneDriveOD-MAC\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneDrive Files On-Demand for Mac</A>, are part of our investments in making it easier for you to get your files into the cloud. By saving to the cloud, you will be able to securely access your most important documents from any device and start collaborating with others from the get go.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 25 Jan 2019 17:25:15 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/93168_SAVE_DOCS_TO_CLOUD_GIF_EXIT_WITHOUT_SAVING_V03.gif","linkMd5":"21acbb2ff5c59e8b9d926a176884e30a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn66@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-52-900_9c154fb2c8946b07.webp","destWidth":900,"destHeight":622,"sourceBytes":1300368,"destBytes":869158,"author":"The_Office_Apps_Team","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/93168_SAVE_DOCS_TO_CLOUD_GIF_EXIT_WITHOUT_SAVING_V03.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn66@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-52-900_9c154fb2c8946b07.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/93168_SAVE_DOCS_TO_CLOUD_GIF_MAC_V03.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn88@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-51-542_95913da14f9290e3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639100},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Announcing: Office 365 endpoint categories and Office 365 IP Address and URL web service","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/announcing-office-365-endpoint-categories-and-office-365-ip/ba-p/177638","description":"<P>[Originally published for the preview on 4/2/2018 and updated on 7/6/2018. Updated for GA on 9/5/2018]</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Announcing: The IP Address and URL web services are generally available from 5th September, 2018.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft recently published a set of <U><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Getting-the-best-connectivity-and-performance-in-Office-365/ba-p/124694\" target=\"_blank\">connectivity principles for Office 365</A></U> which provides concise guidance on the recommended ways of achieving optimal performance and connectivity to Office 365. The first of these principles is to Identify and differentiate Office 365 network traffic using Microsoft published endpoints. Endpoints include IP Addresses and URLs that are used to connect to Office 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The primary benefits of using these web services are that they share the endpoint categories which significantly simplify network perimeter configuration, they are fully automated including automated validation testing them, they can be loaded directly into network devices, and they help automate change management to avoid change related outages. The endpoint categories identify a vital few key network endpoints in the Optimize and Allow categories for Office 365 for which we&nbsp;recommend direct Internet egress.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We use web services because they are easier for customers scripts and network devices to call than web pages. Specific scenarios where you might need this data include:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Updating your perimeter firewall to allow Office 365 network connectivity.</LI>\n<LI>Updating your enterprise proxy server to allow connectivity to Office 365 URLs.</LI>\n<LI>Edit PAC files on your users computers to bypass proxy servers.</LI>\n<LI>Bypassing an SSL decrypting network device for Office 365 network traffic.</LI>\n<LI>Bypassing a CASB service for Office 365 network traffic.</LI>\n<LI>Selecting endpoints for bypassing proxy servers and routing for direct internet access at a branch office user location.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>These web services directly offer Office 365 IP Address and URL data in JSON, and CSV format for&nbsp;all five Office 365 service instances including Office 365 worldwide commercial, Office 365 operated by 21 Vianet, Office 365 Germany, Office 365 U.S. Government DoD, and Office 365 U.S. Government GCC High. We also generate HTML pages from the data and RSS feeds are available from the web services to help with change notification.</P>\n<P>Here’s a few quick links to the web services you can access right in a web browser. These links are provided for the worldwide Office 365 commercial instance as examples only.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Get the latest version number for the Office 365 worldwide service instance<BR /> <SPAN><A href=\"https://endpoints.office.com/version/worldwide?clientrequestid=b10c5ed1-bad1-445f-b386-b919946339a7\" target=\"_blank\">https://endpoints.office.com/version/worldwide?clientrequestid=b10c5ed1-bad1-445f-b386-b919946339a7</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI>Get the current endpoints for the Office 365 worldwide service instance excluding IPv6 IP Addresses<BR /> <SPAN><A href=\"https://endpoints.office.com/endpoints/worldwide?noipv6&amp;ClientRequestId=b10c5ed1-bad1-445f-b386-b919946339a7\" target=\"_blank\">https://endpoints.office.com/endpoints/worldwide?noipv6&amp;ClientRequestId=b10c5ed1-bad1-445f-b386-b919946339a7</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI>Changes to the Office 365 worldwide service instance since 20180828<BR /> <SPAN><A href=\"https://endpoints.office.com/changes/worldwide/2018072800?ClientRequestId=b10c5ed1-bad1-445f-b386-b919946339a7\" target=\"_blank\">https://endpoints.office.com/changes/worldwide/2018072800?ClientRequestId=b10c5ed1-bad1-445f-b386-b919946339a7</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI>The RSS feed for changes to the Office 365 worldwide service instance<BR /> <SPAN><A href=\"https://endpoints.office.com/version/worldwide?allversions=true&amp;format=rss&amp;clientrequestid=b10c5ed1-bad1-445f-b386-b919946339a7\" target=\"_blank\">https://endpoints.office.com/version/worldwide?allversions=true&amp;format=rss&amp;clientrequestid=b10c5ed1-bad1-445f-b386-b919946339a7</A></SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The current XML file and the old RSS feed will be available until October 2nd, 2018. If you have automation that uses the XML format, you should update that to use the JSON format data. If you are using the old RSS feed you should either move to the new RSS feed, or use <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Networking/Use-Microsoft-Flow-to-receive-an-email-for-changes-to-Office-365/m-p/240651\" target=\"_blank\">the sample Microsoft Flow </A>we have published for getting emails on changes. Developer usage documentation for the IP Address and URL web services are detailed in <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/Office365/Enterprise/office-365-ip-web-service\" target=\"_blank\"><U>Managing Office 365 Endpoints – Web Service</U></A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The web services include three categories for Office 365 network endpoints as attributes of this data which can be used to simplify management of perimeter network devices:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Optimize</STRONG> for a small number of endpoints that require low latency unimpeded connectivity which should bypass proxy servers, network SSL break and inspect devices, and network hairpins. Direct Internet access, such as with SDWAN, is recommended for these endpoints.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Allow</STRONG> for a larger number of endpoints that benefit from low latency unimpeded connectivity but do not require it. It is required to bypass SSL break and inspect on these endpoints and to avoid proxy authentication. Although not expected to cause failures, we also recommend bypassing proxy servers entirely, network hairpins, and other network intermediary devices on these endpoints. Good connectivity to these endpoints is required for Office 365 to operate normally.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Default</STRONG> for other Office 365 endpoints which can be directed to the default internet egress location for the company WAN.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Use of these categories, how they simplify connectivity to Office 365, and what actions you can take to make use of them is detailed in <U><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/office-365-network-connectivity-principles-76e7f232-917a-4b13-8fe2-4f8dbccfe041\" target=\"_blank\">Office 365 Network Connectivity Principles</A></U>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The web services and data contained in it are supported by Microsoft. However, you do not need to connect to these web services in order to use Office 365. Keep a local copy of the data and just call them again to check for changes. If you are ever unable to connect to the web services, just use the data you have previously downloaded. When a change is notified, you should have 30 days to make updates.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Documentation links:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><U><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/managing-office-365-endpoints-99cab9d4-ef59-4207-9f2b-3728eb46bf9a#webservice\" target=\"_blank\">Managing Office 365 endpoints – Web Service</A></U> (including usage documentation for the IP/URL web service)&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI><U><A email for endpoint changes</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Networking/Migrating-to-the-new-web-services-based-publishing-for-Office/m-p/229144\" +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"ab23f9162e75b710f0045bf203767148","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Paul Andrew","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639103},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Microsoft wants your ideas on end user adoption & engagement with Microsoft 365 & Office 365","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/microsoft-wants-your-ideas-on-end-user-adoption-amp-engagement/ba-p/688489","description":"<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"new image resaved.jpg\" style=\"width: 612px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/117952i2A878F2D0804474D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"new image resaved.jpg\" alt=\"new image resaved.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Edit: Survey results as of August 6, 2019:</STRONG> Thank you to all who participated in the survey! Here are the top 5 takeaways from your responses:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Who:</STRONG> Admins and adoption/change management teams start with support from decision-makers and leverage power-users.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Challenges:</STRONG> Lack of time, executive support/budget, metrics, training resources, and the complexity of newer apps.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Needs:</STRONG> Adoption statistics and product roadmaps to help plan, plus training in the form of business scenarios and short, guided tutorials and videos.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>MS Comms:</STRONG> It’s ok for Microsoft to communicate to end users only if admins/adoption teams can control/customize frequency and content.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Portal:</STRONG> Admins/adoption teams want all content centrally stored and navigable for easy referral and use.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Survey request as of June 12, 2019:</STRONG> Microsoft is looking for IT professionals like you to provide feedback on end user adoption and engagement for Microsoft 365 / Office 365 through a brief survey. Topics include key challenges in your role, end-user adoption and engagement practices, and preferred communications from Microsoft. Your feedback will help drive the types of content Microsoft develops for you and your end-users.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To qualify for this survey, you must meet the following criteria:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Your role involves end-user training / change management / adoption of Microsoft 365 &amp; Office 365 applications</LI>\n<LI>You are not in government or education sectors</LI>\n<LI>Your organization has at least 150 employees / seats on Microsoft 365 &amp; Office 365 subscription</LI>\n</UL>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Aug 2019 20:59:40 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/117952i2A878F2D0804474D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"27e61dc217c9e4f702525bb953dfa150","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn64@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-50-41-290_aa59386fdc2cbb46.webp","destWidth":612,"destHeight":408,"sourceBytes":40438,"destBytes":30846,"author":"Dhruv_Jain","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/117952i2A878F2D0804474D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn64@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-50-41-290_aa59386fdc2cbb46.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639096},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Rethinking the modern workplace with Microsoft 365","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/rethinking-the-modern-workplace-with-microsoft-365/ba-p/136183","description":"<P>\n <EM>\n  <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MSTechSummit_Toronto_2000x590.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/25500i7357E4A280D9B1D3/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MSTechSummit_Toronto_2000x590.png\" alt=\"MSTechSummit_Toronto_2000x590.png\" /></span>\n </EM>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <EM>\n  Today’s post was written by Catherine Boeger, general manager for Microsoft Office marketing\n </EM>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Today the rapid pace of change is challenging businesses and government organizations to rethink everything we do. What’s changing? For the first time ever, we have five generations in the workforce, from Baby Boomers to Generation Z, all with different ideas about how work gets done and different levels of comfort and expectations around technology. Constantly changing customer and citizen expectations are pushing businesses to innovate quickly and find new ways to leverage information from both inside and outside organizations. And ever-growing cyber security threats remind us we must remain vigilant in protecting our employees and customer data and in maintaining regulatory and industry compliance. One of the primary questions is, how can you embrace these modern workplace trends to help drive business growth? I want to share some of the ways Microsoft 365, which brings together Office 365, Windows 10, and Enterprise Security + Mobility, can help organizations like yours leverage digital transformation to enable people to come together in a secure way and get the best results from each other to drive business forward.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Let’s first look at the generational shift in the workplace. With five generations of workers on the payroll, how can you create a connected environment to leverage that diversity, which can be so critical for your success? At Microsoft, we’ve found that teamwork is key—bringing together groups of people, no matter their generation, function, or location, to address problems and opportunities with a shared sense of accountability to complete the task in front of them. That’s why we built Microsoft Teams in Microsoft 365: to help you create a digital hub for teamwork where everyone can easily share or access information they need and focus on a common goal. Powerful features like threaded persistent chats and access to recorded meetings can help create an ongoing dialog and enable people to learn from each other and get caught up quickly. And while we all may have a habit of thinking that mobility is more important to Millennials or younger generations, really the need and desire to be productive from anywhere has become a reality of all our lives, which is why Teams is accessible from almost any device.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Generational diversity isn’t the only gap we can bridge to help drive business growth. We’re building tools for the modern workplace that close longstanding technology gaps that separate employees from data, resources and expertise they need to do their best work. We believe a truly modern workplace can empower everyone in the organization to turn ideas into action – from the executive team to the Firstline Workforce.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Firstline Workers are often the first to engage customers, the first to represent a company’s brand and first to see products and services in action. They are the people behind the counter, on the phone, in the clinics, on shop floor and in the field. Their unique perspective provides the on-the-ground facts that help organizations spot trends, challenges and best practices. We see organizations take advantage of this firstline perspective every day to unlock innovation and growth. I’m reminded of a Microsoft customer, \n <A href=\"https://customers.microsoft.com/en-us/story/fruitoftheloom-manufacturing-o365\" target=\"_blank\">\n  Fruit of the Loom\n </A>, who recognized that “their greatest thinkers are within the company,” according to their Chief Operating Officer, Tony Pelaski.&nbsp; Fruit of the Loom is using Microsoft 365 Enterprise to connect the entire organization and foster an engaged workforce with the capabilities and tools to deliver against customer insights, market trends, and new ideas. Customer stories like these inspired us to create \n <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/firstline\" target=\"_blank\">\n  a version of Microsoft 365 specifically for your Firstline Workforce\n </A>. We know that all organizations have critical data, and I believe it will be those that take advantage of their firstline data and empower all workers that will achieve a true and sustainable competitive advantage.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Of course, any data you collect must be secured. Today we all face constant pressure to have open flows of information to drive productivity and teamwork, and it’s as critical as ever to protect our organizations because threats today are complex and target everyone. Cyber threats have grown so pervasive that 74 percent of organizations expect to be hacked in the next year.\n <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/rethinking-the-modern-workplace-with-microsoft-365/ba-p/136183#_ftn1\" target=\"_blank\" name=\"_ftnref1\">\n  <SPAN>\n   [1]\n  </SPAN>\n </A> That’s why Microsoft built security into all layers of Microsoft 365, powered by the Microsoft Intelligent Security Graph, to help you detect threats and protect your people, data, and devices without disrupting employee productivity. Customers like the \n <A href=\"https://blogs.office.com/en-us/2016/11/09/uk-ministry-of-defence-on-the-frontline-of-cloud-based-data-protection-with-office-365-advanced-threat-protection/\" target=\"_blank\">\n  UK Ministry of Defence\n </A> have felt confident in shifting to the Microsoft cloud because capabilities like Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection and Customer Lockbox help provide the security and privacy controls they need to protect sensitive data.\n <BR />\n <BR />\n</P> \n<P>\n And on top of security, we all worry about how best to maintain compliance and data privacy, because no doing so can stop any organization—no matter how innovative—in its tracks. Microsoft works closely with regulators and customers to ensure that our services are compliant with global, regional, and industry regulations. Microsoft 365 provides advanced compliance functionality to help adhere to these regulations, including General Data Protection Regulation, also known as GDPR. Microsoft 365 is ready for May 25, 2018 – the day when GDPR takes effect, and can \n <A href=\"https://eventl.on24.com/eventRegistration/console/EventConsoleApollo.jsp?simulive=y&amp;eventid=1520300&amp;sessionid=1&amp;username=&amp;partnerref=&amp;format=fhvideo1&amp;mobile=false&amp;flashsupportedmobiledevice=false&amp;helpcenter=false&amp;key=302A337CD2220EFB678F9B005E8F2A62&amp;text_language_id=en&amp;playerwidth=1000&amp;playerheight=650&amp;overwritelobby=y&amp;eventuserid=185994436&amp;contenttype=A&amp;mediametricsessionid=151230707&amp;mediametricid=2180108&amp;usercd=185994436&amp;mode=launch\" target=\"_blank\">\n  help you accelerate your compliance journey\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n As a keynote speaker at the upcoming \n <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/techsummit/toronto\" target=\"_blank\">\n  Microsoft Tech Summit Toronto\n </A> December 13 and 14, I’ll be talking in depth about how Microsoft 365 can help you create a modern workplace that brings people together in secure ways to innovate new products and services. I hope you’ll join me and Arpan Shah, general manager of Azure Infrastructure marketing at Microsoft, to discover the latest trends, tools, and product roadmaps designed to help you thrive in a new world of work.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/rethinking-the-modern-workplace-with-microsoft-365/ba-p/136183#_ftnref1\" target=\"_blank\" name=\"_ftn1\">\n  <SPAN>\n   [1]\n  </SPAN>\n </A> \n <A href=\"http://www.isaca.org/cyber/Documents/State-of-Cybersecurity-infographic.pdf\" target=\"_blank\">\n  http://www.isaca.org/cyber/Documents/State-of-Cybersecurity-infographic.pdf\n </A>\n</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 12 Dec 2017 16:54:54 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/25500i7357E4A280D9B1D3/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"aebaaf25a140843017643591947c9732","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-41-621_758ac1ebb4ce244f.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":295,"sourceBytes":113285,"destBytes":29192,"author":"Catherine Boeger (KURSCH)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/25500i7357E4A280D9B1D3/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-41-621_758ac1ebb4ce244f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639107},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Managing changes in Office 365: An overview of resources","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/managing-changes-in-office-365-an-overview-of-resources/ba-p/225870","description":"<P>Office 365 gives you the latest updates and features as early as possible so you can continue doing your job productively. For Office 365 services, updates are run in the background as soon as they become available, instead of bundled updates scheduled months apart.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Shifting from a static Office suite to an evergreen one that enhances user productivity, creativity, and collaboration requires us to provide visibility into the updates that are coming for your users – you need the resources to navigate and guide these changes throughout your tenant. From the Office 365 Roadmap to the Message Center, Microsoft provides the information you need to stay on top of change.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>Note: While Office ProPlus client apps are updated every six months, there is also the option to sign up for earlier releases to receive them sooner. See Targeted release section for more details.</EM></P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Roadmap</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/business/office-365-roadmap?filters=\" target=\"_blank\">Office 365 Roadmap</A> gives you a snapshot of upcoming changes as early as possible. Product groups post upcoming updates for features and services on the roadmap in one of several stages: in development, rolling out, and launched. The roadmap is designed to give a wider view into the future of Office 365 changes to come, so admins can get excited for new features, plan appropriately with Targeted release, and keep on the lookout for the Message Center post as the update nears its ship date. Visit the roadmap to get the first view of exciting updates and keep up-to-date on applications and services across Office 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Message Center</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"mc.png\" style=\"width: 522px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/39295i6B91AC2F91A3AC5E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"mc.png\" alt=\"mc.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Message Center is the hub where we post official announcements about upcoming changes to your tenant as well as any actions required by admins to proactively manage the change. You can access the Message Center as a card on the admin center home dashboard or under Health in the left-hand panel.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Each post gives a summary of what’s changing, how it may affect users, and additional links to help you prepare your tenant. Message Center posts also provide important information on preventing and fixing issues in your tenant. Because not all admins may need to see all posts, each admin can set preferences to control which posts are displayed on Message Center. You can also opt in to receive a weekly digest of posts in email format delivered right to your inbox.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"mc1.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/39296i25A1F04C3E768104/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"mc1.png\" alt=\"mc1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Change that is considered a <SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/message-center-in-office-365-38fb3333-bfcc-4340-a37b-deda509c2093\" target=\"_blank\">major update</A></SPAN> is communicated at least 30 days in advance for those who have not opted in to early release opportunities. These announcements are highlighted at the top of Message Center as they are the most impactful to your organization. Major updates are defined as:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Changes to daily productivity such as inbox, meetings, delegations, sharing and access</LI>\n<LI>Changes to the themes, web parts, and other components that may affect customized features</LI>\n<LI>Increases or decreases to visible capacity such as storage, number of rules, items or durations</LI>\n<LI>Changes to product branding that may:\n<UL>\n<LI>Cause end user confusion,</LI>\n<LI>Result in changes to help desk processes and reference material, or</LI>\n<LI>Change a URL</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI>A new service or application</LI>\n<LI>Changes requiring an admin action (exclusive of prevent or fix issues)</LI>\n<LI>Changes to where your data is stored</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Click <SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/message-center-in-office-365-38fb3333-bfcc-4340-a37b-deda509c2093#ID0EAABAAA=Overview\" target=\"_blank\">here</A></SPAN> for more information on Message Center and <SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/message-center-in-office-365-38fb3333-bfcc-4340-a37b-deda509c2093#ID0EAABAAA=Set_preferences\" target=\"_blank\">here</A></SPAN> for guidance on setting preferences in Message Center.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Targeted Release</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Targeted release is an early release ring for select users within a tenant who will receive certain changes prior to the rest of their organization. For Office 365, new releases are first tested and validated by the feature team, then by the Office 365 team, and finally, by all of Microsoft. After internal validation is complete, customers can set individuals in the organization or the entire organization to receive available updates on Targeted release to see the latest updates and help provide early product feedback.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"tr.png\" style=\"width: 602px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/39297iB9EC49BCB2788386/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"tr.png\" alt=\"tr.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>You can manage how your organization receives updates by utilizing Targeted release in many ways. Targeted release allows admins or anyone responsible for managing Office 365 changes within an organization to prepare by letting them:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Test and validate new updates before they are released to all the users in the organization.</LI>\n<LI>Prepare user notification and documentation before updates are released worldwide.</LI>\n<LI>Prepare internal helpdesk for upcoming changes.</LI>\n<LI>Go through compliance and security reviews.</LI>\n<LI>Use feature controls, where applicable, to control the release of updates to end users.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>For Office 365 ProPlus client applications, updates are deployed every January and July on the Semi-Annual Channel. However, admins can opt to deploy some of their users on Semi-Annual Channel (Targeted) for the opportunity to receive updates a few months earlier every March and September. Additionally, admins can set certain users to receive more frequent updates on the Monthly Channel to further test the newest features available before deployment on the other channels.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"pp.png\" style=\"width: 750px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/39298iAF192CD82B2A98BC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"pp.png\" alt=\"pp.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>For more information on Office 365 ProPlus update channels, see <SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/DeployOffice/overview-of-update-channels-for-office-365-proplus#monthly-channel-for-office-365-proplus\" target=\"_blank\">here</A></SPAN>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We strongly recommend enabling Targeted release for admins to manage change within their tenants. However, keep in mind that there’s an option to set specific users, as opposed to entire tenants, to Targeted release. This functionality allows administrators and selected users to experience the new change earlier than the rest of the organization, giving them enough time to prepare the tenant before the change rolls out broadly.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You must be a global admin to set yourself and other users to Targeted release. If you choose not to opt into Targeted release, you will receive updates when they are release broadly in Standard release. For more information on Targeted release and setting it up for your organization, click <SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/set-up-the-standard-or-targeted-release-options-in-office-365-3b3adfa4-1777-4ff0-b606-fb8732101f47?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">here</A></SPAN>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In addition to the resources above, check out the official Microsoft 365 blog <SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/\" target=\"_blank\">here</A></SPAN> and continue engaging here in TechCommunity. Be on the lookout for posts on the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-365-Blog/bg-p/microsoft_365blog\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft 365 TechCommunity blog</A>, as we will be announcing news there as well.&nbsp; As always, feel free to provide feedback in the admin center dashboard or in the comments below, as we love hearing from you and finding out ways to improve the Office 365 experience!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 08 Aug 2018 21:13:39
