Hub","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/empower-your-sales-team-with-the-microsoft-365-sales-innovation/ba-p/195064","description":"<P>Microsoft 365 partnered with the American Association of Inside Sales to bring sales end-users content focused on key priorities for sales professionals.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/_XWVlORlyec\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"autoplay; encrypted-media\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><STRONG>Getting Organized <I>with Outlook</I></STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">Spend less time drowning in administrative tasks and focus on what’s important: building relationships with your customers, garnering insights, and delivering superior client services. Learn how you can spend more time on selling using Outlook effectively.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/0gLS3127_sg\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"autoplay; encrypted-media\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><STRONG>Enable Seamless Collaboration <I>with SharePoint</I></STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">The partnership between marketing and sales is essential. Learn how you can ensure you always have the most up to date content from marketing using SharePoint.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/xW8K4fgG60A\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"autoplay; encrypted-media\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><STRONG>Draw Insights Across Your Organization <I>with Yammer</I></STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">Learn how to leverage the power of your co-workers: they have worked in similar industries, have similar customers and comparable challenges. Reach across your organization, to find best practices and experts using Yammer.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/JjvLERudmQw\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"autoplay; encrypted-media\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P><STRONG>Strengthen Customer Relationships <EM>with Microsoft Teams</EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>Don't just become an email address for your customer. Create a connection using video calls in Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Vs3vXxOz7Rc\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"autoplay; encrypted-media\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><STRONG>Optimize Sales Performance <I>with PowerBI</I></STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">Learn how to leverage data visualization to uncover industry and customer insights. You will make smarter business decisions using powerful analytical capabilities within PowerBI.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Discover content to empower effortless sales achievements in the Sales Innovation Hub: <A href=\"https://www.aa-isp.org/sales-innovation-hub\" target=\"_blank\">https://www.aa-isp.org/sales-innovation-hub</A></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 17 May 2018 22:07:02 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"a7f2a9eb786133c45b36fa66b8139f50","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Molly Hallahan","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639104},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Updates to Office.com and the Office 365 app launcher","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/updates-to-office-com-and-the-office-365-app-launcher/ba-p/1150503","description":"<P>Office.com is the URL for an experience that we’ve been <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2017/09/22/new-office-365-app-launcher-and-office-com-help-you-be-more-productive-on-the-web/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">building</A> for a couple of years. We designed it to be your work hub experience and help you quickly get to the apps, tools, documents, and content you use on a daily basis. We’ve also brought intelligence into the experience that customizes the experience based on your activities.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" style=\"width: 687px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168970i4DC90E7CA5689BD6/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" alt=\"Figure 1 - Office.com home page\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 1 - Office.com home page</span></span></P>\n<P>Office.com includes the <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Meet-the-Office-365-app-launcher-79f12104-6fed-442f-96a0-eb089a3f476a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 app launcher</A>, which opens when you click the app launcher icon . The app launcher, which in addition to Office.com is also available across the suite, is a menu of your Office 365 apps and services that makes opening and switching between apps easy.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" style=\"width: 687px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168972i3AA76CBA0096946C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" alt=\"Figure 2 - Office 365 app launcher\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 2 - Office 365 app launcher</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We’re rolling out some changes to the way pinned applications work on Office.com and in the app launcher:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>We’ve provided admin controls in the Azure Active Directory portal that enable admins with the Cloud application administrator, Application administrator or Global administrator role to pin up to three apps to Office.com and the app launcher. Any app added by an admin can be unpinned by the user at any time. Office.com and the app launcher are now one experience and will show the same set of apps.</LI>\n<LI>There’s no need to manually pin apps to the app launcher because the system now automatically pins apps for you based on usage. Any app added automatically can be unpinned at any time.</LI>\n<LI>In the previous experience, apps were removed after they were unused for a certain period of time. In the updated experience, apps will remain until manually unpinned.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_2.png\" style=\"width: 687px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168973i5A0AE587B3DD5417/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_2.png\" alt=\"Figure 3 - Office 365 gallery\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 3 - Office 365 gallery</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We’re also rolling out a change that provides admins through the Azure Active Directory portal with the ability to group apps and customize the view of the Office 365 gallery. The Office 365 gallery enables you to explore and learn about available applications. This customization can be done via the “collections” blade in the Azure Active Directory admin portal. For information on how to do this, see&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/manage-apps/access-panel-collections\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create collections on the My Apps portal</A>.</P>\n<P><BR />Customers will see these changes rolled out soon. We welcome your comments and feedback so be sure to let us know what you think of these changes.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>--The Office.com and app launcher team</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 04 Feb 2020 17:41:54 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168970i4DC90E7CA5689BD6/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"436578ebb95d6a428a82b7d989e3947f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn91@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-41-575_befec3cb89db50c0.webp","destWidth":687,"destHeight":378,"sourceBytes":105974,"destBytes":19596,"author":"Scott Schnoll","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168970i4DC90E7CA5689BD6/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn91@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-41-575_befec3cb89db50c0.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168972i3AA76CBA0096946C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn4@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-42-907_3e2b2eb0da52b183.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168973i5A0AE587B3DD5417/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-47-315_183472fe71e7bb9f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639094},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"OneNote in 2018","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/onenote-in-2018/ba-p/312793","description":"<P>What a year 2018 was for OneNote! The product team worked hard to bring you features across our platforms for a more reliable, personal, and powerful OneNote. From fun additions like stickers in Mac, to powerful features like insert picture from camera for web, we hope you enjoyed the work we did last year. Many of these features came directly from our users’ feedback, and the team is always grateful to have such passionate fans who are as dedicated to making OneNote awesome as we are.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Here is a sample list of features added in 2018 to help you use OneNote the way <EM>you</EM> need it:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Tag search</LI>\n<LI>Roaming custom tags that sync across devices</LI>\n<LI>Customizable settings from autocorrect options (web) to default paste options (Windows 10)</LI>\n<LI>Support for small and large eraser sizes</LI>\n<LI>Clipboard options to Home tab</LI>\n<LI>Show/hide source link in settings when they copy/paste (Windows 10)</LI>\n<LI>Recent notebook provider</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>While we worked hard to bring the list above (and more) to make OneNote a better tool for all users, we also added some features – like the ones listed below (and more!) – to make OneNote a more powerful tool for whatever you may need it for:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Faster sync</LI>\n<LI>Faster search with improved indexer</LI>\n<LI>Math capabilities, such as complex numbers in Math Solver, multiple functions on one graph, and Ink math assistant (web)</LI>\n<LI>Accessibility checker</LI>\n<LI>Office Lens in OneNote mobile (iOS)</LI>\n<LI>PDF Printout: insert multiple files via drag-and-drop and the file picker</LI>\n<LI>Copy link and share to section (web)</LI>\n<LI>Roaming Ink toolbox</LI>\n<LI>Lasso tool to select, move, resize in Ink mode on mobile (Android)</LI>\n<LI>Table sorting in Mac</LI>\n<LI>Sticky Notes synced in OneNote mobile</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thank you for following OneNote on an incredible journey in 2018. The product would not be what it is without you, our users and fans. We deeply appreciate your feedback and do take each of them to heart. As always, leave any comments down below and we look forward to making OneNote an even better tool for you to remember, think, organize, and achieve in 2019 and onward!</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 15 Jan 2019 17:58:37 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"7972675d07990616d350fe925367bd38","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Jee Soo Han","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639101},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Office 365 ProPlus Deployment and Proxy Server Guidance","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/office-365-proplus-deployment-and-proxy-server-guidance/ba-p/849164","description":"<P>By far, the most important prerequisite for successful Office 365 ProPlus deployment is network configuration.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Unlike older versions of Office, Office 365 ProPlus was designed from the ground up to work with cloud services such as Microsoft Content Delivery Network (CDN).&nbsp; Microsoft recommends IT Pros “Bypass or white list endpoints on network devices and services that perform traffic interception, SSL decryption, deep packet inspection and content filtering” when accessing Microsoft Office 365 service endpoints. &nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We often find customers apply “legacy” network configurations for on-premises only products to Office 365 ProPlus which can lead to slower product adoption, poor product performance, and higher cost of ownership.&nbsp; The network requirements are documented in&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/urls-and-ip-address-ranges\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 URLs and IP address ranges document.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The goal of this blog is to clarify how IT Pros can optimize Office 365 ProPlus deployments with a proxy server in order to leverage a new concept called <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/fieldnotes/build-dynamic-lean-universal-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hybrid or “Lean Installs”.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In terms of Office 365 ProPlus general deployment, we have several broad approaches. We’re going to focus on the 3<SUP>rd</SUP> option, \"SCCM with Office CDN fallback\" or \"Lean Install\".</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>On-premises only</STRONG> – download and mirror all content from CDN on-premises. Enterprise customers have a variety of install packages (Base Office, Visio, Project, Visio + Project, second installs for languages).&nbsp; All Office 365 ProPlus builds are cumulative and are updated monthly which can make this cumbersome and difficult to maintain as each permutation requires refreshed content.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Cloud only</STRONG> – installations from the Office portal and update workflow occur using CDN. End users in the enterprise are normally not Administrators so self-service installations from portal.office.com are blocked.&nbsp; Further, installation from CDN doesn’t currently support custom configuration files to exclude applications and so forth.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Building-dynamic-lean-amp-universal-packages-for-Office-365/ba-p/839658\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SCCM with Office CDN fallback or “Lean Install”</A> – IT Pros use SCCM (which has elevated permissions and allows custom configuration.xml files) to deploy Office 365 ProPlus but can either omit all or portions of the installation source and use CDN content.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 76px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/131184iE89254BAD76703A4/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"SCCM is not a requirement to adopt “Lean Install” approach.  If you are using 3rd party deployment tool, identify user context of process using process monitor and adopt proxy strategy below.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">SCCM is not a requirement to adopt “Lean Install” approach.  If you are using 3rd party deployment tool, identify user context of process using process monitor and adopt proxy strategy below.</span></span></P>\n<P>Lean install examples:</P>\n<P><STRONG>1<SUP>st</SUP> Install</STRONG></P>\n<P>SCCM package contains all Office 365 ProPlus content and only subset of languages. You support 12 languages but only include two primary languages in the application source to minimize content and include <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/configuration-options-for-the-office-2016-deployment-tool\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">AllowCdnFallback</A> as Enabled within configuration.xml.&nbsp; During the Office 365 ProPlus installation process, the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/ODT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office Deployment Tool</A> (ODT) looks first for source files in local working directory. If the language pack files required aren’t available in local source location and the AllowCdnFallback setting within configuration.xml is set to True, then the ODT will leverage the Office CDN for the missing ones.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>2<SUP>nd</SUP> Install </STRONG></P>\n<P>Office may need to be reconfigured to <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/New-feature-Make-changes-to-Office-deployments-without-changing/ba-p/816482\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">make changes to Office deployments without changing the version, like adding a language or Project/Visio</A>. In this case, we only want the required bits to perform the change and nothing else.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>All example scenarios above depend on the CDN to fetch content when embracing these new “Lean Install” approaches.&nbsp; The primary reason we want to lean on the CDN is because it allows Office 365 ProPlus to only download the bits it requires for the change request resulting in the smallest network payload possible.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Exploring 2<SUP>nd</SUP><SPAN style=\"font-size: 12px;\">&nbsp;</SPAN>Install Scenario in detail in terms of content size:</STRONG></P>\n<P>IT Pro wants to perform a 2<SUP>nd</SUP> install to add Project to an existing Office 365 ProPlus installation on one machine.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If we use <STRONG>SCCM on-premises only strategy</STRONG>:</P>\n<P>SCCM will download full Office content from CDN ~2GB.&nbsp; SCCM will then copy this content to all distribution points to support scenario.&nbsp; Let’s assume an enterprise customer has 50 distribution points, 2 GB * 50 = <STRONG>100 <U>GB</U></STRONG> per month <U>every</U> month (build needs to be up to date as to not downgrade client introducing security concerns).&nbsp; Office 365 ProPlus builds are cumulative, irrespective of channel, so this content changes each month.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If we use <STRONG>SCCM with Office CDN fallback</STRONG>:</P>\n<P>SCCM calls ODT Setup.exe /configure to add Project, only <STRONG>~41 <U>MB</U></STRONG> will be downloaded from CDN instead of ~2GB (without language packs).&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 76px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/131185i1A631978DDAAB9AE/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"Make sure to use MatchInstalled parameter in your XML.  Ensure Delivery Optimization is working for further efficiency.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Make sure to use MatchInstalled parameter in your XML.  Ensure Delivery Optimization is working for further efficiency.</span></span></P>\n<P>We expect most customers will download and cache all Office 365 ProPlus content one time to existing machines to perform an upgrade to Office 365 ProPlus but once installed we recommend to leverage the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Building-dynamic-lean-amp-universal-packages-for-Office-365/ba-p/839658\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">lean technique</A> going forward.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 76px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/131186i828A29E449B75CA6/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"Having “lean” applications in SCCM also means they rarely need to be updated.  An occasional refresh of the Office Deployment Tool (ODT) is good idea. (Less than 10 MB)\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Having “lean” applications in SCCM also means they rarely need to be updated.  An occasional refresh of the Office Deployment Tool (ODT) is good idea. (Less than 10 MB)</span></span></P>\n<P>Tip: There are several ODT features which can benefit from approach (<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/configuration-options-for-the-office-2016-deployment-tool\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FallbacktoCDN, MatchPreviousMSI, MatchInstalled, MatchOS</A>)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Proxy Challenge</H2>\n<P>It seems there are an infinite number of ways customers secure egress traffic to internet for security and compliance.&nbsp; Some don't configure a proxy within Windows and some do.&nbsp; The Office team is always looking for opportunities to reduce network friction where possible.&nbsp; One example is product change in terms of transport used from BITS to <A title=\"Delivery Optimization and Office 365 ProPlus\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/delivery-optimization\" target=\"_self\">Delivery Optimization (DO)</A> with fallback when downloading files during product installation and update workflow.&nbsp; Delivery Optimization provides user impersonation which will allow connectivity to internet when an interactive user is logged on with WinINET internet access even if System account has no internet access.&nbsp; By default, Delivery Optimization as a technology was designed to&nbsp;<SPAN>download portions of the content from peers in their network.&nbsp; Customers who have investments in SCCM can enable&nbsp;<A title=\"Microsoft Connected Cache in Configuration Manager\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/configmgr/core/plan-design/hierarchy/microsoft-connected-cache\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Connected Cache in Configuration Manager</A>&nbsp;which can be a powerful combination of these technologies.&nbsp; In this way, Office can leverage Windows network stack feature Delivery Optimization and combine that with Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager for increased network efficiency.&nbsp; Customers can use&nbsp;<A title=\"Delivery Optimization in Update Compliance\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/update-compliance-delivery-optimization\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Delivery Optimization in Update Compliance</A>&nbsp;dashboard to see metrics about Office peer sharing efficiency.&nbsp; SCCM IT Pros can reduce operational costs by eliminating need to manually download and distribute static content to Distribution Points and allow Office to dynamically populate cache based on their needs regardless of channel or version and at the same time remain in control of what versions of Office are deployed to their clients.&nbsp; The transport change to Delivery Optimization for Office downloads is currently rolling out now and should be completed by July 2020 in Semi-Annual Channel.&nbsp; IT Pros don't need to do anything intentional to take advantage of these enhancements.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Many customers we visit in the field prohibit computers from accessing the internet directly.&nbsp; Typically, only Users can access the internet through a proxy server or via PAC file.&nbsp; These User settings are defined as WinINET proxy setting you’ll find in Internet Explorer.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"WinINET.png\" style=\"width: 248px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/131187iE0E844D30B458F7A/image-dimensions/248x218?v=1.0\" width=\"248\" height=\"218\" title=\"WinINET.png\" alt=\"Standard proxy configuration in Internet Explorer\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Standard proxy configuration in Internet Explorer</span></span></P>\n<P>So, what about the local SYSTEM account needed by SCCM?&nbsp; If customers allow users and computers access to Office 365 endpoints, everything “just works”.&nbsp; However, often we find customers only configure network proxy for Users and therefore the “lean install” or update scenarios driven by Office Automatic Updates 2.0 scheduled task may fail when user is not interactively logged on as user impersonation is not possible. (Example: Installation will hang as Office Deployment Tool running as System process will fail when attempting to access Office CDN)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>OK, what can we do to solve problem?&nbsp; Configure network perimeter device to white list Office CDN\\URLs or configure additional proxy settings within Windows.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Alternatives:</STRONG></P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Configure WinHTTP proxy (if no interactive user) as DO runs as Network Service</LI>\n<LI>If DO fails, attempt to fallback to BITS will respect WinINET for System account</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>*Installs and Updates can still succeed without System proxy via User Impersonation (leverages DO transport to provide feature) through interactive logged on user session who does have internet access but this can limit ability to perform deployments after hours when no user session is present or ensuring update compliance if computers are not logged on regularly.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 76px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/131188i51C2E95C4A778A1D/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"In my lab I use PSEXEC.EXE to accelerate testing.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">In my lab I use PSEXEC.EXE to accelerate testing.</span></span></P>\n<P>From elevated command prompt, run PSEXEC.EXE -s -i cmd.exe.&nbsp; This will launch cmd.exe process in the SYSTEM context to simulate SCCM package etc.&nbsp; Type whoami from command line to verify.</P>\n<PRE><FONT face=\"courier new,courier\" size=\"2\">C:\\Windows\\System32&gt;whoami</FONT><BR /><FONT face=\"courier new,courier\" size=\"2\">nt authority\\system</FONT></PRE>\n<P>Sample commands to set WinINET and import into WinHTTP:</P>\n<PRE><FONT face=\"courier new,courier\" size=\"2\">C:\\Windows\\System32&gt;bitsadmin /util /setieproxy localsystem MANUAL_PROXY proxy.contoso.com:8080 \";*.contoso.com\"</FONT><BR /><FONT face=\"courier new,courier\" size=\"2\">C:\\Windows\\System32&gt;netsh.exe winhttp import proxy source=ie</FONT></PRE>\n<P>Sample commands to reset:</P>\n<PRE><FONT face=\"courier new,courier\" size=\"2\">C:\\windows\\system32&gt;bitsadmin /util /setieproxy localsystem RESET</FONT><BR /><FONT face=\"courier new,courier\" size=\"2\">C:\\windows\\system32&gt;netsh winhttp reset proxy</FONT></PRE>\n<P>The proxy server\\network team should only allow computer access to internet URLs as defined by <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/urls-and-ip-address-ranges\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 URLs and IP address ranges document</A> as well as any other URLs that they want to explicitly allow the Computer account to access.&nbsp; A number of network appliance vendors provide seamless Office 365 integration as a feature by calling Microsoft Graph API to dynamically populate network access list.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In summary, using a “lean” Office 365 ProPlus deployment strategy will greatly reduce complexity and cost of ownership to operate Office 365 ProPlus.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Additional Reference Documentation and tools for proxy configuration for Windows</P>\n<P><A title=\"Office 365 Network Onboarding tool\" href=\"https://connectivity.office.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 Network Onboarding tool</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4494447/use-group-policy-to-apply-winhttp-proxy-settings-to-clients\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Use Group Policy to apply WinHTTP proxy settings to Windows clients</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/bitsadmin-util-and-setieproxy\" target=\"_blank\" In this session, Tara Hanratty, a Senior Program Manager in Microsoft Ireland who focuses on helping enterprises address compatibility concerns, will discuss best practices for upgrading to Office 365 ProPlus, including:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Evaluating Office readiness</LI>\n<LI>Using the Readiness Toolkit for advanced VBA readiness</LI>\n<LI>Discovering and remediating issues</LI>\n<LI>Deploying to “ready devices” with the right settings</LI>\n<LI>Identifying optimal pilots to unblock more devices</LI>\n<LI>Viewing health on deployed devices</LI>\n<LI>Viewing unblocked devices</LI>\n<LI>Advanced plug-in reports (accessibility)</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG><BR /><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions/79039?source=sessions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Get to know the new Office Cloud Policy Service (THR3038)</A></STRONG>. Office uses the power of the Microsoft Cloud to deliver exciting new capabilities to individuals and organizations. Diagnostic data helps Microsoft keep Office and these experiences secure, up to date, and performing as customers expect. Some organizations have wondered what happens to this data, how it's used, and how they might control the flow. Revolutionary change in product transparency over the past year means commercial customer IT departments can now control this data. In this session, you’ll gain a deep understanding about diagnostic data, identify the benefits of diagnostic data to your organization, learn about you can view and manage this data, and hear from a customer that has implemented the controls. This session is presented by Brian Albrecht and Steve Conn. Brian runs the Microsoft Office Data, Privacy, and Insights PM Team and is responsible for diagnostic data privacy and compliance with GDPR and next generation privacy regulations across the Office 365 client experiences. Steve has worked on Office and Windows in various marketing and engineering roles for 12 years.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><STRONG>The future of Office: The insiders view and how we're making it easier for IT admins and organizations to deploy and use Office 365 ProPlus <A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions/82839?source=sessions\" target=\"_self\">(BRK3298)</A></STRONG>. the way you want it</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;to.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>That’s why&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>this week we are rolling out <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/bb81fb88-968d-4c1a-818d-eec590deadef\" target=\"_self\"><STRONG>Dark Mode</STRONG></A></SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/bb81fb88-968d-4c1a-818d-eec590deadef\" target=\"_self\"><STRONG>&nbsp;for OneNote 2016</STRONG></A><SPAN>.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>This will be available for Office 365 subscribers and non-volume licensing Office 2019 customers.</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;Dark Mode changes the app’s interface elements from light to dark. Using OneNote in this mode can improve readability in low light environments, increase legibility of the user interface as well as your notes, provide better contrast, and reduce eye strain.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>You might also use OneNote in Dark Mode simply as a personal preference</SPAN><SPAN>. The choice is yours!</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P><P>&nbsp;</P><P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"OneNote_2016_DarkMode(CROP)\" style=\"width: 768px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154673i6134F6BA27E6AAF2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OneNote_2016_DarkMode(CROP)\" alt=\"OneNote_2016_DarkMode(CROP)\" /></span></P><P>&nbsp;</P><P><SPAN>We’re excited&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>about today’s announcements and we’ll&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>keep listening to you</SPAN><SPAN>r feedback</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;to make your OneNote better and better</SPAN><SPAN>! Please continue requesting features and telling us what you think via the in-app feedback</SPAN><SPAN>.</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P><P>&nbsp;</P><P><SPAN>For more information&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>check out&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Frequently-Asked-Questions-about-OneNote-and-Office-2019-6582c7ae-2ec6-408d-8b7a-3ed71a3c2103\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN>our&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>OneNote&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>FAQ</SPAN></A><SPAN>!</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 05 Nov 2019 02:04:06 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154673i6134F6BA27E6AAF2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"3e7d0415762169f4c686870a9259da7c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn22@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-50-40-094_05c205b5b5fcc25a.webp","destWidth":768,"destHeight":511,"sourceBytes":245658,"destBytes":45482,"author":"OneNotePM","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154673i6134F6BA27E6AAF2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn22@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-50-40-094_05c205b5b5fcc25a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639096},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"How to secure your remote workers with Office Cloud Policy Service","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-secure-your-remote-workers-with-office-cloud-policy/ba-p/1308579","description":"<P>With more and more users working from home, organizations are facing new security and privacy challenges. One of them might be, that users are working on unmanaged, maybe personal devices accessing corporate data. Classic technologies like Active Directory Group Policy Management do not help in such scenarios, as these do not apply to unmanaged devices.</P>\n<P><BR />This blog post will provide guidance on how to leverage the Office cloud policy service (OCPS) to address those scenarios. OCPS allows an admin to target a user with policies which follow them across all devices, regardless of the way the devices are managed (if at all). We will also share some recommended security settings which might be worth considering.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 1 – Enable OCPS</H2>\n<P>The <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-office-cloud-policy-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office cloud policy service (OCPS)</A> is a cloud-based service that enables you to apply policy settings for Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise (formally known as Office 365 ProPlus) on a user’s device. The policy settings roam to whichever device the user signs into and uses Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise. This applies whether the device is managed through on-premises domain devices, as a Azure AD registered, Azure AD Joined, or Hybrid Azure AD joined device.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You should start by verifying <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-office-cloud-policy-service#requirements-for-using-the-office-cloud-policy-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the requirements</A>:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Supported version of Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise deployed</LI>\n<LI>Licensed for Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise</LI>\n<LI>At least one <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/fundamentals/active-directory-manage-groups\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Azure AD group</A> which contains the users you're targeting.</LI>\n<LI>An admin user with at least the Office Apps Admin role assigned</LI>\n<LI>Clients must be able to reach&nbsp;<SPAN>these URLs:&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>*.manage.microsoft.com, *.officeconfig.msocdn.com, config.office.com over 443</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Sign in on <A href=\"https://config.office.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://config.office.com</A> and accept the EULA for OCPS. If you're using Intune, you can also use the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://devicemanagement.microsoft.com/#blade/Microsoft_Intune_DeviceSettings/AppsMenu/officeProPlusPolicies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Policies for Office apps</A>&nbsp;blade. That’s it. No more prep work needed.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_2.jpg\" style=\"width: 940px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184457i9DD4E5F414789F7B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_2.jpg\" alt=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_2.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 2 – Create a policy configuration and assign to users</H2>\n<P>Now y<SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">ou should create your first policy configuration and assign it to a group of users:</SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Expand the <STRONG>Customization node</STRONG> and select <STRONG>Policy Management</STRONG></LI>\n<LI>On the Policy configurations page, choose <STRONG>Create</STRONG> and provide a name and a description (optional)</LI>\n<LI>In <STRONG>Assignments</STRONG>, choose whether this policy applies to users of locally installed Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise, or just to users who anonymously access documents using Office for the web.</LI>\n<LI>Select the AAD-based security group that is assigned to the policy configuration. Each policy configuration can only be assigned to one group, and each group can only be assigned one policy configuration.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_3.jpg\" style=\"width: 940px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184459iD203B5D6B4A39389/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_3.jpg\" alt=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_3.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We also have <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9w8LzBFvjQY&amp;t=195s\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a video ready for you</A> which walks you through these steps.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 3 – Set policies</H2>\n<P>After clicking on <STRONG>Configure policies</STRONG> you can start to search for and configure policies. Please note that most policies are only applicable to Office on Windows, but some are applicable cross-platform as noted in the platform column in the policy list.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As a starting point, you can filter the <STRONG>Recommendation</STRONG> column to view the recommended Microsoft Security baseline policies. Click on each policy name to view the description and decide if you want to keep the baseline’s recommended value or manually configure it. The reviewed items will switch the <STRONG>Status</STRONG> to <STRONG>Configured</STRONG> when applied.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_4.jpg\" style=\"width: 940px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184460i5492A893921D3AD6/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_4.jpg\" alt=\"Secure_remote_devices_w_OCPS_4.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Especially for the scenario of remote workers, here are some policies you might want to have a closer look at:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<TABLE border=\"1\" width=\"100%\">\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\"><STRONG>Policy Name</STRONG></TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\"><STRONG>Comment</STRONG></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Block signing into Office</TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Can be used to prevent users from being signed in with a corporate and personal account at the same time in order to prevent data leakage to e.g. a personal OneDrive.</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Hide file locations when opening or saving files</TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Setting to “Hide local PC” will discourage users from saving corporate data to the maybe non-corporate device.</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Disable VBA for Office applications</TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\">VBA/macros are powerful tools and can help automate data processing or entry. But it is also used for malicious attacks and might be better prevented to run on non-managed/remote devices.</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Do not open files from the Internet zone in Protected View</TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\">If set to “Disabled”, Office files downloaded from the internet will always be opened in Protected View first.</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Set document behavior if file validation fails</TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Admins can enforce Protected View for files which failed validation. Those files could e.g. try to exploit Office through malformed documents.</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Allow the use of connected experiences in Office, et al.</TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Admins can control if Office is allowed to leverage cloud services for downloading and analyzing content. <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/privacy/overview-privacy-controls\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Review documentation</A> for available controls.</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\">Force Runtime AV Scan</TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\">If enabled, all files opened by Office will be passed to the installed AV engine for scanning.</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>Use Cached Exchange Mode for new and existing Outlook profiles</TD>\n<TD>You can use this policy to enforce Online Mode for Exchange in order to prevent users from syncing down their inbox content to a maybe insecure device. Note that this setting will apply to all devices the user is signing into.</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD>Block all unmanaged add-ins</TD>\n<TD>This setting allows you to block all add-ins from being loaded by Office.</TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 4 – Additional considerations</H2>\n<P>As policies configured through OCPS are following the user across all devices, it is not limited to remote workers or users on un-managed devices. You should consider folding your on-prem policies into OCPS policies and go forward with a single solution for both on-prem as well as off-prem users.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If multiple sets of policies are applied to a user/device, Office will evaluate the applicable settings following these rules:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Winning configuration is evaluated per individual setting, not per object.</LI>\n<LI>OCPS-set policies win over AD-based settings.</LI>\n<LI>If multiple OCPS-based policies are applied, the priority configured in the OCPS service is applied.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Once you have deployed OCPS policies, you can also enable the <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2088532\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Security Policy Advisor</A> to get further insights into high impactful these changes are for your users. Maybe there are opportunities to further tightening it up without impacting users. We have a <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/boost-security-of-your-remote-workers-with-confidence-using/ba-p/1552909\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SPA walkthrough guide</A>&nbsp;for you as well.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Overview of blog post series</H2>\n<P>This post is part of a series which is covering different stages and phases in the Office lifecycle in remote worker/work from home scenarios. The others are:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/deploy-office-365-proplus-to-remote-workers/ba-p/1258514\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">How to upgrade from legacy to Microsoft 365 Apps for remote workers using VPN</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/configuring-office-365-proplus-updates-for-remote-workers-using/ba-p/1253491\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Configuring Microsoft 365 Apps updates for remote workers using VPN</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/fieldnotes/build-dynamic-lean-universal-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Maintaining installations in terms of adding e.g. Project, Visio or additional Language Packs for remote workers</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>We hope this will help you to minimize the impact of deploying, servicing and managing Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise on your own network and your user’s VPN connections.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>FAQ</H2>\n<P><STRONG>Q: Am I secure after enabling OCPS and setting the Microsoft recommended policies?</STRONG><BR />A: “Being secure” is a relative state where you can try to achieve a high bar, but basically never be 100% secure. Using OCPS is one building block in a broader strategy to secure remote workers. In addition make sure to review <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/authentication/concept-mfa-howitworks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Azure Multi-Factor Authentication</A>, <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Azure Conditional Access</A> and the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/reports-monitoring/concept-risky-sign-ins\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">user’s sign-in risk assessment</A> to further protect the user’s identity. For guidance on protecting your corporate data, please review <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/information-protection/what-is-information-protection\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Azure Information Protection</A>.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Q: I’ve got issues with OCPS, how can I troubleshoot the service?</STRONG><BR />A: We got you covered, please review <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/troubleshooting-office-cloud-policy-service-ocps/ba-p/1070242\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Troubleshooting OCPS on Windows</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Q: Can I fully secure a device not owned by my organization?</STRONG><BR />A: There are limits on how secure a device that you don’t own or manage can be. Each employed security technology raises the bar for an attack/exploit on the device/user/data successfully, but unless you fully manage the device there is a risk to your data. Security is sometimes not about secure/not secure, but more about the right level of security for a given scenario. You can use <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/fundamentals/what-is-intune\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Intune</A> to manage devices that you don’t own.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Q: Can I also secure and control Office on iOS or Android using OCPS?</STRONG><BR />A: While some policies also apply to Office on Android or iOS, there are more advanced controls available through <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/app-protection-policy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Intune Application policies</A>. These allow you to e.g. enforce a PIN, local data encryption of cloud-only storage of data for the Office apps on mobile devices.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Q: We’re an Intune shop, can I also use Intune to manage OCPS policies?</STRONG><BR />A: Sure thing. You can manage the <A href=\"https://devicemanagement.microsoft.com/#blade/Microsoft_Intune_DeviceSettings/AppsMenu/officeProPlusPolicies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Policies for Office apps</A> from the Intune portal as well.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Q: Can we use OCPS to block syncing OneDrive for Business content on devices which aren’t managed?</STRONG></P>\n<P>A: No. However, we can address this concern by having your Office 365 tenant administrator running <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/sharepoint-online/set-spotenantsyncclientrestriction?view=sharepoint-ps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Set-SPOTenantSyncClientRestriction</A> cmdlet. This permits adding restrictions on whether users can sync items to non-domain joined machines.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>The Authors</H2>\n<P>This blog post is brought to you by the Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise Ranger Team at Microsoft. Feel free to share your questions and feedback in the comments below.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 29 Jul 2020 13:10:56 365","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/announcing-3d-content-guidelines-for-office-365/ba-p/431876","description":"<P>Since 3D was first introduced in Office, we’ve heard resounding feedback from the community that better guidance was needed to help users acquire, build and convert 3D content for use in Office. Whether you are an Office user looking to acquire 3D assets for your documents, or a 3D professional creating content for your clients, we are pleased to announce that the <A href=\"http://aka.ms/3DContentGuidelines\" target=\"_self\">3D Content Guidelines for Microsoft</A> are now publicly available, and have been developed to help users be more successful with 3D in Office.<BR /><BR />Download the guide in <A href=\"http://aka.ms/3DContentGuidelines\" target=\"_self\">PPT format</A><BR />Download the guide in <A href=\"https://aka.ms/3DContentGuidelines_PDF\" target=\"_self\">PDF format</A><BR /><BR />Customer connections were the key to defining the scope of what the guidelines cover. These connections gave us the opportunity to understand the friction points first-hand, provide immediate support to keep customers moving forward, and roll those learnings back into the guidelines.</P>\n<P><BR />The 3D Content Guidelines for Microsoft are split into four major sections and can be read in sequence or independently depending on what you would like to accomplish.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>3D engine overview</STRONG><BR />Learn about the inner workings of the real-time 3D engine used in Office and how it compares to other methods of rendering 3D content.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3D Engine Overview.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/108380iB2CC364083644104/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3D Engine Overview.png\" alt=\"3D Engine Overview.png\" /></span><BR /><STRONG>Sourcing assets</STRONG><BR />Learn tips and tricks for finding quality 3D content in online marketplaces and best practices when working with third party vendors to build custom 3D assets.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Sourcing Assets.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/108381i123A9C465ACF1630/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Sourcing Assets.png\" alt=\"Sourcing Assets.png\" /></span><BR /><BR /><STRONG>Content creation</STRONG><BR />Step through the process of creating custom 3D content for real-time rendering in Office. From modelling, surfacing and animation guidance for new content, to exporting, converting and optimizing existing 3D content, this section will help to ensure that 3D assets targeted for Office will render optimally.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"ContentCreation1.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/108382iF612A2A16AC6CF6F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"ContentCreation1.png\" alt=\"ContentCreation1.png\" /></span><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Content Creation2.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/108383iA72643391E15A9FF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Content Creation2.png\" alt=\"Content Creation2.png\" /></span><BR /><BR /><STRONG>Additional Resources</STRONG><BR />Discover tools for viewing, analyzing and validating your 3D content as well as links to other valuable resources.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"AdditionalResources.png\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/108384i84C74E14F2FB2C61/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"AdditionalResources.png\" alt=\"AdditionalResources.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><BR />While today's version of the guidelines is focused on Office, the vision is to expand the scope and include other Microsoft products and services in the future. We believe these guidelines will be a good connection point between many of the great existing resources and look forward to continuing to evolve them to meet the growing needs of all our users. Please check them out!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: transparent; color: #333333; cursor: text; font-family: 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"OneNote: March 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/onenote-march-2019/ba-p/388879","description":"<P>This month in OneNote, we want to highlight three recent features added across platforms. From new navigation, to roundtrip editing of embedded files and phrase search, find exactly what you need and stay in the flow with OneNote.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>A new look for navigation</H2>\n<P>We heard the user feedback and incorporated some new elements to navigation in OneNote for Mac and OneNote for Windows 10. In the updated navigation, switch easily between your notebooks, search results and recent notes using the buttons along the left-hand rail and use the drop-down button across the top of sections and pages to view additional notebooks. If you want to maximize your canvas, you can hide navigation by clicking the notebooks icon at the top of the left rail. Click the icon again when you need to navigate your way to another page, section or notebook.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OneNote March.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100154i96A483178752B194/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OneNote March.jpg\" alt=\"OneNote March.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The updated navigation is currently rolling out to all users on Mac and available for Office Insiders on Windows 10. It will be available to all Windows users in the next few weeks. We are working to bring this update to OneNote Online and OneNote for iPad as well.&nbsp;See <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/ab84fcc2-f845-41ac-9c29-89b0720c8eb3\" target=\"_self\">here</A> for a detailed refresher on the updated navigation.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Edit embedded files seamlessly</H2>\n<P>Starting this month, you can edit files embedded in notebooks more easily on OneNote for Windows 10. Users will be able to open files, make edits and have those changes saved seamlessly without having to save a new version or re-embed into the notebook.</P>\n<P>To try this feature, open a file embedded in a notebook and make edits. Don’t worry about saving the new changes as a separate file and re-attaching to your notebook – your changes are already synced and ready to be viewed in OneNote! Make sure AutoSave is on, edit what you want, and close the file when you’re done. The next time someone opens the file from the notebook, those latest changes will be there.</P>\n<P>This feature will be rolling out to all users on OneNote for Windows 10 over the next few weeks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Search for exactly what you need</H2>\n<P>We’re continuously working to make OneNote’s search experience even better with each new feature. Our newest addition to search capabilities: phrase search. To try it today, open the search pane and put a phrase between quotations to get more relevant search results. Putting your search terms in quotations searches for exactly those words in that order rather than each word separately, providing more relevant search results.</P>\n<P>This feature is available for all users across platforms, so try searching for exact phrases in quotation marks to find exactly what you need across sections and pages!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Relativistic Physics.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100157iCAE0902EF7672FA1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Relativistic Physics.png\" alt=\"Relativistic Physics.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We hope you enjoy the latest updates on OneNote and look forward to hearing your feedback. border-width: 100%;\">\n<DIV style=\"direction: ltr; margin-top: 0in; margin-left: 0in; width: 7.9569in;\">\n<DIV style=\"direction: ltr; margin-top: 0in; margin-left: 0in; width: 7.9569in;\">\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">In order to drive consistent protection for US Government information, employees, and infrastructure, the Department of Homeland Security issued requirements for Federal agencies using email and web services. The <A href=\"https://cyber.dhs.gov/\" target=\"_blank\">\"Enhance Email and Web Security\" Binding Operational Directive (BOD 18-01)</A> outlines specific controls and configurations to be applied to email servers and web services within 30, 60, and 120 days of issuance.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">The Department of Homeland Security is responsible for developing and enforcing binding operational directives under the Federal Information Security Modernization Act of 2014 (FISMA) (<A href=\"https://www.congress.gov/113/plaws/publ283/PLAW-113publ283.pdf#page=3\" target=\"_blank\">Id. § 3553(b)(2)</A>), and BODs are mandatory for federal, executive branch, departments and agencies (<A href=\"https://www.congress.gov/113/plaws/publ283/PLAW-113publ283.pdf#page=2\" target=\"_blank\">44 U.S.C. § 3552(b)(1)</A>). While the BOD 18-01 is not compulsory for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, or State and Local Governments, these policies and security protocols are strongly recommended and should be heeded by all agencies in public sector, as well as commercial companies.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">The cybersecurity requirements issued by the Department of Homeland Security will help protect information by enforcing encryption and more secure connections when government employees use internet systems for email and websites. Additionally, emails will require a digital signature that makes it harder to fake an email address to deliver malware or trick users into providing passwords. (Learn more in <A href=\"http://www.govtech.com/blogs/lohrmann-on-cybersecurity/dmarc-states-should-follow-federal-mandate-to-enhance-email-and-web-security.html\" target=\"_blank\">Dan Lohrmann's cybersecurity blog on govtech.com</A>)</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Microsoft's cloud makes it easy to enhance email and web security to comply with BOD 18-01. </SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">(Action may be required to configure SPF/DMARC policies. Resources can be found below.)</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic;\">All agencies are required to:</SPAN></P>\n<OL type=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: .375in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\" value=\"1\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Within 30 calendar days after issuance of this directive, develop and provide to DHS an “Agency Plan of Action for BOD 18-01” to:</SPAN></LI>\n<OL type=\"a\" style=\"margin-left: .375in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\" value=\"1\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Enhance email security by:</SPAN></LI>\n<OL type=\"i\" style=\"margin-left: .375in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\" value=\"1\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Within 90 days after issuance of this directive, configuring:</SPAN></LI>\n<OL type=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: .375in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\" value=\"1\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">All internet-facing mail servers to offer STARTTLS, and</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">All second-level agency domains to have valid SPF/DMARC records, with at minimum a DMARC policy of “p=none” and at least one address defined as a recipient of aggregate and/or failure reports.</SPAN></LI>\n</OL>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Within 120 days after issuance of this directive, ensuring:</SPAN></LI>\n<OL type=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: .375in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\" value=\"1\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Secure Sockets Layer (SSL)v2 and SSLv3 are disabled on mail servers, and</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">3DES and RC4 ciphers are disabled on mail servers.</SPAN></LI>\n</OL>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Within 15 days of the establishment of centralized National Cybersecurity &amp; Communications Integration Center (NCCIC) reporting location, adding the NCCIC as a recipient of DMARC aggregate reports.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Within one year after issuance of this directive, setting a DMARC policy of “reject” for all second-level domains and mail-sending hosts.</SPAN></LI>\n</OL>\n</OL>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Enhance web security by:</SPAN></LI>\n<OL type=\"a\" style=\"margin-left: .375in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\" value=\"1\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Within 120 days after issuance of this directive, ensuring:</SPAN></LI>\n<OL type=\"i\" style=\"margin-left: .375in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\" value=\"1\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">All publicly accessible Federal websites and web services provide service through a secure connection (HTTPS-only, with HSTS),</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">SSLv2 and SSLv3 are disabled on web servers, and</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">3DES and RC4 ciphers are disabled on web servers.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Identifying and providing a list to DHS of agency second-level domains that can be HSTS preloaded, for which HTTPS will be enforced for all subdomains.</SPAN></LI>\n</OL>\n</OL>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Upon delivery of its Agency Plan of Action for BOD 18-01 within 30 days of this directive per required action 1, begin implementing that plan.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle; font-style: italic;\"><SPAN style=\"font-style: italic; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">At 60 calendar days after issuance of this directive, provide a report to DHS on the status of that implementation. Continue to report every 30 calendar days thereafter until implementation of the agency’s BOD 18-01 plan is complete.</SPAN></LI>\n</OL>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-left: .375in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Source: <A href=\"https://cyber.dhs.gov/\" target=\"_blank\">https://cyber.dhs.gov/</A></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Email security with Exchange Online:</P>\n<UL style=\"margin-left: .3819in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle;\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Uses opportunistic TLS and possible to </SPAN><A href=\"https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms.exch.eac.connectorselection(v=exchg.150).aspx\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">force TLS</SPAN></A></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle;\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">SSLv2 and SSLv3 are disabled</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle;\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">RC4 cipher is disabled</SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle;\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">3DES cipher will be disabled in the future</SPAN></LI>\n<UL style=\"margin-left: .3819in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; vertical-align: middle;\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Enterprise / GCC:&nbsp;<EM>&nbsp;3DES cipher to be disabled with mandatory use of TLS 1.2 in Office 365.&nbsp; Please reference <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4057306/preparing-for-tls-1-2-in-office-365\" target=\"_blank\">Preparing for the mandatory use of TLS 1.2 in Office 365</A> for details.</EM></SPAN></LI>\n<LI style=\"margin-top: 0; font-family: 'Segoe UI Semibold'; font-size: 10.0pt; color: black;\">On disabling ciphers via GPO:</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; line-height: 13pt; font-family: 'Segoe UI'; font-size: 9.75pt;\"><SPAN style=\"color: #2a2a2a;\">This entry does not exist in the registry by default. For information about ciphers that are used by the Schannel SSP, see&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn786419(v=ws.11).aspx\" target=\"_blank\">Supported Cipher Suites and Protocols in the Schannel SSP</A><SPAN style=\"color: #2a2a2a;\">.</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; line-height: 13pt; font-family: 'Segoe UI'; font-size: 9.75pt; color: #2a2a2a;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; line-height: 13pt; font-family: 'Segoe UI'; font-size: 9.75pt; color: #2a2a2a;\">Registry path: HKLM SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Control\\SecurityProviders\\SCHANNEL</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; line-height: 13pt; font-family: 'Segoe UI'; font-size: 9.75pt; color: #2a2a2a;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; line-height: 13pt; font-family: 'Segoe UI'; font-size: 9.75pt; color: #2a2a2a;\">To disable a cipher, create an&nbsp;Enabled&nbsp;entry in the appropriate subkey. This entry does not exist in the registry by default. After you have created the entry, change the DWORD value to 0. When you disable any algorithm, you disallow all cipher suites that use that algorithm. To enable the cipher, change the DWORD value to 1.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><CITE style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 9.0pt; color: #595959;\">Source: <A href=\"https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn786418(v=ws.11).aspx#BKMK_SchannelTR_Ciphers\" target=\"_blank\">https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn786418(v=ws.11).aspx#BKMK_SchannelTR_Ciphers</A></CITE></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11.0pt;\">Want to stay up to date on technology trends in government, Microsoft 365 for US Government product updates, and the musings of a Microsoft product manager? January 22, 2020 we&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/introducing-and-managing-microsoft-search-in-bing-through-office/ba-p/1110974\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">announced</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;in</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;advance that the Microsoft Search in Bing&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">browser&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">extension would be made available through Office 365&nbsp;ProPlus&nbsp;on Windows devices starting at the end of February.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Since then, we’ve heard from many customers who are excited about the&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://www.bing.com/business/explore\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">value Microsoft Search provides through Bing</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;and the simplicity of deploying that value through Office 365&nbsp;ProPlus.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">With Microsoft Search</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">integrated</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">, Bing becomes a single search engine for&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">users&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">to find what they need - both from inside their&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">organization</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;and the public web.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">But we’ve also heard concerns about the way we were planning to roll this value out</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">. Most importantly, we heard that customers don't want Office 365&nbsp;ProPlus&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">to&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">change search defaults without an opt-in,</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;and&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">they need a way to govern these changes on&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">unmanaged devices</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.&nbsp;&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Based on your feedback, we are making a few changes to our plan:</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;<BR /><BR /></SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"\" automatically deployed with Office 365&nbsp;ProPlus.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"\" data-font=\"Symbol\" data-listid=\"4\" aria-setsize=\"-1\" data-aria-posinset=\"2\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Through a new toggle in Microsoft 365 admin center, administrators will be able to opt in to deploy the browser extension to their organization through Office 365&nbsp;ProPlus.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"\" data-font=\"Symbol\" data-listid=\"4\" aria-setsize=\"-1\" data-aria-posinset=\"3\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">In the near term, Office 365&nbsp;ProPlus&nbsp;will only deploy the browser extension to AD-joined devices, even within organizations that have opted in.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">In the future we will add specific settings to govern the deployment of&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">the</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;extension to unmanaged devices</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-leveltext=\"\" data-font=\"Symbol\" data-listid=\"4\" aria-setsize=\"-1\" data-aria-posinset=\"4\" data-aria-level=\"1\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">We will continue to provide end users who receive the extension with control over their search engine preference</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;<BR /><BR /></SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Due 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Save your Office deployment configurations to the cloud","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/save-your-office-deployment-configurations-to-the-cloud/ba-p/671806","description":"<P>Keeping to our promise of continuous innovation and improvements to make Office deployment easier, our team released a new feature that allows you to save the deployment configurations that you create in the cloud.&nbsp; This allows you to create, edit and access your deployment configurations from one central location, your Office 365 tenant.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Annotation 2019-06-04 133148.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/117263i1E71F7CFFBAE3B0A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Annotation 2019-06-04 133148.png\" alt=\"Annotation 2019-06-04 133148.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Not only can you save your deployment configurations, but you can access them directly using an anonymous URL that can be copied from each deployment configuration and used with the Office Deployment Tool.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Annotation 2019-06-04 141421.png\" style=\"width: 763px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/117264i2352D841640DE995/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Annotation 2019-06-04 141421.png\" alt=\"Annotation 2019-06-04 141421.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This allows you to skip the step of downloading the XML and just reference it directly on the command line when executing the /configure, /download or /customize commands. &nbsp;The Office Deployment Tool will access the XML directly from your tenant using the anonymous access URL.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Annotation 2019-06-05 110845.png\" style=\"width: 420px;\"><img
