Hopkins","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/117263i1E71F7CFFBAE3B0A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn96@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-50-39-879_f5757fcb01d3f1b6.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/117264i2352D841640DE995/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-52-43-982_e38189bbb9c8673f.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/117269iFC9041ADDB182388/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn15@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-40-807_68ca8d7602f37a62.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639097},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"The new cloud-based policy management service for Office 365 ProPlus has been released!","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/the-new-cloud-based-policy-management-service-for-office-365/ba-p/480676","description":"<P>The <A href=\"http://aka.ms/o365clientmgmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office cloud policy service</A> allows administrators to define policies for Office 365 ProPlus and assign these policies to users via Azure Active Directory security groups.&nbsp; Once defined, policies are automatically enforced as users sign in and use Office 365 ProPlus.&nbsp; No need to be domain joined or MDM enrolled and works with corporate owned devices or BYOD.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Get started today by visiting and signing into the <A href=\"http://aka.ms/o365clientmgmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office cloud policy service</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Build a policy configuration</STRONG> that includes the policies you want to enforce, configured for your organization’s needs. &nbsp;The service is always up to date and includes the latest policies as they are released.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Target a group of users</STRONG> by assigning the policy configuration to a specific AAD security group.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Policies automatically enforced</STRONG> as users sign into Office 365 ProPlus.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Health reporting</STRONG> available for each of the policy configurations, letting administrators know that the policies are getting deployed to users and their devices.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"OCPS.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/109839iEC907B316DC4188A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OCPS.png\" alt=\"OCPS.png\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>This service is now generally available and supported for all Office 365 ProPlus customers.</STRONG>&nbsp; If you are an administrator, you can start using this service today by signing into the <A href=\"http://aka.ms/o365clientmgmt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office client management portal</A> and creating policy configurations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We are also excited to announce the public preview for the security policy advisor feature; an intelligent policy recommendation engine being added to the Office cloud policy service.&nbsp; <A href=\"https://aka.ms/spaannouncement\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Click here</A> for more information on the security policy advisor feature.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This service is just one of many new services which the Office team will be releasing over the next 12+ months.&nbsp; These services, which shape the foundation of the Office serviceability SDK, are designed to work with 1<SUP>st</SUP> and 3<SUP>rd</SUP> party management solutions to help administrators simplify and streamline Office deployment and management.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For additional documentation on how to use this new policy service and its capabilities take a look at this <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=2010017\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">document</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As always, please provide feedback using the feedback button to help us improve the service.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>FAQ:</H2>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG>Does the Office client policy service replace Group Policy management options?</STRONG><BR />No, this service provides an alternative to Group Policy management. Group Policy management enforces policies on Windows PCs joined to an Active Directory domain, while the Office client policy service only requires the user sign into Office using their corporate credentials (Azure Active Directory) along with a valid Office 365 ProPlus license. <BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>What are primary differences between the types of policies I can enforce using Office client policy service compared to Group Policy?</STRONG><BR />Office client policy service manages only user-based policies for Office 365 ProPlus. Group Policy can manage both user-based and machine-based policies.<BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>How does the Office client policy service compare with the Office Customization Tool for Click-to-Run’s application preferences settings?</STRONG><BR />The settings configured as part of Office installation using the Office Customization Tool for Click-to-Run – as well as previous OCT versions – are based on ‘preferences’, meaning that a user can change them. Office client policy service settings are enforced, like Group Policy enforcement.<BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>If I use Group Policy Management and the Office cloud policy service, how will conflicts be resolved?</STRONG><BR />The policies configured in the Office cloud policy service take precedence over any policies configured via Group Policy Management. If there are conflicts, the values specified in the Office cloud policy service for the conflicting policies will be honored.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL start=\"5\">\n<LI><STRONG>Can I import policies from Group Policy Management to Office cloud policy service?<BR /></STRONG>At this time we do not have import capabilities, but we are looking at providing this functionality to help admins migrate.<BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI><STRONG><STRONG>How is this different from the Administrative Templates feature in Intune for Device configuration<BR /></STRONG></STRONG>The Office cloud policy service is built specifically for managing Office policies in non-domain joined and non-MDM managed scenarios.&nbsp; Office cloud policy service is available to any customer that owns Office 365 ProPlus.&nbsp; If used with Intune, the policies configured in Office cloud policy service take precedence over any Office policies managed via Intune.</LI>\n</OL>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 23 Apr 2019 23:51:50 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/109839iEC907B316DC4188A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"f79a04943df7fbab8b9ef0199fe77aa1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn91@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-40-519_23e06fcd937703d5.webp","destWidth":998,"destHeight":675,"sourceBytes":204415,"destBytes":41562,"author":"Chris Hopkins","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/109839iEC907B316DC4188A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn91@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-40-519_23e06fcd937703d5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639099},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Now available: Multi-Geo in SharePoint and Office 365 Groups","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/now-available-multi-geo-in-sharepoint-and-office-365-groups/ba-p/263302","description":"<P><STRONG>Updated March 27, 2019</STRONG></P>\n<P>Today, we’re thrilled to announce the General Availability of Multi-Geo Capabilities in SharePoint Online and Office 365 Groups. The functionality has been in preview, and thanks to the invaluable feedback from our preview customers, it’s now ready for prime time.</P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>Multi-Geo in SharePoint and Groups enables global businesses control the country or region where shared resources like SharePoint Team Sites, Office 365 Groups content (associated SharePoint Sites and Groups mailboxes) are stored at-rest.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>Earlier this year we&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Security-Privacy-and-Compliance/Get-global-data-location-controls-with-Multi-Geo-Capabilities-in/ba-p/182710\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN>launched Multi-Geo in Exchange Online and OneDrive</SPAN></A><SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Security-Privacy-and-Compliance/Get-global-data-location-controls-with-Multi-Geo-Capabilities-in/ba-p/182710\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">,</A>&nbsp;giving control over the geo-location of user-attached resources like user’s mailbox and OneDrive files.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With more data residency measures being legislated around the world for cloud data, global businesses are challenged with meeting their data residency requirements and digitally transforming with the cloud.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Multi-Geo addresses these challenges by enabling a single Office 365 tenant to span multiple regions and/or countries and giving customers the flexibility to choose the country or region where each employee’s Office 365 data is stored at-rest. This helps businesses meet their global data residency needs and digitally transform with Office 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Configuring Multi-Geo in SharePoint</STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\"><STRONG>&nbsp;<LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Sk8mO0bLnE&amp;t=105s\" align=\"center\" size=\"medium\" width=\"400\" height=\"225\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/_Sk8mO0bLnE/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>Setting up and managing Multi-Geo is now available through the SharePoint admin center. &nbsp;Simply click ‘Add location’ and select the needed satellite geo and then pick a namespace URL. New sites created by users are automatically created in the geo where their PreferredDataLocation (PDL) was established.&nbsp; See more about managing PDL with Azure AD Connect at&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/PDL\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noopener noreferrer\">aka.ms/PDL</A></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/PDL\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noopener noreferrer\"><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\"><IMG style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" class=\"lia-media-image\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/54723i4D6C10E0FED4FC59/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" border=\"0\" alt=\"SPO admin1.png\" title=\"SPO admin1.png\" /></SPAN></A></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-img-tmp-id-1\">For your global workforce, the digital transformation means that every employee is empowered with a modern productivity experience in Office 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Global SharePoint Home experience</STRONG></P>\n<P>With SharePoint Multi-Geo, satellite geos now get the rich SharePoint Online functionalities in addition to the OneDrive functionalities. SharePoint Home experience shows a curated list of News roll-up and Suggested sites powered by the intelligence of the Office graph, which analyzes the activities and signals from across the global organization and tailors a list for every user.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\"><IMG style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" class=\"lia-media-image\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/54724i207624BCEF77626E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" border=\"0\" alt=\"News from Sites.png\" title=\"News from Sites.png\" /><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\">SharePoint Home</SPAN></SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG>New site creation in the user's geo</STRONG></P>\n<P>Team sites and Communications sites creation experience automatically detects the user’s configured geo-location and triggers sites creations in the corresponding geo.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\"><IMG class=\"lia-media-image\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/54725iF5DEDEC5EBFD6FBE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" border=\"0\" alt=\"New Site Creation.png\" title=\"New Site Creation.png\" /><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\">New sites automatically created in the user's geo</SPAN></SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG>Hub site is Multi-Geo aware</STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/what-is-a-sharepoint-hub-site-fe26ae84-14b7-45b6-a6d1-948b3966427f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noopener noreferrer\">SharePoint Hub sites</A>&nbsp;enhances the discovery and engagement with content for employees, while creating a complete and consistent representation of projects, departments or regions. With SharePoint Multi-Geo, sites from Satellite geos can easily be associated with a hub site regardless of which geo the hub site is hosted in. This makes it easy for employees to tailor their business units needs through hubs while at the same time being part of One Enterprise. Employees can search and get results across the hub through a single search experience, regardless of in which geo the sites are located at-rest.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\"><IMG class=\"lia-media-image\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/54727i3369EB4B04B85868/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" border=\"0\" alt=\"Hub Site.png\" title=\"Hub Site.png\" /><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\">SharePoint Hub Site experience</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Mobile</STRONG></P>\n<P>For employees on the go, the same great productivity experience is available on rich mobile apps for SharePoint, OneDrive and Outlook. Employees simply sign in with their Office 365 credentials and access content in their Multi-Geo enabled Office 365 tenant, they don’t need to remember any geo specific URLs or other information.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\"><IMG class=\"lia-media-image\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/54729iA2FAC175ED087AD9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" border=\"0\" alt=\"Mobile.png\" title=\"Mobile.png\" /><SPAN class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\">SharePoint Mobile with sites and people from around the world</SPAN></SPAN></P>\n<P><LI-WRAPPER></LI-WRAPPER></P>\n<P><SPAN><STRONG>Managed metadata</STRONG></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>For organizations that use taxonomy enterprise managed metadata to organize their sites and contents, Multi-Geo enables an easy way to centrally manage metadata in a central location and behind the scene these get replicated to all the satellites and ready to use in satellite sites. This doesn’t require any additional customization.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Rollout</STRONG></P>\n<P>Multi-Geo for SharePoint Online and Exchange Online Groups is now rolled out to all Office 365 tenants enabled with the Multi-Geo feature. Please see<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/GoMultiGeo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noopener noreferrer\">https://aka.ms/GoMultiGeo</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>for details.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Pricing</STRONG></P>\n<P>Multi-Geo in SharePoint Online and Groups is included with the existing Multi-Geo offering. Please see<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/GoMultiGeo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noopener noreferrer\">https://aka.ms/GoMultiGeo</A><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>for further details or contact your Microsoft representative.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Resources</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Admin Guide:<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><A In the next few weeks, Multi-Geo customers will get a Message center notification in Office 365 indicating that the India geo available. After that, simply set the \"PDL\" to \"IND\" to&nbsp;trigger&nbsp;the move of&nbsp;mailboxes and OneDrive files to the India geo. to&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>bring&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>custom tags</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;to our users</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;in the next few weeks!&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>With this feature, users will be able to name the tag and select an icon to create a custom tag that will sync across devices and show up in app search results.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>Add custom tags to your pages and stay organized in whatever way helps&nbsp;</SPAN><I><SPAN>you</SPAN></I><SPAN>&nbsp;achieve more!</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>Custom tags were passionately requested by</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;our</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;customers and starting in January</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;2019</SPAN><SPAN>, it will be available&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>on&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/onenote/9wzdncrfhvjl?activetab=pivot:overviewtab\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN>OneNote for Windows 10</SPAN></A><SPAN>&nbsp;and&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-onenote/id784801555\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN>OneNote for Mac</SPAN></A><SPAN>.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>No settings need to be enabled to use this feature.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>Once you see it in your app, feel free to start using it. For a detailed explanation on how to use custom tags,&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>read on</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;below.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Creating&nbsp;and using&nbsp;a&nbsp;custom&nbsp;tag</STRONG><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559738&quot;:40,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>To create a new custom tag, click&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>the Tags dropdown in the Home tab and select “Create New Tag.</SPAN><SPAN>”&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>When the Create a Tag pane opens, name the new tag</SPAN><SPAN>,</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;select an icon to represent it</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;and click Create to add your new tag to the list of tags.</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>Your new custom tag is ready to use</SPAN><SPAN>!&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>To tag content with&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>the</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;new tag</SPAN><SPAN>,&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>select</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;the&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>line</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;you want to tag, click Tags on the Home tab&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>and&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>select the desired tag</SPAN><SPAN>.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-aria-level=\"1\" data-aria-posinset=\"2\" data-listid=\"1\" data-font=\"Symbol\" data-leveltext=\"\"><SPAN>C</SPAN><SPAN>ustom tags created by&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>you</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>from</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;another device</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI data-aria-level=\"1\" tags&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>help&nbsp;</SPAN><I><SPAN>you</SPAN></I><SPAN>&nbsp;stay organized your way, but they will also help</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;your</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;teams and organizations keep shared notebooks organized wit</SPAN><SPAN>h customized tags.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG>Searching for custom tags&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN>Now that you’ve started tagging throughout OneNote with&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>custom tags, it’s easier than ever&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>stay organized and find what you need through search.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>Users can search for custom tags&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>in the app search experience</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;and</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;tag results will appear under the Tags tab.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN>Click on one of the results to go to its specific location.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/customtags_Gif (002).gif","linkMd5":"61e628bd5686363a2e30b7245d33daeb","author":"Jee Soo Han","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/customtags_Gif (002).gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn99@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-53-33-999_c7e4a929d66700ee.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639101},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"User Activity based Expiration Policy for Office 365 groups is now in Private Preview!","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/user-activity-based-expiration-policy-for-office-365-groups-is/ba-p/762598","description":"<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   Update: This feature has new updates. Please see the \n   <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/User-Activity-based-Expiration-Policy-for-Office-365-groups-is/ba-p/942877\" target=\"_self\">\n    blog\n   </A> for details.\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   --\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   O365 Groups power collaboration across Office 365\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n Collaboration is a key ingredient for the success of any organization. Office 365 groups, of the most used collaboration features in Microsoft 365 today, power the collaboration features across \n <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/itshowcase/a-foundation-for-modern-collaboration-microsoft-365-bolsters-teamwork\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  apps\n </A>, including Outlook, Teams, Yammer, and SharePoint. Employees can create groups quickly and start collaborating with co-workers by sharing group documents, emails, and calendars.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   The twin problems&nbsp;of Groups Life cycle Management\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n As the number of Office 365 groups increases, an organization needs to strike a balance between cleaning up unused groups and ensuring any valuable groups do not get deleted unintentionally, causing data loss. Many of you have shared feedback about these challenges in groups lifecycle management.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   You say, we listen and act\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n We heard your feedback, and we've made some changes! We are excited to announce the new version of expiration policy which ensures any group being actively used continues to be available, circumventing expiration. This feature makes life easier for users, including admins, group owners and members, by automating the expiration and renewal process by tracking groups for user activity across different apps, like Teams, SharePoint, Outlook, tied to the group.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   The new expiration&nbsp;policy&nbsp;puts&nbsp;group&nbsp;life cycle&nbsp;management&nbsp;on&nbsp;autopilot\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n The current Expiration policy allows you to set an expiration time frame for selected or all Office 365 groups . After the defined group lifetime, owners are asked to renew them if they are still needed. With this newly added intelligence, groups which are being actively used will be automagically renewed. This preempts the need for any manual action on the part of the group owners. This is based on user activity in groups across Office 365 apps like Outlook, SharePoint and Teams.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Example\n </STRONG>:&nbsp; At Contoso, the administrator has configured the Group lifetime to be 180 days. Megan is the owner of the Contoso Marketing O365 Group, with Enrico and Alex as its members. Her group is set to expire the following month. If an owner or a member performs actions like uploading a document in SharePoint, visiting Teams channel or sending an email to the group in Outlook, the group is automatically renewed for another 180 days, and she does not get any expiry notifications.\n</P> \n<P style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Image 1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123624i4637AD5ED82B7A79/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Image 1.png\" alt=\"Image 1.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Manual Controls\n </STRONG>: Group owners will continue to have the manual “delete”, “renew” option for granular control.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Soft Delete\n </STRONG>: Like before, groups which aren't renewed (either automatically based on activity or manually) will be soft deleted. Groups in “Soft-delete” state can still be restored within 30 days, after which the content is deleted permanently.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Image 2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123623i433F1BE9C02BBCDE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Image 2.png\" alt=\"Image 2.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  User actions for group auto-renewal: \n </STRONG>The following user actions will lead to automatic renewal of groups\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  SharePoint – View, Edit, Download, Move, Share, Upload Files\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Outlook – Join group, Read/write group message from group space, Like a message (OWA)\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Teams – Visit a Teams channels\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n We will continue to update this list to fine tune group auto-renewal experience.\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  &nbsp;\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Auditing and reporting:\n </STRONG> Administrators can get a list of auto-renewed groups from audit logs on the \n <A href=\"https://portal.azure.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  azure portal\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Image 3_2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123974iE6081E88324C3CF0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Image 3_2.png\" alt=\"Image 3_2.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Here are some quick steps to get you started.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Getting started\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Office 365 groups expiration policy can be configured from the Azure Active Directory portal, as well as programmatically via Azure Active Directory PowerShell. Please note you need an Azure AD Premium license. Below is a quick tutorial on how to get started with the functionality in the new Azure portal experience.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  1. Create Expiration Policy: \n </STRONG>Sign into the Azure portal, select \n <STRONG>\n  Azure Active Directory\n </STRONG>, go to the \n <STRONG>\n  Groups\n </STRONG> tab and select \n <STRONG>\n  Expiration\n </STRONG> under \n <STRONG>\n  Settings\n </STRONG>. (More details \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/groups-lifecycle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  here\n </A>) .\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Image 4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123621iAF9DD3AB0226F549/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Image 4.png\" alt=\"Image 4.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  2. Set Group Life cycle: \n </STRONG>Specify the group lifetime in days and select which groups you want the expiration settings to apply to.\n</P> \n<P>\n Group owners will receive a renewal notification 30 days before the expiration date, and from that notification they can renew their group with a single click!\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n If there is no user activity in the group (and the owners don't manually renew their group) within the required time frame, their group will expire. Upon expiry it will stay in a “soft deleted” state for 30 days. Owners of deleted groups will receive a notification letting them know their group has been deleted and giving them the opportunity to restore their group within 30 days after its deletion date. The Group will be permanently deleted after 30 days.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  3. Auto-renewal based on user activity\n </STRONG>: No explicit action is required to enable activity-based auto-renewal. If an the expiration policy is set for Office 365 groups, auto-renewal will be enabled by default.\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more about how you can restore you group to recover all its content, including SharePoint, Planner, and Outlook -&nbsp;\n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/active-directory-groups-restore-azure-portal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  how to restore deleted Office 365 groups\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Note: The new version of Office 365 groups expiration feature is available in \n <STRONG>\n  private preview\n </STRONG> today for select Azure AD Premium customers. Please reach out to your TAMs/CSMs regarding enrollment in private preview.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Let us know what you think!\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n We would love to hear your feedback! If you have any suggestions for us, questions, or issues to report, please leave a comment below. We're always looking for ways to improve.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n User Voice: \n <A href=\"https://office365.uservoice.com/forums/286611-office-365-groups/suggestions/33942997-add-security-groups-to-office-365-groups\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Add security groups to Office 365 groups\n </A>\n</P> \n<P>\n Support &amp; feedback: \n <A href=\"mailto:groupsarfeedback@microsoft.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  groupsarfeedback@microsoft.com\n </A>\n</P> +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123624i4637AD5ED82B7A79/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"d30abf77552371dc24b7c7af40f0d105","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-41-821_f99c6af6a9ced3c2.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":589,"sourceBytes":133078,"destBytes":49072,"author":"Salil_Kakkar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123624i4637AD5ED82B7A79/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-41-821_f99c6af6a9ced3c2.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123623i433F1BE9C02BBCDE/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn24@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-52-40-550_b0484cad72913d3d.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123974iE6081E88324C3CF0/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn20@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-46-384_c769b3f577defae9.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123621iAF9DD3AB0226F549/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn43@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-40-662_6146d40bd4f7d31c.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123632i13075828B2867566/image-dimensions/21x21?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn56@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-43-330_be5af13201800f71.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639093},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Announcing the General Availability of Microsoft Graph reporting APIs","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/announcing-the-general-availability-of-microsoft-graph-reporting/ba-p/137838","description":"<P><STRONG>General Availability of Microsoft Graph reporting APIs for retrieving Office 365 product usage data</STRONG></P>\n<P>The usage reports in the Office 365 admin center enable admins to understand their company's usage across the Office 365 services. However, many of you have existing reporting solutions such as a company reporting application or a web portal in place. To assure that you can monitor your IT services in one unified location, the usage reporting APIs complement the usage reports and allow organizations and independent software vendors to incorporate Office 365 usage data into their&nbsp;existing reporting solutions. Using these APIs, you can retrieve the data available in all of the usage reports, including organization level summaries per service, entity level (user, sites, accounts) usage information for reporting periods of the last 7/30/90/180 days, and&nbsp;daily activity aggregates.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Get started with the new APIs</STRONG></P>\n<P>The new APIs are available now, and any user with global admin, product admin rights (for Exchange, Skype for Business and SharePoint), or a reports reader role can retrieve data through these APIs.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You can leverage the <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/docs/api-reference/beta/resources/report\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft Graph documentation</A> for the reporting API and submit feature requests by asking or voting on an idea on <A href=\"https://officespdev.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\">UserVoice</A>.&nbsp;Please submit questions by posting them on Stack Overflow and tagging <STRONG>microsoftgraph</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With this announcement, we are announcing the deprecation of the following APIs within the <A href=\"https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/jj984325.aspx\" target=\"_blank\">Office 365 Reporting Web Service</A>: ConnectionbyClientType, ConnectionbyClientTypeDetail, CsActiveUser, CsAVConferenceTime, CsP2PAVTime, CsConference, CsP2PSession, GroupActivity, MailboxActivity, GroupActivity, MailboxUsage, MailboxUsageDetail, StaleMailbox and StaleMailboxDetail.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We will remove these APIs, as well as any related PowerShell cmdlets,&nbsp;on January 29, 2018.</P>\n<P>If you are currently using APIs or any of the related PowerShell cmdlets&nbsp;from the Office 365 Reporting Web Service, please start planning the migration of any subsystems within your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Below is a summary of the APIs and cmdlets that will be deprecated.</P>\n<TABLE width=\"780\">\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"156\">\n<P><STRONG>Office 365 Reporting web service</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>reference system use.</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"294\">\n<P>This method is being deprecated as of January 29, 2018. It is replaced by the new MS Graph Reporting API available at</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/docs/api-reference/v1.0/resources/email_activity_reports\" target=\"_blank\">https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/docs/api-reference/v1.0/resources/email_activity_reports</A></P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"156\">\n<P><A href=\"https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/jj984316.aspx\" target=\"_blank\">StaleMailboxDetail report </A></P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"204\">\n<P><A href=\"https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj200715.aspx\" target=\"_blank\">Get-StaleMailboxDetailReport</A></P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 23 Jan 2018 17:27:57 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"20215d125818f02c0afe37bce3e470a4","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Brent Davis","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639110},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Microsoft Whiteboard now available for the web and integrated in Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/microsoft-whiteboard-now-available-for-the-web-and-integrated-in/ba-p/973566","description":"<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><SPAN style=\"background-color: #ffffff; box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; cursor: text; display: inline; float: none; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">Today we are excited to announce the general availability of Whiteboard for the web and integration with Teams meetings, releases that continue our journey to enable people to ideate and create from any device, anywhere.&nbsp;</SPAN></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><SPAN style=\"background-color: #ffffff; box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; cursor: text; display: inline; float: none; font-family: inherit; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"web.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154678i2E72392D08576D3F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"web.PNG\" alt=\"web.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Easily collaborate with others or access your boards from any device</FONT></H2>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Today we’re making Microsoft Whiteboard for the web available for all commercial Office customers. It is available on the all apps list under&nbsp;<A href=\"http://office.com\" target=\"_self\">office.com</A> or directly at <A href=\"http://whiteboard.microsoft.com\" target=\"_self\">whiteboard.microsoft.com</A>. </FONT><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">We believe that the best results come when everyone participates and this release makes Whiteboard available on all your organization, school or employee devices including PCs, tablets and phones running Windows, MacOS, iOS and Android. Whiteboard for the web provides the ability to collaborate in real-time with others as well as access your existing boards. </FONT><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Whiteboard for the web is an important part of the Whiteboard family of clients as it makes Whiteboard available on all devices and in Teams. We are starting from an experience that is focused on real-time inking but are committed to bringing additional functionality from our native apps over time.</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR />&nbsp;<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Office.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154669i36C44615A83A68FE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Office.png\" alt=\"Office.png\" /></span></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Run effective Teams meetings with Whiteboard</FONT></H2>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">We are excited to bring Whiteboard to Teams meetings. Customers can now easily add a whiteboard to any Teams meeting by clicking on Whiteboard under the Share option. The newly created whiteboard will be automatically shared with all meeting participants and available for them to start collaborating without leaving the Teams experience. A new Whiteboard tab will also be added to the meeting to make is easy to access the board after the meeting.<BR />Adding a Whiteboard to a Teams meeting is useful for a variety of scenarios such as diagramming collaboratively, expressing ideas, capturing agenda items and follow ups, remote training, and more. We can’t wait to learn how your organization will be using Whiteboard in meetings. Please share your stories below.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"104115_WHITEBOARD_IN_TEAMS_V07.gif\" style=\"width: 703px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154444i0C65DBDEEC7C7342/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"104115_WHITEBOARD_IN_TEAMS_V07.gif\" alt=\"104115_WHITEBOARD_IN_TEAMS_V07.gif\" /></span></FONT></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 04 Nov 2019 16:02:20 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154678i2E72392D08576D3F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"e1e60868bfaac07710a726bb3f2b8103","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn60@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-41-645_716a228ede404bf4.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":641,"sourceBytes":110914,"destBytes":27254,"author":"Itai Almog","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154678i2E72392D08576D3F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn60@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-41-645_716a228ede404bf4.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154669i36C44615A83A68FE/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn3@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-45-701_6084b44303d8bb8c.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154444i0C65DBDEEC7C7342/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn68@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-52-48-618_f6d14148e9b9df2c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639095},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Calendaring is Tricky and That Might be Why You Were An Hour Late to that Meeting","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/calendaring-is-tricky-and-that-might-be-why-you-were-an-hour/ba-p/1168031","description":"<DIV class=\"lia-message-body-wrapper lia-component-message-view-widget-body\">\n<DIV id=\"bodyDisplay\" class=\"lia-message-body\">\n<DIV class=\"lia-message-body-content\">\n<P>Writing code for calendaring features is hard. Some of you might say writing any kind of code is hard, and you might have a point, but calendaring is particularly tricky. Why’s that? Well, consider time zones for a start – a meeting you set up isn’t necessarily in the same time as it is for me, and then you also invited people, from a whole bunch of other time zones (did you know some time zones are 30 mins off, not a full hour?), and then you made the meeting recurring, not every week, but every third Monday, except for next month, when it’s on Tuesday… and so on and so forth. But you got a meeting set up, all good.</P>\n<P>And then one of the attendees happens to live in a country that decided to implement Daylight Saving Time (DST) and change the local time by an hour. Just in that country.</P>\n<P>And we have an good example, as <A href=\"https://www.timeanddate.com/news/time/brazil-scraps-dst.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow noopener noreferrer\">Brazil changed their DST rules in 2019</A> to eliminate DST and those changes are coming up very soon and they might impact users even with the <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4507704/dst-changes-in-windows-for-brazil-and-morocco\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noopener noreferrer\">latest OS updates applied</A>. Users may see various issues with \"off by an hour\" calendar items when using the Brasilia time zone.</P>\n<P>Sometimes we get caught out by a DST change made by a country, or a particular change needs us to code something new to account for it, and for the most part we make it so you don’t notice. But despite our best efforts sometimes users notice meetings are off by an hour. Then the users call you, their IT Pro to complain.</P>\n<P>What do you do? There are a number of things we recommend, and so we wanted to share some simple advice on what to do, if it happens.</P>\n<P>The “off by one hour” issue can vary widely in terms of scope and symptom, although it is typically limited to <STRONG><EM>recurring appointments and meetings</EM></STRONG>. For example, a user might report:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Every single recurring meeting is off by an hour, but only in Outlook on the Web (OWA).&nbsp; The meetings render correctly in Outlook for Windows.</LI>\n<LI>Only a few meetings are off by an hour, but they show incorrectly in both OWA and in Outlook for Windows.</LI>\n<LI>Only exceptions to a recurring meeting are off by an hour, and only for attendees, not for the organizer.</LI>\n<LI>Only existing meetings that were created BEFORE the Windows Operating System DST patches were applied are off by an hour.</LI>\n<LI>Some other possible variation of meeting creation, attendee vs organizer, all vs some, OWA or Outlook desktop, etc.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>The #1 best thing you can do to avoid seeing these issues in the first place is to keep your client software and operating system up to date. Sorry if that’s obvious to you, but the OS is the master time source for the client (in OWA’s case that means Exchange Online), and sometimes these DST patches require an update to Windows/Mac/Linux – so keep them patched. Sometimes we need to patch Outlook for Windows, Mac, iOS or Android, and so keeping the client up to date can prevent these issues from showing up. There’s a strong case to be made here for switching to Office 365 ProPlus and having updates regularly applied.</P>\n<P>These DST issues can also require server-side changes. Exchange Online does all that for you, of course. In an on-premises world you need to update your servers, so make sure you keep up to date on Cumulative Updates (CU's) for Exchange and OS updates.</P>\n<P>Assuming you’ve done all that, your clients and servers/services are up to date – what then?</P>\n<P>You need to figure out how large the scope of this issue is for your users. Is it every user? Is it Outlook for Windows only? What about OWA, does that work? Because the easiest thing might be to have the user switch to another client app until you figure it out.</P>\n<P>If it’s only a subset of users (as you only have a small number of users in that geography where DST changed the time) perhaps you decide to manually ‘fix’ the meetings. If so, here’s what we suggest;</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Make sure the DST patches/updates are in place.</LI>\n<LI>Make sure you note any existing meeting exceptions that might exist if the problem meeting is recurring.</LI>\n<LI>Have the organizer cancel the meeting that is problematic.</LI>\n<LI>Have the organizer create and send a new meeting so that the start time correctly takes into account the new DST rules.</LI>\n<LI>Recreate the needed exceptional instances.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>We also see cases where users ‘fixed’ their meetings ahead of a patch/update by just dragging them to the ‘correct’ start time, which then results in them breaking again when updates are installed (and their automatic changes come into effect) – that’s confusing but it’s all the same issue.</P>\n<P>We realize re-creating the meeting series is a bit inconvenient, but that’s because time zone rule information is stored on the meeting itself and re-creating it on a patched machine will ensure the correct rules are being used for that series. And it’s often the quickest solution. But what if the impact is too large to handle that way, and you’ve made sure your clients are patched – then you should call into support and get some advice.</P>\n<P>On multiple occasions we have made service side changes in Exchange Online to ‘fix’ it there. Those changes do make it to on-prem, but not until the next CU typically.</P>\n<P>We give you a lot of flexibility in how you can create meetings (and we are not done improving meetings by a long shot) but it sometimes feels like it’s something of a minor miracle any of us ever get to meet and talk to each other at all, it really is. We celebrate people meeting every day, and we work really hard on this stuff, all the time, to make sure changes such as DST are accounted for.</P>\n<P>We’re working on the Brazilian DST issue very hard right now, but we want to call it out so admins with users in that timezone are aware, and have a chance to make sure patches are applied, users are aware and so on. We’ll get things patched and fixed in time, no doubt, but we thought this a good time to broadly discuss DST, what it means, what you can do, and why writing code for calendaring can sometimes be a bit hard.</P>\n<P><FONT color=\"#ff9900\">The Office 365 Calendaring Team</FONT></P>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 11 Feb 2020 22:07:14 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"9d34d67491e73c8eabad37057efd5157","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Greg Taylor - EXCHANGE","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639094},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"New Apps and Services in Office 365 US Government","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/new-apps-and-services-in-office-365-us-government/ba-p/149680","description":"<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Office 365 US Government.png\" style=\"width: 568px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27560iE44B7E97A432FA89/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Office 365 US Government.png\" alt=\"Office 365 US Government.png\" /></span>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">By meeting compliance requirements of the US and State Governments, <STRONG>Office 365 US Government empowers agencies to realize a modern workplace supported by devices and services. </STRONG>Increased collaboration breaks down siloes within and across agencies, and secure mobility allows civil servants to remain productive in the field and away from desks. Cost savings and data center footprint reduction can be re-invested into digitizing citizen services.</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">Microsoft delivers Office 365 secure productivity and communication services like email, document creation apps and storage, intranet sites, and instant messaging/telephony to the US Government from three environments designed to meet the unique data handling regulations for controlled unclassified information. Architected according to NIST controls, FedRAMP requirements, and the DISA Security Requirements Guidelines, these environments store content in the continental United States, are operated by US citizens, and are authorized to hold Federal, criminal justice, Federal tax, and covered defense information. </SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">We want to answer a few questions about the Office 365 US Government environments and offerings: What services and applications are included, why is the roadmap different from Enterprise offerings, and what services will be released in the future and when?</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">To answer this question in a meaningful way, we must explain the compliance commitments, audit process, and accreditation requirements. But if you want to skip ahead,<STRONG> the roadmap for Office 365 Government Community Cloud (GCC), Government Community Cloud (GCC) High, and DoD can be found at the end of this post.</STRONG></SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin-left: .5in;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">The Office 365 GCC environment is designed for Federal, State, and Local government and has been available for about five years. With millions of monthly active users, agencies across the country are benefitting from cloud productivity and security services that meet their compliance requirements.</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin-left: .5in;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin-left: .5in;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">The Office 365 GCC High environment is designed for Federal agencies, defense industry, aerospace industry, and other organizations holding Controlled Unclassified Information. Introduced more recently, the GCC High offerings are ideal for national security organizations and companies with International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) data or Defense Federal Acquisition Regulations Supplement (DFARS) requirements.</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin-left: .5in;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin-left: .5in;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">The Office 365 DoD environment is designed for the US Department of Defense exclusively.</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Office 365 US Government environments and associated compliance commitments\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27562iD2E62D60615EC9DB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Office 365 US Gov Environments.png\" alt=\"Office 365 US Government environments and associated compliance commitments\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Office 365 US Government environments and associated compliance commitments</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">Every service introduced into the US Government offerings has undergone a third party review to ensure that we meet our compliance commitments to you. We complete audits regularly to make new capabilities available as frequently as possible. Release cycles differ from Enterprise offerings for new services, but once available, the service will align with the commercial user experience.</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">The October audit is complete, and Microsoft has received the 3PAO report, so we can confirm what will be released in the coming weeks. We will be sharing an updated roadmap at the </SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/techsummit/washington-dc\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">Microsoft Government Tech Summit taking place in Washington DC on March 5-6</SPAN></A><SPAN style=\"font-size: 11.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif;\">, so stay tuned and don't hesitate to register to attend! Information will be published online also.</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin:
