href=\"https://channel9.msdn.com/blogs/Azure-Government/Identity-on-Azure-Government\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft US Government Cloud Identity: On-Premises, Cloud, and Hybrid</A></LI>\n<LI>Endpoints:\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Office-365-URLs-and-IP-address-ranges-8548a211-3fe7-47cb-abb1-355ea5aa88a2\" target=\"_blank\">Office 365 GCC Endpoints</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/Office-365-U-S-Government-GCC-High-endpoints-cbd2369c-fd96-464c-bf48-c99826b459ee?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">Office 365 GCC High Endpoints</A></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Required-DNS-Records-for-Office-365-GCC-High-5cb45d81-fdcf-4fde-8601-a09666353cc4?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">Office 365 GCC High DNS Records</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/service-govus-overview#limitations-of-power-bi-us-government\" target=\"_blank\">Power BI US Government Documentation</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Plan-for-multi-factor-authentication-for-Office-365-Deployments-043807b2-21db-4d5c-b430-c8a6dee0e6ba\" target=\"_blank\">Multi Factor Authentication (including PIV/CAC cards)</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Brian Levenson is the product manager for Microsoft 365 for US Government. Follow him on <A href=\"https://twitter.com/brian_levenson\" target=\"_blank\">Twitter (@brian_levenson)</A> and <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/brianlevenson/\" target=\"_blank\">LinkedIn (Brian Levenson)</A> for the latest in government technology and Microsoft 365 news.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Mar 2018 23:18:32 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27560iE44B7E97A432FA89/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"30ccf2b6cec1f680119d6370b1b2a239","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn50@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-39-956_fdf6110bfb94dee2.webp","destWidth":568,"destHeight":508,"sourceBytes":11324,"destBytes":13276,"author":"Brian Levenson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27560iE44B7E97A432FA89/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn50@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-39-956_fdf6110bfb94dee2.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27562iD2E62D60615EC9DB/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn4@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-48-000_3d79c068773c8285.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639108},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Troubleshooting Office Cloud Policy Service (OCPS)","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/troubleshooting-office-cloud-policy-service-ocps/ba-p/1070242","description":"<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-office-cloud-policy-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Office cloud policy service</A> (OCPS) is a cloud-based service that enables you to apply policy settings for Office 365 ProPlus on a user’s device.&nbsp; The policy settings roam to whichever device the user signs into and uses Office 365 ProPlus.&nbsp; As end users become increasingly mobile, IT Pros need a single approach to secure Office 365 ProPlus for traditional on-premises domain devices, Azure AD registered devices, Azure AD Joined, and Hybrid Azure AD joined devices.&nbsp; OCPS applies to all scenarios above without the need to download and replicate any content such as Administrative Template files (ADMX/ADML) on-premises.&nbsp; The goal of this blog is to provide some transparency of how the service works to help IT Pros during their validation phase and to encourage transition from classic domain-based policy to OCPS service for Office 365 ProPlus.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>Requirements of OCPS</STRONG></U></P>\n<P>1. At least Version 1808 (August 2018) of Office 365 ProPlus<BR />2. User accounts created in or synchronized to Azure Active Directory (AAD). The user must be signed into Office 365 ProPlus with an AAD based account.<BR />3. Security groups created in or synchronized to Azure Active Directory (AAD), with the appropriate users added to those groups.<BR />4. To create a policy configuration, you must be assigned one of the following roles in Azure Active Directory (AAD): Global Administrator, Security Administrator, or Office Apps Admin.<BR />5. Connectivity to addresses below. Microsoft recommends proxy bypass\\whitelist for these URLs<BR />*.manage.microsoft.com, *.officeconfig.msocdn.com, config.office.com over 443</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>Steps to perform proof of concept and validation</STRONG></U><BR />1. Create a test user, ours will be “Kasper Graf”, kgraf@contoso.com.<BR />2. Create security group “OCPS Service Validation” and add user to group within Active Directory Users and Computers.<BR />3. Allow AAD Connect to synchronize user and group to Azure AD. (lunch break :)</img> or force synchronization via commands below)</P>\n<PRE>(optional) From AAD Connect Server and elevated PowerShell, run the following commands:<BR />PS C:\\WINDOWS\\system32&gt;import-module adsync<BR />PS C:\\WINDOWS\\system32&gt;Set-ADSyncScheduler -NextSyncCyclePolicyType Delta<BR />PS C:\\WINDOWS\\system32&gt;Start-ADSyncSyncCycle</PRE>\n<P>Browse Azure AD portal and explore Users – All Users, select Kasper Graf and then Groups. Verify that group “OCPS Service Validation” has been assigned and source says, “Windows Server AD”. This confirms user and group were synced into Azure AD successfully and we can proceed to next steps.<BR />4.&nbsp;&nbsp;<A title=\"Create your first OCPS policy\" href=\"https://config.office.com/officeSettings/officePolicies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create your first OCPS policy</A> and select “Create” button:</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Create1.png\" style=\"width: 751px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162150iBF6A52D884B1692C/image-dimensions/751x321?v=1.0\" width=\"751\" height=\"321\" title=\"Create1.png\" alt=\"Create1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>5. Complete input fields, when selecting assigned security group input “OCPS” and service should filter results to “OCPS Service Validation” group.&nbsp; Next, define a policy.&nbsp; For the demo, I&nbsp;chose policy \"VBA Macro Notification Settings\", \"Enabled\" where VBA Macro Notification Settings are set to \"Disable all with notification\".&nbsp; &nbsp;Once selections have been made “Create” or “Save”.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Create4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162153i1222DBF34FBDA886/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Create4.png\" alt=\"Create4.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Create3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162154iE0CDFF0226F4F427/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Create3.png\" alt=\"Create3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>6. From Policy Management, we can now see our policy exists.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Create2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162156iA72E760D5CE754B7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Create2.png\" alt=\"Create2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>So, we’ve got a policy, we’ve assigned it to a security group containing our test user, our next step is to validate. My test machine happens to be classic on-premises domain joined machine. My user, Kasper Graf, is signed in with his normal Active Directory credentials which is displayed in upper right hand corner of Word.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"signin.png\" style=\"width: 338px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163903i82378C603B7A2EA1/image-dimensions/338x201?v=1.0\" width=\"338\" height=\"201\" title=\"signin.png\" alt=\"signin.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Traditional Group Policy uses Client-Side Extensions in Windows to apply policy every 90 minutes.&nbsp; IT Pros can force policy by using command line “gpupdate /force” and inspect\\verify registry as well as application behavior prior to broad deployment.&nbsp; OCPS checks for policy upon initial Office application launch, calls into cloud service endpoints listed above, determines policy applicability based on group membership and priority assignment and registry keys are populated.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Specifically, there are two locations of interest in registry.</P>\n<P>1. HKEY_CURRENT_USER\\Software\\Microsoft\\Office\\16.0\\Common\\<STRONG>CloudPolicy</STRONG>\\<BR />This will contain information about FetchInterval, 90 minutes is default, as well as record of Last Fetch Time and Last Payload Hash.</P>\n<P><BR />2. HKEY_CURRENT_USER\\Software\\Policies\\Microsoft\\<STRONG>Cloud</STRONG>. This key will contain path to registry keys representing the policy assignment. For example, ours will be HKEY_CURRENT_USER\\Software\\Policies\\Microsoft\\<STRONG>Cloud</STRONG>\\Office\\16.0\\word\\security<BR />Vbawarnings = 2 (DWORD)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>IT Pros can achieve the same behavior of gpupdate by simply deleting the key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\\Software\\Microsoft\\Office\\16.0\\Common\\<STRONG>CloudPolicy</STRONG>, close Office application and relaunch to fetch policy.&nbsp; I typically use tools like <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/procmon\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Process Monitor</A> to help trust\\verify operations of this type with filters such as “Path” contains “CloudPolicy” or where Operation is “RegSetValue” etc.&nbsp; Opening a Word document containing a Macro displaying warning with notification as expected.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Warning.png\" style=\"width: 416px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163904iAE412FE77309DBBA/image-dimensions/416x218?v=1.0\" width=\"416\" height=\"218\" title=\"Warning.png\" alt=\"Warning.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>Advanced troublshooting</STRONG></U></P>\n<P>The OCPS client on Win32 is built into the C2R service. The C2R service runs as SYSTEM on the device and is not aware of the active user(s). When you launch one of the Win32 Office apps (like Word) the user token is passed to C2R by the app and then C2R is able to call the OCPS service with the user token and request the policies. This makes it difficult to troubleshoot as the traffic to the service is managed via this SYSTEM process.<BR />Below is the set of steps needed to monitor the HTTPS traffic running under the SYSTEM account on the Win32 device.<U><STRONG><BR /></STRONG></U></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Setup</STRONG><BR />Tools you need<BR />- Fiddler (or some tool to monitor the HTTPS traffic and decrypt the HTTPS traffic)<BR />By monitoring and decrypting the HTTPS traffic you will be able to see the content that is sent and received via the OCPS check in service.<BR />In Fiddler there is a configuration option that allows Fiddler to decrypt HTTPS traffic by installing a trusted certificate on the target machine. Without this you cannot decrypt the content.</P>\n<P><BR />- The ability to run Fiddler as SYSTEM on the Win32 device<BR />runassystem.exe is a small tool available from a third party, <A href=\"https://apreltech.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://apreltech.com/</A>.<BR />This tool allows you to specify an EXE to launch in a new process that is run under SYSTEM.<BR />There are other tools and methods available to accomplish this.<BR /><A href=\"https://sourceforge.net/projects/runassystem/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://sourceforge.net/projects/runassystem/</A>&nbsp;<BR /><A href=\"https://www.winhelponline.com/blog/run-program-as-system-localsystem-account-windows/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://www.winhelponline.com/blog/run-program-as-system-localsystem-account-windows/</A>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>Steps to troubleshoot<BR /></STRONG></U>1. Shut down all Office apps<BR />2. Delete the OCPS registry hives<BR />3. Launch runassystem.exe and accept the elevation prompt.<BR />4. Provide runassystem.exe the path and EXE of Fiddler<BR />5. Launch Word and monitor the traffic<U><STRONG><BR /></STRONG></U></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>What you should see<BR /></STRONG></U>You should see a call to ocps.manage.microsoft.com to retrieve the policies for the user and a call to ocps.manage.microsoft.com to send the acknowledgement that the policies were received and the health status.<U><STRONG><BR /></STRONG></U></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>Call to retrieve</STRONG></U><BR />The retrieval of policies includes a JSON payload that contains the policies and their values. Select the item in Fiddler and review the payload using the JSON tab.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OCPS2.png\" style=\"width: 879px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213361i168F4F3C6FA7696C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OCPS2.png\" alt=\"OCPS2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Each configured policy is detailed in the JSON response showing the policy ID (ParentSettingId), the data type (Type) and the value name and value.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OCPS3.png\" style=\"width: 357px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213362i1BC56EBE079C967A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OCPS3.png\" alt=\"OCPS3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>ParentSettingId<BR />If the policy is an ADMX based policy you will see this as [admxfile][admx id]. Ex. office16;L_UseOfficeForLabeling. You can look up L_UseOfficeForLabeling in the office16.admx file.<BR />If the policy is not an ADMX based policy you will see this as [app][policy id] as defined by the app team. Ex. cortana;C_AllowBingAnswersInCortana. There is no reference for these policies as they are only defined in the OCPS policy library.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U>Call to </U><U>acknowledge</U></P>\n<P>The call to the /ack API is passed details on the payload that was received by the client and the success status for writing to the client.</P>\n<P>The JSON data will contain the device name, platform and Office version as well as Success or Failure and additional failure information if needed.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OCPS4.png\" style=\"width: 887px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213363i9D340163DCA99A6F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OCPS4.png\" alt=\"OCPS4.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OCPS5.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213364i60B78935FBEEF1CE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OCPS5.png\" alt=\"OCPS5.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U><STRONG>FAQ:</STRONG></U><BR /><STRONG>How does conflict resolution work if the same policy is set via traditional domain-based policy as well as OCPS?</STRONG><BR />OCPS takes priority if there are any conflicts with traditional domain-based policies.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Computer accounts within my organization don't have direct internet access and sit behind a proxy.&nbsp; With this configuration I've noticed OCPS doesn't work even though the User does have access to all required Office 365 URLs?</STRONG></P>\n<P>We have added proxy and User Impersonation support to address this issue.&nbsp; The tentative release date is 2020 September SAC-T and 2021 January SAC.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Currently policies are limited to user settings. Are there plans on adding machine settings?</STRONG><BR />Yes. This has been accepted and currently is in our backlog. We hope to have this available next year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Group Policy provides a view of all policies on the device or for the specified user. Does OCPS support this?</STRONG><BR />Currently OCPS does not provide a list of all Office policies applied to a specific user or device. This is on our backlog and we hope to have this available next year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Will OCPS support other platforms such as MacOS, Android and iOS?</STRONG><BR />Yes, OCPS in the future will also support additional platforms such as MacOS, Android and iOS. We will create additional blog postings per platform once features are generally available.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Are there any environments where OCPS is not available?</STRONG></P>\n<P>The Office cloud policy service isn't available to customers who have the following plans: Office 365 operated by 21Vianet, Office 365 Germany, Office 365 GCC, or Office 365 GCC High and DoD.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Change log</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>8/19/2020 Updated to include more prescriptive guidance for troubleshooting</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><SPAN style=\"color: inherit; font-family: inherit; font-size: 24px;\">The Author</SPAN></DIV>\n</DIV>\n<P>This blog post is brought to you by Dave Guenthner, a Senior Premier Field Engineer and “ProPlus Ranger” at Microsoft. Feel free to share your questions and feedback in the comments below.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 19 Aug 2020 19:12:22 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162150iBF6A52D884B1692C/image-dimensions/751x321?v=1.0","linkMd5":"b5676fba8198269395c59e803aeb3093","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn8@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-41-810_d5be022dcc9f9c9d.webp","destWidth":750,"destHeight":321,"sourceBytes":37453,"destBytes":7868,"author":"Dave Guenthner","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162150iBF6A52D884B1692C/image-dimensions/751x321?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn8@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-41-810_d5be022dcc9f9c9d.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162153i1222DBF34FBDA886/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-40-667_accdc23087902353.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162154iE0CDFF0226F4F427/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn67@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-41-969_87bd9194f276e038.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162156iA72E760D5CE754B7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn68@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-44-926_bf6acba73a05b530.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163903i82378C603B7A2EA1/image-dimensions/338x201?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn47@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-44-663_f0274dc77c00240e.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/163904iAE412FE77309DBBA/image-dimensions/416x218?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn51@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-52-43-648_2b8b9780d9db243b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213361i168F4F3C6FA7696C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn92@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-44-262_3e98fe06bbb306ad.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213362i1BC56EBE079C967A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn95@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-42-432_c34d71192d873296.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213363i9D340163DCA99A6F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-46-647_8bb306b634af8f3a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213364i60B78935FBEEF1CE/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn31@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-45-186_ee73e61d3aea9203.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639080},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Network optimization tips for on-premises Office installs and updates","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/network-optimization-tips-for-on-premises-office-installs-and/ba-p/1608089","description":"<P>There are a variety of scenarios including but not limited to, installations of Office using Content Delivery Network (CDN), <A title=\"lean 2nd installs\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/fieldnotes/build-dynamic-lean-universal-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">lean 2nd installs</A> (removing the Office source files from the install packages), <A title=\"right-sized first install\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/fieldnotes/right-sizing-initial-deployment\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">right-sized first install</A> (only include most used language packs), and default behavior where Office stays up to date using CDN. Microsoft recommends optimizing these network operations because a device can get portions of the content from other devices on its local network instead of having to download the update completely from Microsoft CDN. The goal of this article is to provide solutions for challenges collected from customers in the field.&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2 id=\"toc-hId--1297263935\">Typical challenges we've heard from our customers</H2>\n<UL>\n<LI>Office updates are too large.</LI>\n<LI>Too many egress points within on-premises network when obtaining content.</LI>\n<LI>In a remote work world, we need a solution to address on-premises and remote users.</LI>\n<LI>Are there additional costs for this optimization?&nbsp; (Spoiler...NO!)</LI>\n<LI>Fear of increased complexity for office installs and updates.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Can my compliance deadlines still be met?</LI>\n</UL>\n<H2 id=\"toc-hId--1297263935\">Solution: Use Windows Delivery Optimization (DO) or if available,&nbsp; Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager Connected Cache</H2>\n<P>All of these above concerns can be addressed with this proposed solution.&nbsp; You can use Delivery Optimization (DO) to reduce bandwidth consumption by sharing the work of downloading Office content among multiple Windows 10 devices in your deployment. DO can accomplish this because it is a self-organizing distributed cache that allows clients to download content from alternate sources (such as other peers on the network). Delivery Optimization is a cloud-managed solution. Access to the Delivery Optimization cloud services is a requirement. This means that to use the peer-to-peer functionality of DO, devices <EM><U>must have access to the DO cloud service end points.</U></EM></P>\n<P><BR />Optionally, customers who use Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager can take advantage of a feature called Configuration Manager Connected Cache which delivers a powerful combination of DO plus Connected Cache leading to high hit rates for content searches. If the cache doesn’t contain necessary files, Configuration Manager Site Server will download content to Distribution Point to populate cache, based on the client needs. In this way, customers have far more flexibility in terms of supporting different architectures and languages as manual downloads are no longer required as they've been replaced by a dynamic workflow as well as making use of existing capital investments.</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Prerequisites for solution</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>At least Office Version 1808 for background updates</LI>\n<LI>At least Office Version 1908 for installing or user-initiated updates</LI>\n<LI>Windows 10 Delivery Optimization\n<UL class=\"lia-list-style-type-square\">\n<LI>\n<P>For communication between clients and the Delivery Optimization cloud service: <BR />*.do.dsp.mp.microsoft.com.<BR />*.dl.delivery.mp.microsoft.com<BR />*.emdl.ws.microsoft.com</P>\n<P>Delivery Optimization listens on port 7680 for requests from other peers by using TCP/IP. The service will register and open this port on the device, but you might need to set this port to accept inbound traffic through your firewall yourself. If you don't allow inbound traffic over port 7680, you can't use the peer-to-peer functionality of Delivery Optimization. However, devices can still successfully download by using HTTP or HTTPS traffic over port 80 (such as for default Windows Update data).</P>\n</LI>\n<LI>\n<P>If you set up Delivery Optimization to create peer groups that include devices across NATs (or any form of internal subnet that uses gateways or firewalls between subnets), it will use Teredo. For this to work, you must allow inbound TCP/IP traffic over port 3544. Look for a \"NAT traversal\" setting in your firewall to set this up.</P>\n<P>Delivery Optimization also communicates with its cloud service by using HTTP/HTTPS over port 80.</P>\n</LI>\n<LI>\n<P data-unlink=\"true\">Recommended (if existing Configuration Manager customer, use <A title=\"Microsoft Connected Cache\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/mem/configmgr/core/plan-design/hierarchy/microsoft-connected-cache\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Microsoft Connected Cache </STRONG></A>combined with Delivery Optimization)&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Implementation steps.</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>1. Operationally, stop any future software updates for Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise using Configuration Manager</STRONG></P>\n<P>Group Policy or Configuration Manager Client Settings require setting \"Management of Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise\" (formerly known as Office 365 Client Management) to Disabled in order to restore default functionality where software update workflow for Office updates uses CDN <STRONG>not</STRONG> Configuration Manager. When available, Connected Cache feature will be enabled but software updates workflow for Office using Configuration Manager will no longer be used.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>2. Configure Group Policy for Microsoft Office 2016 (Machine)/Updates</STRONG></P>\n<TABLE border=\"1\" width=\"100%\">\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\"><FONT size=\"2\">Enable Automatic Updates</FONT></TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\"><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Hide option to enable or disable updates</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Management of Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Disabled</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Update Deadline</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">3 (Deadline count starts once content download has completed on client)</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>3. Configure Group Policy for Microsoft Office 2016 (Machine)/Updates</STRONG></P>\n<TABLE border=\"1\" width=\"100%\">\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"50%\"><FONT size=\"2\">Allow uploads while the device is on battery while under set Battery level (Percentage)</FONT></TD>\n<TD width=\"50%\"><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled (60)</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Delay background download from http (in secs)</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled *Higher time will increase likelihood of finding peer but slow background update. Example (240)</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Delay foreground download from http (in secs)</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled (60)</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Download Mode</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled (Group 2)</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Enable Peer Caching while the device connects via VPN</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Disabled</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Minimum Peer Caching Content File Size (in MB)</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled (1)</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Select a method to restrict Peer Selection</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled (subnet)</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Set Business Hours to Limit Background Download Bandwidth</FONT></TD>\n<TD><FONT size=\"2\">Enabled</FONT></TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>4. (optionally)&nbsp;Configure Connected Cache for Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager</STRONG></P>\n<P>Navigate using Configuration Manger Console to \\Administration\\Overview\\Distribution Points and select properties of Distribution Point. Enable Connected Cache by checking box and designate LUN to host cached content.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"LUN.png\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/214328i3F6E60CB67183AB4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"LUN.png\" alt=\"LUN.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Navigate using Configuration Manger Console to panel \\Administration\\Overview\\Hierarchy Configuration\\Boundary Groups. Select each on-premises boundary group and enable selection highlighted below. (toggle on other selections based on your environment preferences)</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"allowpeers.png\" style=\"width: 433px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/214360iF476F73E44A1ACAD/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"allowpeers.png\" alt=\"allowpeers.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Finally, using Configuration Manger Console Navigate to \\Administration\\Overview\\Client Settings, enable options below.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"ClientSettings.png\" style=\"width: 588px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/214330iB23F93906DFFEE29/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"ClientSettings.png\" alt=\"ClientSettings.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>How to verify DO and Connected Cache are working?</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>1. Deploy Office to validation machine where per Update history for <A title=\"Microsoft 365 Apps (listed by date)\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/officeupdates/update-history-microsoft365-apps-by-date\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 Apps (listed by date)</A> build is N-2.</STRONG> <BR />For example, at the time of this writing, today is “Patch Tuesday” so August 2020 Monthly Enterprise Channel is Version 2006 (Build 13001.20520). The reference machine should have June 2020 Version 2004 (Build 12730.20430) installed. This should result in Office moving to N-1 or N (depending on CDN throttle).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>2.&nbsp;Allow up for 24 hours for scheduled task Office Automatic Updates 2.0 to detect and perform Office update.<BR /></STRONG>For accelerated lab testing consider moving system clock forward by one day prior to running scheduled task.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>3.&nbsp;</STRONG><STRONG>[Client] Use PowerShell on Windows client to verify Office content used DO and Conncted Cache.</STRONG></P>\n<OL class=\"lia-list-style-type-lower-alpha\">\n<LI>\n<PRE>PS C:\\Windows\\system32&gt; Get-DeliveryOptimizationStatus</PRE>\n</LI>\n<LI>Search for field FileID from the list which contains string STREAM_X64_X_NONE or STREAM_X86_X_NONE for details which contains the build. (this is largest file containing Office).&nbsp; For the test, your looking for FileId is 95D2EE60-C9D3-45E4-876D-BAE16D758A87_16_0_13001_20520_STREAM_X64_X_NONE.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>Search for fields under FileID such as FileSize, TotalBytesDownloaded, BytesFromPeers, BytesFromHttp and BytesFromCacheServer.&nbsp;&nbsp;In my lab, the FileSize was 1863339050 bytes or 1.86 GB. Referencing TotalBytesDownloaded, the Office client using DO only downloaded 516967466 bytes or 517 MB because only the necessary pieces were downloaded not the entire Office build. Further, using BytesFromCacheServer I can confirm the 517 MB was downloaded from Configuration Manager connected cache, not egress to internet.<BR />*In the example the client was N-2 plus Office was a new version which contributed to larger download.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><STRONG>4.&nbsp;[Server] Check the Configuration Manager Connected Cache disk for build.</STRONG></P>\n<OL class=\"lia-list-style-type-lower-alpha\">\n<LI>Browse the Connect Cache disk and explore content under officecdn.microsoft.com.edgesuite.net to find dynamically populated content for latest Monthly Enterprise Channel 16.0.13001.20520</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"DOINC.png\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/214332i8EE542B4A0354E39/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"DOINC.png\" alt=\"DOINC.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Conclusion:</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\">Delivery Optimization and Microsoft Connected Cache provide a powerful and low cost of ownership method for Office installations and updates using peer to peer sharing technologies.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>FAQ</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Are there some additional references for Delivery Optimization and its capabilities?</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/deployment/update/waas-delivery-optimization-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Delivery Optimization reference</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/Delivery-Optimization-Scenarios-and-configuration-options/ba-p/280195\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Delivery Optimization: Scenarios and configuration options</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o0C2j7msdCE\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Delivery Optimization deep dive: How to reduce internet bandwidth impact on your network (Ignite 2018 presentation)</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/Ignite/Microsoft-Ignite-Orlando-2017/BRK2048\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/configmgr/core/plan-design/hierarchy/microsoft-connected-cache#:~:text=Enable%20Connected%20Cache.%201%20In%20the%20Configuration%20Manager,the%20most%20free%20space.%20Note%20...%20More%20items\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Connected Cache in Configuration Manager</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/windows-it-pro-blog/introducing-microsoft-connected-cache-microsoft-s-cloud-managed/ba-p/963898\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Introducing Microsoft Connected Cache: Microsoft’s cloud-managed cache solution</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Where can I obtain more information about VPN and remote configuration options?</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/microsoft-365-vpn-implement-split-tunnel?view=o365-worldwide#common-vpn-scenarios\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Common VPN scenarios</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/configuring-office-365-proplus-updates-for-remote-workers-using/ba-p/1253491\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Configuring Office 365 ProPlus updates for remote workers using VPN</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Can we use a third-party Configuration Manager alternate content provider with this solution?</STRONG></P>\n<P>No, alternate content providers typically depend on Configuration Manager software update workflow which won’t be used in scenario above.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>For the UpdateDeadline GPO, how does that impact the end user experience?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Please see section “User Experience when updating from CDN” from blog posting <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/understanding-office-365-proplus-updates-for-it-pros-cdn-vs-sccm/ba-p/795728\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Understanding Office 365 ProPlus Updates for IT Pros (CDN vs SCCM)</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>The Authors</STRONG></P>\n<P>This blog post is brought to you by <LI-USER uid=\"222575\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;and <LI-USER Once that timeframe is set, owners of these groups get notification emails reminding them to renew these groups if they still need them. This announcement wraps up our set of commercial previews for Office 2019, which included <SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-Apps-Blog/Office-2019-Preview-is-ready-for-Commercial-customers/ba-p/187506\" target=\"_blank\">Office 2019 for Windows</A></SPAN> and <SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-Apps-Blog/Office-2019-for-Mac-Preview-is-ready-for-commercial-customers/ba-p/202724\" target=\"_blank\">Office 2019 for Mac</A></SPAN> earlier this year.&nbsp; With this announcement, we're well positioned to ship Office 2019, the next perpetual update to Office, in the next few months.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Office 365 delivers the most productive and most secure Office experience – with the lowest total cost of ownership for deployment and management.&nbsp; But for customers who aren’t yet ready to move to the cloud, Office 2019 provides an update to the perpetual apps and servers. <BR /> <BR /> <STRONG>Exchange Server 2019</STRONG> <BR /> Exchange Server 2019 will support Windows 2019 Server core and allow customers to run Exchange on the most secure Windows operating system to date.&nbsp; In addition, this release will include new and improved search powered by Bing and improved calendaring with features like Do Not Forward and Simplified Calendar Sharing. See what else we’re bringing to Exchange Server 2019 <SPAN><A href=\"https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/exchange/2018/07/24/exchange-server-2019-public-preview/\" target=\"_blank\">here</A></SPAN>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Skype for Business Server 2019</STRONG><BR /> Skype for Business Server 2019 will continue to support on-premises and hybrid customers.&nbsp; This release adds security, quality, and performance features to improve the hybrid scenario, and refreshes mainstream support.&nbsp; New features include Cloud Voicemail, Cloud Org Auto Attendant, Cloud Call Data Connector, and Streamlined Migration to Teams. For more on Skype for Business Server 2019, see our blog post <SPAN><A href=\"http://aka.ms/sfbsvr\" target=\"_blank\">here</A></SPAN>.<BR /> <BR /> <STRONG>SharePoint Server 2019</STRONG><BR /> SharePoint Server 2019 adds new value for end users, IT, and developers. For end users, SharePoint Server 2019 delivers new, modern experiences.&nbsp; IT professionals will see improved performance and scale with simplified management. And developers will now be able to build for both cloud and on-premise environments with deeper SharePoint Framework integration. Check out the <SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-SharePoint-Blog/Announcing-Availability-of-SharePoint-Server-2019-Preview/ba-p/214427\" target=\"_blank\">preview blog</A></SPAN> to see what we are delivering in SharePoint Server 2019.<BR /> <BR /> <STRONG>Project Server 2019</STRONG> <BR /> Project Server 2019 offers a robust end-to-end project and portfolio management solution, with strong collaboration capabilities powered by SharePoint Server 2019. Updates include enhancements to performance and scalability, improved reporting, and an expanded set of APIs.&nbsp; For more information, see the Project team’s <SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Project-Blog/Microsoft-Project-Server-2019-available-for-preview-today/ba-p/218063\" target=\"_blank\">blog post</A></SPAN>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Going forward, we will be investing in and adding new capabilities to Office 365. Office 2019 will be a valuable upgrade for customers who feel that they need to keep some or all of their apps and servers on-premises.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 22 Oct 2018 16:27:56 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"14897172f3359106ad7cf27a04b25a1e","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Jared Spataro","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639102},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"2018 Global Office 365 Developer Bootcamp","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/2018-global-office-365-developer-bootcamp/ba-p/222779","description":"<P class=\"\"><SPAN class=\"\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"BootCamp Logo - Dark@2x.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/38721i79C3FC2D3AD975B6/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"BootCamp Logo - Dark@2x.png\" alt=\"BootCamp Logo - Dark@2x.png\" /></span></SPAN></P><P>&nbsp;</P><P class=\"\"><SPAN class=\"\">Following the success of last year, Global Office 365 Developer Bootcamp now becomes an annual event. And we’ve designed new innovations for <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/office-365-proplus/CFQ7TTC0K8R0?activetab=pivot%3aoverviewtab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 ProPlus</A> to do just that. As announced at Microsoft Ignite 2019 last week, we introduced:<BR /><BR /></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>An update to the Office cloud policy service.</LI>\n<LI>Deeper integration for managing Office 365 for Mac using Jamf Pro.</LI>\n<LI>New tools for Configuration Manager to better plan Office deployment projects.</LI>\n<LI>New security features for the Office client.</LI>\n<LI>New Group Policy setting to enable users to install Insider builds.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><BR />Together, these new functionalities help you more efficiently adopt, deploy, and manage Office 365 ProPlus—regardless of the size of your organization and the platform you choose.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><STRONG><EM>Cross-platform support* for the Office cloud policy service<BR /><BR /></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>The Office cloud policy service—initially announced for Windows earlier this year—is a cloud-based service that enables IT admins to enforce policy settings for Office 365 ProPlus users. The settings are enforced across devices, whether domain-joined, Azure Active Directory (AAD)-joined, or completely unmanaged. In short, the policy settings roam with the user.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P>Today, we’re introducing an update to add cross-platform support for Office on the web, Android, Mac*, and iOS* devices, giving administrators the ability to manage Office policies from a single portal for all their Office users. To learn more, read <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/DeployOffice/overview-office-cloud-policy-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this article</A>.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><EM>Easier Office 365 for Mac management using Jamf Pro<BR /><BR /></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>Today, we're announcing deeper integration for <A href=\"https://aka.ms/jamf-and-office\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">managing Office 365 using Jamf Pro</A>. Our integration with the new Application and Custom Settings experience, which was demonstrated at the Jamf Nation User Conference (JNUC), allows IT admins to easily set Office 365 policies using a familiar forms-based interface. Mac administrators can centrally configure security, privacy, and update policies to deliver the very best Office 365 experience to their users, including:<BR /><BR /></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Enabling friction-free sign-on to Office 365</LI>\n<LI>Controlling privacy and telemetry options</LI>\n<LI>Reducing the attack surface for sensitive devices</LI>\n<LI>Increasing compliance levels through feature enablement</LI>\n<LI>Lowering support costs by implementing desired update workflows</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><EM>Pilot health and inventory tools to deploy faster<BR /><BR /></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>We’ve brought a pair of updates to the Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager—you probably know it as Config Manager—to help IT admins streamline parts of the device upgrade process. The first of these shows the health of pilot devices as it relates to a forthcoming upgrade. Pilots are a subset of devices you’ve selected to validate before deploying. With this update, that subset will also show the upgraded health of selected devices, including which are ready to upgrade right now. For those not ready, you can see what issues are blocking the upgrade and remediate those for faster deployment.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The second update, which enhances your existing inventory tools, leverages device telemetry to determine which devices running Office 365 ProPlus are ready to update to newer release. This update also provides insight into issues that are blocking an immediate upgrade, giving you the information needed to remediate problem areas.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Pilot health and enhanced inventory tools are just the beginning. With 80% of Office 365 ProPlus admins using Config Manager, we’re continuing to prioritize upgrades for the Config Manager console—including features like recommended configurations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><EM>Safe Documents and Application Guard for enhanced file protection<BR /><BR /></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN>On Tuesday, we shared Safe Documents, a new capability that brings the power of Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) to Office 365 ProPlus.</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN> When a user has a document in Protected View and wants to consider that document “trusted”, the field will be automatically checked against the ATP threat cloud before release.&nbsp;Admins will have advanced visibility and response capabilities, including alerts, logs, and visibility into similar threats across the enterprise. </SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>We also showed an early, live demo of Application Guard capabilities integrated with Office 365 ProPlus.&nbsp;When available in mid-2020, Microsoft 365 customers will be able to open an untrusted Word, Excel, or PowerPoint file in a virtualized container instead of Protected View.&nbsp;From there, users will be able to view, print, edit, and save changes to untrusted Office documents—all while benefiting from hardware-level security.&nbsp;If the untrusted file is malicious, the attack is confined to the isolated container and the host machine is untouched. Users will be able to leverage Safe Documents to “trust” a document securely, and full reporting and audit trails will be available through ATP.</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><EM><STRONG>Group Policy to allow users to experience&nbsp;Office Insider builds </STRONG></EM>&nbsp;<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P>Enabling your users to self-select into the <A href=\"https://insider.office.com/en-us/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office Insiders program</A> is as simple as delivering a policy.&nbsp; This can be done by using the Office Cloud Policy service which is available in config.office.com and via group policy. This policy makes it easy for you to enable which users can self-select their device to receive the Office Insider builds as they become available in order to try new features. Read more in this <A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=2104928\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">article</A>.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><STRONG><EM>Microsoft Teams deployed with Office 365 ProPlus<BR /><BR /></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>As a quick reminder, when you update to Version 1908 of Office 365 ProPlus in January, Microsoft Teams will be rolled out to existing installations on the Semi-Annual Channel. Learn more about deploying Teams as part of Office 365 ProPlus in <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/teams-install\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this article</A>.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><STRONG><EM>Office 201</EM></STRONG><STRONG><EM>0 End of Support<BR /><BR /></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>Finally, support for Office 2010 is ending in October 2020—but with Office 365 ProPlus, you can continue to stay current with the latest Office tools and security features, like the ones we described above. Read more in this <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2019/10/14/support-office-2010-ending-current-office-365-proplus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blog</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Catch up on all other Office 365 ProPlus deployment content recorded at Ignite by following <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Microsoft-Ignite-2019-Guide-to-Office-365-ProPlus-Deployment/ba-p/928034\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this guide</A>. As always, learn <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/DeployOffice/whats-new-office-it-pros\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">what’s new in Office 365 ProPlus</A>, watch our YouTube <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtGE6W1kFbokk_aFVyN1KmA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Deployment Insider channel</A>, and join <A href=\"https://insider.office.com/en-us/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office Insider Program</A>.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P>You may also find the following additional resources useful:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Office Apps deployment center <A target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://docs.microsoft.com/deployoffice</A></LI>\n<LI>What's new in Office deployment for IT Pros <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.microsoft.com%2FDeployOffice%2Fwhats-new-office-it-pros&amp;data=02%7C01%7Cyanat%40microsoft.com%7Cecebda9f31344d74eae808d75283eb39%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637068598848470447&amp;sdata=eWZOdbKuCixIcX3e%2BpiVCQDmYBn2evv1RCbWAdmnwJU%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://docs.microsoft.com/DeployOffice/whats-new-office-it-pros</A></LI>\n<LI>Microsoft 365 Enterprise documentation and resources <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.microsoft.com%2Fmicrosoft-365%2Fenterprise%2F&amp;data=02%7C01%7Cyanat%40microsoft.com%7Cecebda9f31344d74eae808d75283eb39%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637068598848470447&amp;sdata=iVqwNEIgjF%2B3EG4gzVszTOdzYwn9%2BJemnUbgEHUSuuM%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/enterprise/</A></LI>\n<LI>Getting started deploying Office Insider builds <A from FastTrack <A href=\"https://fasttrack.microsoft.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://fasttrack.microsoft.com</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><EM>*Office cloud policy service support for Mac and iOS devices is expected to roll out soon.</EM></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 13 Nov 2019 00:02:52 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"1e537645c8f96956872776120f49ec41","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Yana Terukhova","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639095},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"User Activity based Expiration Policy for Office 365 groups is now generally available!","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/user-activity-based-expiration-policy-for-office-365-groups-is/ba-p/942877","description":"<P>\n We are happy to announce the general availability of User Activity based Expiration Policy for Office 365 groups. This means any active groups covered by the expiration policy will be automatically renewed.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n We would like to draw your attention to a few resources available to you:&nbsp;\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  Documentation will be updated shortly:\n  <SPAN> \n   <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/admin/create-groups/office-365-groups-expiration-policy?view=o365-worldwide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n    https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/admin/create-groups/office-365-groups-expiration-policy\n   </A>\n  </SPAN>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <SPAN>\n   <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/groups-lifecycle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n    https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/groups-lifecycle\n   </A>\n  </SPAN>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  THANK YOU\n </STRONG> to all private preview participants for the feedback and comments you shared in this community. Please continue share your thoughts here. Also, please feel free to reach out to us on:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  User Voice: \n  <A href=\"https://office365.uservoice.com/forums/286611-office-365-groups\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Office 365 groups\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Support &amp; feedback: \n  <A href=\"mailto:groupsarfeedback@microsoft.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   groupsarfeedback@microsoft.com\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   --\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   Office 365 Groups power collaboration across Office 365\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n Collaboration is a key ingredient for the success of any organization. Office 365 groups, of the most used collaboration features in Microsoft 365 today, power the collaboration features across \n <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/itshowcase/a-foundation-for-modern-collaboration-microsoft-365-bolsters-teamwork\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  apps\n </A>, including Outlook, Teams, Yammer, and SharePoint. Employees can create groups quickly and start collaborating with co-workers by sharing group documents, emails, and calendars.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   The twin problems&nbsp;of Groups Life cycle Management\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n As the number of Office 365 groups increases, an organization needs to strike a balance between cleaning up unused groups and ensuring any valuable groups do not get deleted unintentionally, causing data loss. Many of you have shared feedback about these challenges in groups lifecycle management.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   You say, we listen and act\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n We heard your feedback, and we've made some changes! We are excited to announce the new version of expiration policy which ensures any group being actively used continues to be available, circumventing expiration. This feature makes life easier for users, including admins, group owners and members, by automating the expiration and renewal process by tracking groups for user activity across different apps, like Teams, SharePoint, Outlook, tied to the group.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <SPAN>\n  <STRONG>\n   The new expiration&nbsp;policy&nbsp;puts&nbsp;group&nbsp;life cycle&nbsp;management&nbsp;on&nbsp;autopilot\n  </STRONG>\n </SPAN>\n <SPAN>\n  &nbsp;\n </SPAN>\n</P> \n<P>\n The current Expiration policy allows you to set an expiration time frame for selected or all Office 365 groups . After the defined group lifetime, owners are asked to renew them if they are still needed. With this newly added intelligence, groups which are being actively used will be automagically renewed. This preempts the need for any manual action on the part of the group owners. This is based on user activity in groups across Office 365 apps like Outlook, SharePoint and Teams.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Example\n </STRONG>:&nbsp; At Contoso, the administrator has configured the Group lifetime to be 180 days. Megan is the owner of the Contoso Marketing Office 365 Group, with Enrico and Alex as its members. Her group is set to expire the following month. If an owner or a member performs actions like uploading a document in SharePoint, visiting Teams channel or sending an email to the group in Outlook, the group is automatically renewed for another 180 days, and she does not get any expiry notifications.\n</P> \n<P style=\"text-align: center;\">\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Image 1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123624i4637AD5ED82B7A79/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Image 1.png\" alt=\"Image 1.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Manual Controls\n </STRONG>: Group owners will continue to have the manual “delete”, “renew” option for granular control.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Soft Delete\n </STRONG>: Like before, groups which aren't renewed (either automatically based on activity or manually) will be soft deleted. Groups in “Soft-delete” state can still be restored within 30 days, after which the content is deleted permanently.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Image 2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123623i433F1BE9C02BBCDE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Image 2.png\" alt=\"Image 2.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  User actions for group auto-renewal: \n </STRONG>The following user actions will lead to automatic renewal of groups\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  SharePoint – View, Edit, Download, Move, Share, Upload Files\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Outlook – Join group, Read/write group message from group space, Like a message (OWA)\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Teams – Visit a Teams channels\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n We will continue to update this list to fine tune group auto-renewal experience.\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  &nbsp;\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Auditing and reporting:\n </STRONG> Administrators can get a list of auto-renewed groups from audit logs on the \n <A href=\"https://portal.azure.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  azure portal\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Image 3_2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123974iE6081E88324C3CF0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Image 3_2.png\" alt=\"Image 3_2.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Here are some quick steps to get you started.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Getting started\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Office 365 groups expiration policy can be configured from the Azure Active Directory portal, as well as programmatically via Azure Active Directory PowerShell. Please note you need an Azure AD Premium license. Below is a quick tutorial on how to get started with the functionality in the new Azure portal experience.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  1. Create Expiration Policy: \n </STRONG>Sign into the Azure portal, select \n <STRONG>\n  Azure Active Directory\n </STRONG>, go to the \n <STRONG>\n  Groups\n </STRONG> tab and select \n <STRONG>\n  Expiration\n </STRONG> under \n <STRONG>\n  Settings\n </STRONG>. (More details \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/users-groups-roles/groups-lifecycle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  here\n </A>) .\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Image 4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/123621iAF9DD3AB0226F549/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Image 4.png\" alt=\"Image 4.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  2. Set Group Life cycle: \n </STRONG>Specify the group lifetime in days and select which groups you want the expiration settings to apply to.\n</P> \n<P>\n Group owners will receive a renewal notification 30 days before the expiration date, and from that notification they can renew their group with a single click!\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n If there is no user activity in the group (and the owners don't manually renew their group) within the required time frame, their group will expire. Upon expiry it will stay in a “soft deleted” state for 30 days. Owners of deleted groups will receive a notification letting them know their group has been deleted and giving them the opportunity to restore their group within 30 days after its deletion date. The Group will be permanently deleted after 30 days.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  3. Auto-renewal based on user activity\n </STRONG>: No explicit action is required to enable activity-based auto-renewal. If an the expiration policy is set for Office 365 groups, auto-renewal will be enabled by default.\n</P> \n<P>\n Learn more about how you can restore you group to recover all its content, including SharePoint, Planner, and Outlook -&nbsp;\n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/active-directory-groups-restore-azure-portal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  how to restore deleted Office 365 groups\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Note: The new version of Office 365 groups expiration feature is available for all Azure AD Premium customers.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Let us know what you think!\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n We would love to hear your feedback! If you have any suggestions for us, questions, or issues to report, please leave a comment below. We're always looking for ways to improve.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n User Voice: \n <A href=\"https://office365.uservoice.com/forums/286611-office-365-groups/suggestions/33942997-add-security-groups-to-office-365-groups\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Add security groups to Office 365 groups\n </A>\n</P> \n<P>\n Support &amp; feedback: \n <A href=\"mailto:groupsarfeedback@microsoft.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  groupsarfeedback@microsoft.com\n </A>\n</P> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Yuan Karppanen\n</P> \n<P>\n Program
