Han","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/29881i4AE2A4E7BA79FA32/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn13@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-39-806_20c500426a91e800.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/29882iBD88C73DEB940230/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn60@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-52-44-589_6bb9ebc7b9fa3988.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/29883i6E85F0C2C8D669DA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn72@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-48-557_cca6bab69b3ba327.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/29884i2555D18A3E4692C3/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn36@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-42-772_c59d6185543a928d.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/29885i749A4BAB13C20D16/image-dimensions/390x704?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn55@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-42-141_c11d2e1129ed293f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639103},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Multi-Geo reduced seat minimum and expanded geo coverage","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/multi-geo-reduced-seat-minimum-and-expanded-geo-coverage/ba-p/1310777","description":"<P>We are excited to announce the availability of Microsoft 365 Multi-Geo in Switzerland, and the reduction of the seat minimum requirement to 250 for Enterprise Agreement customers. These updates will allow more organizations to utilize Microsoft 365 Multi-Geo to address their legal, compliance, industry, or other related data residency requirements.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Please note that this product was previously referred to as ‘Multi-Geo Capabilities for Office 365,’ and will now be named ‘Multi-Geo Capabilities for Microsoft 365,’ consistent with the overall <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/03/30/introducing-new-microsoft-365-personal-family-subscriptions/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 announcement on March 30</A>. We previously announced the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/security-privacy-and-compliance/multi-geo-in-exchange-online-and-onedrive/ba-p/182710\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">general availability of Multi-Geo Capabilities</A>, in addition to the workload expansion from Exchange Online and OneDrive to <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/now-available-multi-geo-in-sharepoint-and-office-365-groups/ba-p/263302\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">include SharePoint Online</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 Multi-Geo provides a solution for multi-national businesses seeking a balance between working as a single organization in the Microsoft 365 cloud and addressing global data residency needs. With the reduced seat minimum requirement and coverage across Exchange Online, OneDrive, and SharePoint Online this feature helps bring the full power of Microsoft 365 – the world’s productivity cloud – to organizations at any stage in their digital transformation journey.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 Multi-Geo enables customers to reduce their on-premises footprint by allocating user data at rest to our available geo locations in the Microsoft 365 cloud, facilitating their ability to meet data residency obligations, all within a single tenant. For in-depth information on how Multi-Geo capabilities work and how to get started, please review the links above.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Available Geos</STRONG></P>\n<P>Microsoft is continuously making new infrastructure investments in response to growing customer demand as more industry leaders choose Microsoft’s cloud services. As a result, Microsoft 365 Multi-Geo is increasing our geo coverage as we expand our datacenter footprint for Microsoft 365. With the latest addition of Switzerland, you can now extend your Microsoft 365 tenant to store your users’ data in one or more of the following geos:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<TABLE>\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"321\">\n<P>Australia</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"302\">\n<P>Asia Pacific</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"321\">\n<P>Canada</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"302\">\n<P>European Union</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"321\">\n<P>France</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"302\">\n<P>India</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"321\">\n<P>Japan</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"302\">\n<P>Korea</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"321\">\n<P>United Kingdom</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"302\">\n<P>United States</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"321\">\n<P>United Arab Emirates</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"302\">\n<P>South Africa</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"321\">\n<P>Switzerland</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"302\">\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"John_Mighell_0-1587062466172.png\" style=\"width: 508px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184836i4EEE1D209C54EF0E/image-dimensions/508x286?v=1.0\" width=\"508\" height=\"286\" title=\"John_Mighell_0-1587062466172.png\" alt=\"John_Mighell_0-1587062466172.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn about where your Microsoft 365 data is stored at&nbsp;<A href=\"https://aka.ms/datamaps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/DataMaps</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Industry Focus</STRONG></P>\n<P>We see worldwide organizations of all sizes and across all industries currently investing in new ways of empowering their employees with modern tools to enable secure, flexible, and mobile working that fosters collaboration.&nbsp;The ability to configure data residency on a by-user basis helps&nbsp;<SPAN>organizations</SPAN> meet regulatory requirements, which is particularly important and relevant in industries such as healthcare, manufacturing, public sector, and financial services. This latest step enables companies adopting&nbsp;<SPAN>Microsoft 365</SPAN>&nbsp;to accelerate their digital transformation journey. As a result, we see <SPAN>Microsoft 365</SPAN>&nbsp;Multi-Geo assisting organizations across the world to enable the scalability required to address critical challenges affecting the global community.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<TABLE>\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"144\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"John_Mighell_1-1586976202701.jpeg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184614iED66914417EB3A5B/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"John_Mighell_1-1586976202701.jpeg\" alt=\"John_Mighell_1-1586976202701.jpeg\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</TD>\n<TD width=\"479\">\n<P>“We now have as many people outside the US as in it, and although the GDPR doesn’t mandate a particular Geo for data residency, our clients are hypersensitive about data privacy issues, so we prefer to get in front of it,” Ackermann says. “Our lifeblood includes data which is personal information about people and with Multi-Geo, we’re able to proactively address client concerns about data residency.”</P>\n<P>-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <STRONG>Bryan Ackermann, Chief Information Officer, Korn Ferry</STRONG></P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Pricing and Licensing:</STRONG></P>\n<P>Multi-Geo is available as an add-on to the following Microsoft 365 subscription plans for EA customers with a minimum of&nbsp;250 Microsoft 365 seats in their Microsoft 365 tenant, and a minimum of 5% of the Microsoft 365 seats within a tenant have corresponding Multi-Geo Capabilities for Microsoft 365. Please contact your Microsoft account team for details.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<TABLE>\n<TBODY>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"384\">\n<P>Microsoft 365 F1, E1, E3, or E5</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"384\">\n<P>Microsoft 365 F1, E1, E3, or E5</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"384\">\n<P>Exchange Online Plan 1 or Plan 2</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"384\">\n<P>OneDrive for Business Plan 1 or Plan 2</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n<TR>\n<TD width=\"384\">\n<P>SharePoint Online Plan 1 or Plan 2</P>\n</TD>\n</TR>\n</TBODY>\n</TABLE>\n<P><STRONG><EM>&nbsp;</EM></STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Licensing</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>USD $2/user/month for users in Satellite Geos</LI>\n<LI>Resource mailboxes (Rooms/Equipment) and Shared mailboxes need to be licensed</LI>\n<LI>Microsoft 365 Group Mailboxes moved to Satellite Geos will not need to be licensed for Multi-Geo</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>How to buy Multi-Geo?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Please talk to your Microsoft representative to buy Multi-Geo Capabilities for Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Questions?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Please comment on this thread with your questions</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 16 Apr 2020 18:42:38 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184836i4EEE1D209C54EF0E/image-dimensions/508x286?v=1.0","linkMd5":"a6c65bd48e6a270e4f8f82342c629b51","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-42-194_44c8040a01ebb100.webp","destWidth":508,"destHeight":285,"sourceBytes":72622,"destBytes":9088,"author":"John_Mighell","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184836i4EEE1D209C54EF0E/image-dimensions/508x286?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-42-194_44c8040a01ebb100.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184614iED66914417EB3A5B/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn100@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-45-792_ac0299c265326189.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639091},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Ink annotations in Office Lens","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/ink-annotations-in-office-lens/ba-p/193565","description":"<P>Today we are excited to announce the following update to your most loved scanner app – Office Lens.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I> </I></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><I>On</I> <I>Office Lens for </I><I>Android and iOS</I><I>, </I><I>you can now annotate your photos using </I><I>our</I><I> new inking tool. </I></P>\n<P><I><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"smaller_img.png\" style=\"width: 433px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/34388i1D75953256BB93C7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"smaller_img.png\" alt=\"smaller_img.png\" /></span></I></P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233117&quot;:true,&quot;134233118&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">We spoke to a lot of passionate Office Lens customers around the world and found an overwhelming need to annotate on photos. With this update, it has been made easy and simple to annotate your scans. Like traditional methods involving ink and printed paper, Office Lens ink is made to feel natural and fluid, and with it you can annotate while on the go and in the moment – as soon as you have captured the perfect image using Office Lens.&nbsp; <BR />&nbsp;<BR />Want to draw attention to a part of the document? Want to mark important points on a whiteboard image that you took during a brainstorming meeting? You can now easily and quickly annotate using the new inking tool. You can even use it to redact the information you want to hide in your confidential scans.&nbsp; </SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/YNQWmTCtfwA\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"autoplay; encrypted-media\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233117&quot;:true,&quot;134233118&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\"><EM>Ink Annotations in Office Lens for Android</EM> </SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233117&quot;:true,&quot;134233118&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\"><BR />To get the latest Office Lens Ink feature, update your app now. Please comment below and let us know how you would use ink annotations in your daily lives.&nbsp; </SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 17 May 2018 23:31:25 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/34388i1D75953256BB93C7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"54a5c809032da8eb1087e374bd48f0e0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn32@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-50-41-159_5710274e15fada22.webp","destWidth":433,"destHeight":748,"sourceBytes":178966,"destBytes":38876,"author":"Mitali Jain","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/34388i1D75953256BB93C7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn32@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-50-41-159_5710274e15fada22.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639103},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Deploy Office 365 ProPlus to remote workers","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/deploy-office-365-proplus-to-remote-workers/ba-p/1258514","description":"<P>This blog post will address the enterprise IT admin’s challenge on how to deploy Office 365 ProPlus to remote workers without saturating the company’s VPN connections. It will show you how to implement a tactical approach which allows an IT admin to stay in control and quickly relief the pain of VPN congestion by offloading content distribution to the Microsoft Content Delivery Network (CDN). Maybe you are in the process of moving off legacy versions of Office and want to keep the pace with e.g. the <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/office-2010-end-of-support\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 2010 end-of-support</A> approaching fast. There are multiple strategic solutions available (e.g. <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/enterprise-mobility-security/deploying-office-365-proplus-with-microsoft-intune/ba-p/250292\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Intune</A> and <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/windows-autopilot/windows-autopilot\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Windows Autopilot</A>), but for now we focus on a quick fix.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Overview of blog post series</H2>\n<P>This blog post is part of a series, which is brought to you by the Office Rangers Team at Microsoft, a group of senior deployment experts. The series provides guidance on how to address scenarios around working-from-home across the lifecycle of an Office 365 ProPlus installation:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Initial install - How to upgrade to Office 365 ProPlus with minimal on-prem network impact for remote workers (this post)</LI>\n<LI>Servicing -&nbsp;<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/configuring-office-365-proplus-updates-for-remote-workers-using/ba-p/1253491\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Configuring Office 365 ProPlus updates for remote workers using VPN</A></LI>\n<LI><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">Managing - Adding e.g. Project, Visio or additional Language Packs in “</SPAN><A style=\"font-family: inherit; background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/fieldnotes/build-dynamic-lean-universal-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Building dynamic, lean &amp; universal packages</A><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">”</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-secure-your-remote-workers-with-office-cloud-policy/ba-p/1308579\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">How to secure your remote workers with Office Cloud Policy Service</SPAN></A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>We hope this will help you to minimize the impact of deploying, servicing and managing Office 365 ProPlus on your own network and your user’s VPN connections.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>The Concept</H2>\n<P>With the approach described below, we want to achieve two things:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Keep IT admins in control what happens when by continue using your enterprise management solution like Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (formally known as System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM))</LI>\n<LI>Offloading the content distribution to Microsoft’s CDN to allow remote user to leverage their local internet connection instead of pulling large source files from your ConfigMgr Distribution Points over VPN connections</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>We will walk you through the process on how to adjust an existing Office 365 ProPlus deployment package for a hybrid approach, update your sources and ensure that the source file download will bypass your VPN.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 1 – Adjust your deployment package</H2>\n<P>To allow remote users to leverage their local internet connection for source file access, we have to remove the source files from the Configuration Manager application. Navigate to the folder which is holding your software sources, locate the “office” folder and delete it:</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Deploy_O365PP_to_Remote_workers_2.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179914i153480540E8C3D5A/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Deploy_O365PP_to_Remote_workers_2.jpg\" alt=\"Deploy_O365PP_to_Remote_workers_2.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">In the above example, 11 Language Packs were included in the deployment package, bumping the size up to 6+ gigabytes. Keep the setup.exe as well as any configuration files located in the folder. This reduces the size of your deployment package to less than 10 megabyte. That’s a huge saving on your VPN connections.</SPAN></P>\n<P>In case you don’t have an Office 365 ProPlus installation package yet, you can use the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/deploy-office-365-proplus-with-configuration-manager#step-3---create-and-deploy-the-office-application-to-the-pilot-group\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">built-in wizard</A> to create one. Maybe you want to adjust the handling of languages, instead of hard-coding those you might want to use <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-of-deploying-languages-in-office-365-proplus#install-the-same-languages-as-the-operating-system\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MatchOS</A> or <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-of-deploying-languages-in-office-365-proplus#install-the-same-languages-as-a-previous-msi-installation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MatchPreviousMSI</A>. After that, apply the steps above.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 2 – Update the content sources</H2>\n<P>If your application was already synced to Distribution Points, those still have the larger package cached. Navigate to <STRONG>Software Library</STRONG> &gt; <STRONG>Application Management</STRONG> &gt; <STRONG>Applications</STRONG>, select your application, switch to the <STRONG>Deployment Types</STRONG> Tab, right-click the appropriate entry and click <STRONG>Update Content</STRONG>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Deploy_O365PP_to_Remote_workers_3.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179915i4ECD5655DC656EE6/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Deploy_O365PP_to_Remote_workers_3.jpg\" alt=\"Deploy_O365PP_to_Remote_workers_3.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">This will re-sync any changes to your Distribution Points, so those will now also have the smaller deployment package ready to sync to devices.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 3 – Verify VPN configuration and deploy</H2>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">Once a client has received the smaller deployment package through ConfigMgr and kicks off the installation, it will download the source files directly from the Microsoft CDN. It is important to ensure that your devices can actually reach out to those endpoints directly and don’t backhaul through the VPN tunnel. We <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-quickly-optimize-office-365-traffic-for-remote-staff-amp/ba-p/1214571\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">published guidance on how to enable so-called VPN split-tunneling</A>, the endpoints relevant for Office 365 ProPlus source file download are listed at <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/enterprise/urls-and-ip-address-ranges\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 URLs and IP address</A> ranges as entry #92.</SPAN></P>\n<P>If you already have an active deployment of the newly-updated package, clients will start receiving it after the Distribution Points have finished syncing the changes. If you want to start with a fresh deployment, just follow the regular guidelines in your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Step 4 - Leverage peer caching to reduce on-prem traffic (optional)</H2>\n<P>The following step is not required, but highly recommended. In order to use the same deployment package for your remote and on-premises workers, we recommend to configure and enable&nbsp;<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/delivery-optimization\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noopener noreferrer\">Delivery Optimization for Office</A><SPAN>&nbsp;in combination with&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/configmgr/core/plan-design/hierarchy/microsoft-connected-cache\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noopener noreferrer\">Connected Cache</A>. This will enable your on-prem devices to share content which is no longer included in the deployment and greatly&nbsp;<SPAN>reduce the load on your corporate internet connection.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>FAQ</H2>\n<P><STRONG>Q:</STRONG> We usually controlled which build is installed by embedding the matching source files. How can I control this now?<BR /><STRONG>A:</STRONG> By default, setup will fetch the latest build available for the specified update channel. You can use the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/configuration-options-for-the-office-2016-deployment-tool#version-attribute-part-of-add-element\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">version attribute</A> in the configuration file to specify a build. This might be important if your organization is wants to deploy the older SAC feature release.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>The Authors</H2>\n<P>This blog post is brought to you by <LI-USER uid=\"6347\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;from the Office 365 ProPlus Ranger Team at Microsoft. Feel free to share your questions and feedback in the comments below.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 28 Apr 2020 08:10:34 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179914i153480540E8C3D5A/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400","linkMd5":"df2215f9bf96e66aed6a1aeeab85daa0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn38@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-39-642_a00c582cdb9117bd.webp","destWidth":400,"destHeight":145,"sourceBytes":10650,"destBytes":8066,"author":"Martin Nothnagel","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179914i153480540E8C3D5A/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn38@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-39-642_a00c582cdb9117bd.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179915i4ECD5655DC656EE6/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn28@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-45-931_bb101b912356e9c7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639090},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Microsoft Whiteboard is now generally available for Windows.","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/microsoft-whiteboard-is-now-generally-available-for-windows/ba-p/214574","description":"<P><STRONG>Note:&nbsp;</STRONG><FONT size=\"2\">September 2018 - Microsoft Whiteboard is now available for iOS and for commercial preview on web. Learn more <A href=\"https://na01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcommunity.microsoft.com%2Ft5%2FOffice-365-Blog%2FMicrosoft-Whiteboard-is-now-available-for-more-devices%2Fba-p%2F255431&amp;data=02%7C01%7Cv-dysnod%40microsoft.com%7C21b387ad931e40dd261608d6295d1803%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C636741877139146109&amp;sdata=XuF2TMdnypzmUZSx8eCLq0egomUasOXwWLtGpjxVWVk%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\">here</A>.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today we are pleased to announce the general availability of the Microsoft Whiteboard app for Windows 10. Whiteboard gives teams a freeform, intelligent canvas for real time ideation, creation, and collaboration.&nbsp; Since releasing a preview of the app in December, more than 200,000 customers have helped us fine tune the feature set and end user experience.&nbsp; Based on their feedback we’ve added a number of new features, including text notes, the ability to add and manipulate images, enhancements to shape and table recognition, accessibility improvements, compliance with various <SPAN><A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=864328\" target=\"_blank\">global standards</A></SPAN>, and more.&nbsp; In addition, the Whiteboard app for iOS and preview on the web will be coming soon. &nbsp;These releases will mark an important milestone in our journey to make Whiteboard the best tool for freeform collaboration across platforms and form factors.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/hG91PYYPDto\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"autoplay; encrypted-media\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Create freely, work naturally</STRONG></P>\n<P>Whiteboard provides an infinite canvas where imagination has room to grow.&nbsp; Draw, type, or add images.&nbsp; Use sticky notes to organize ideas.&nbsp; Stack things up and move them around.&nbsp; Designed for pen, touch, and keyboard, Whiteboard allows you to share your ideas naturally.&nbsp; Intelligent ink recognizes shapes and makes creating tables a snap.&nbsp; And because the canvas expands along with your creations, you never have to worry about running out of space.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MSSurfacePro_MKT_006_RGB_NO_BCKGRND3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/37574iF94A7DA6E6E0303B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MSSurfacePro_MKT_006_RGB_NO_BCKGRND3.png\" alt=\"MSSurfacePro_MKT_006_RGB_NO_BCKGRND3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Work together in real time, wherever you are</STRONG></P>\n<P>Whiteboard brings a team together* – and gives them space to create. &nbsp;Teammates can huddle around a large touchscreen in the same room or work together on their own devices from around the world<SUP>+</SUP>.&nbsp; And, avatars on the canvas help you keep track of who is doing what and bring a natural rhythm to the interaction.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Whiteboard mobile.png\" style=\"width: 969px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/37548iD4B986CFE8C0018A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Whiteboard mobile.png\" alt=\"Whiteboard mobile.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Save automatically, resume seamlessly</STRONG></P>\n<P>Forget taking photos of conference room whiteboards or marking them with “Do Not Erase.” With the Whiteboard app, your brainstorming sessions are saved automatically to the Microsoft cloud, so you can pick up where you left off, whenever – and wherever – inspiration strikes next.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To start using Whiteboard on your Windows 10 device, download the app for free at the <SPAN><A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=863555\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft Store</A></SPAN> and log in with your Microsoft account (Outlook, Hotmail, Live, Xbox, etc.) or Office 365 account (work or school).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>-----</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>* Whiteboard currently supports collaboration within Office 365 tenants for commercial customers, and across personal accounts for customers with a Microsoft account. Collaboration across multiple Office 365 tenants is planned for future release.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SUP>+ </SUP>Microsoft Whiteboard is available as an app for all users on Windows 10 devices. For commercial users, the Whiteboard app will be coming soon to iOS devices and will be accessible from other devices via the Whiteboard web client (preview).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For more information, see the <SPAN><A href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=864328\" target=\"_blank\">FAQ</A></SPAN>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 08 Oct 2018 17:53:54 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/37574iF94A7DA6E6E0303B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"75951c618f2021c53d9ad1122c705689","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn36@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-41-525_e9b881811af766b2.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":603,"sourceBytes":162261,"destBytes":46528,"author":"Jared Spataro","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/37574iF94A7DA6E6E0303B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn36@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-41-525_e9b881811af766b2.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/37548iD4B986CFE8C0018A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn68@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-47-287_a5f4009e18d1e5f3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639102},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Introducing the Microsoft 365 Admin Center","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/introducing-the-microsoft-365-admin-center/ba-p/167392","description":"<P>Last year, at Inspire, we unveiled <A href=\"https://blogs.office.com/en-us/2017/07/10/introducing-microsoft-365/\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft 365</A>, bringing together Office 365, Windows 10 and Enterprise Mobility + Security, to deliver a complete, intelligent and secure solution for the modern workplace. In October Microsoft 365 Business reached <A href=\"https://blogs.office.com/en-us/2017/10/31/empower-your-team-and-safeguard-your-business-with-microsoft-365-business/\" target=\"_blank\">general availability</A>, representing an integrated solution designed to simplify IT for small and medium-sized businesses.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We know that our customers, from small businesses to large enterprises, rely on the admin center for a broad set of activities. From an administration perspective, our vision for Microsoft 365 is to help simplify IT by unifying management across users, devices, apps and services. Today marks an important step in that vision as we are rolling out a new admin experience for Microsoft 365 enterprise customers. This will be a single place for admins to get started with Microsoft 365 and discover the breadth of management capabilities and experiences available to them.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Integrated into this admin center is both the new Microsoft 365 Security &amp; Compliance Center, dedicated to providing security and compliance specialists with integrated management capabilities across Office 365, Windows, and EMS, as well as Microsoft 365 Device Management, dedicated to providing integrated device management capabilities across Intune, Office, and Windows. The Security and Compliance Center will be available shortly, with Device Management to follow afterwards. Please look forward to additional details.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"M365 screen.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/29576iCAF30EC5B0F4886F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"M365 screen.png\" alt=\"M365 screen.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Over the coming months we will continue investing in more integrated, streamlined administration experiences across Microsoft 365 to help organizations become more productive and secure while optimizing their IT resources. We will also continue to improve the admin’s user experience, so admins can complete their tasks faster and easier and get more done with their day.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For Microsoft 365 customers, once this is rolled out to your tenant, you will automatically have the new admin experience. You can login as you usually do, or navigate to <A href=\"http://admin.microsoft.com\" target=\"_blank\">admin.microsoft.com</A> to try out the new admin experience.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 07 Mar 2018 17:01:07 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/29576iCAF30EC5B0F4886F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"3e9a37fadcfd896f7b172ec6222b5d70","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn20@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-42-411_561256a0dfdf01ae.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":688,"sourceBytes":186108,"destBytes":115176,"author":"Brent Davis","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/29576iCAF30EC5B0F4886F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn20@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-50-42-411_561256a0dfdf01ae.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639105},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"5 steps to get you collaborating more effectively in Office 365 Word, Excel, and PowerPoint","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/5-steps-to-get-you-collaborating-more-effectively-in-office-365/ba-p/376983","description":"<P><EM>With last month’s Twins Challenge, we shared a few time-saving tips for <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2019/02/06/5-tricks-for-word-in-office-365/\" target=\"_self\">Word</A>, <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2019/02/06/excel-with-microsoft-excel-in-office-365/\" target=\"_self\">Excel</A>, and <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2019/02/06/5-time-saving-tips-for-powerpoint-in-office-365/\" target=\"_self\">PowerPoint</A>. Today, we’re following up with a few ways to get you started collaborating in your documents.</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><SPAN><STRONG>1. Create and save your documents to the cloud by default. Whether you plan to work on a document with others or simply share it for review, your documents are safer when saved to the cloud.</STRONG></SPAN></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><STRONG><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Save-your-files-to-the-cloud-more-easily/ba-p/325133\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create and save your documents to the cloud</A></STRONG></SPAN><STRONG> by default </STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">Now, when you<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun CommentStart  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">go to save a new</SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\"><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>Word, Excel, or PowerPoint file</SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\"><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">in the desktop</SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\"><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">app<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">using<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">Ctrl-S (Windows),<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"SpellingError  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">Cmd</SPAN><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">-S (macOS), or the Save button in Office, a new dialog will default to OneDrive or SharePoint Online and allow you to quickly set the<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun CommentStart  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">filename and location.<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"TextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-contrast=\"none\"><SPAN class=\"NormalTextRun  BCX0 SCXW251264408\">Once saved to the cloud, you can access the file across your devices.&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN><SPAN class=\"EOP  BCX0 SCXW251264408\" data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233117&quot;:true,&quot;134233118&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/93168_SAVE_DOCS_TO_CLOUD_GIF_EXIT_WITHOUT_SAVING_V03.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"652\" height=\"450\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>And when you forget to save a new document before exiting, you'll see an updated save experience directing you to the cloud. And because documents are saved to the cloud, you can work with others, like real-time co-authoring, from the get go.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Turn on <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/What-is-AutoSave-6d6bd723-ebfd-4e40-b5f6-ae6e8088f7a5\" target=\"_self\">AutoSave</A> so you never have to worry about saving changes to your document.</STRONG><BR />Once a document is in the cloud, AutoSave takes over to regularly sync your documents to the cloud. With AutoSave, you don’t have to worry about hitting save or losing changes since edits are saved automatically.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If the AutoSave toggle is turned off, flip it to “On” and store your file in OneDrive. It saves your file so that you don’t have to.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"AutoSave_Excel_v2.gif\" style=\"width: 651px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100432i6C4C42540CA3C7B5/image-dimensions/651x366?v=1.0\" width=\"651\" height=\"366\" title=\"AutoSave_Excel_v2.gif\" alt=\"AutoSave_Excel_v2.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For those using Office in the browser, your files are already being saved automatically!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>And if you are still saving files to your computer’s hard drive, you are leaving your documents vulnerable to device theft or destruction. Use <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-OneDrive-Blog/Migrate-Your-Files-to-OneDrive-Easily-with-Known-Folder-Move/ba-p/207076\" target=\"_self\">Known Folder Move</A> to easily backup and sync your desktop documents and folders to OneDrive, making OneDrive the default location for those files.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>2. Once in a shared cloud document, you can co-author and even assign tasks using @mentions.</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Video-Share-documents-in-Office-365-1438f676-ee5c-40cb-a1f3-f814e649d2ea\" target=\"_self\">Share Office 365 documents</A> with others to <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Document-collaboration-and-co-authoring-EE1509B4-1F6E-401E-B04A-782D26F564A4\" target=\"_self\">co-author</A> the document together.</STRONG></P>\n<P>Stop spending time merging changes from coworkers into one document or sifting through emails for versions of a file. Simply share the Word document, Excel spreadsheet, or PowerPoint presentation with collaborators and work together.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Once a cloud file is shared, you can work in the file on your own time or with multiple collaborators simultaneously. If you’re editing together in real time, you’ll see others’ changes in real time. Co-author with others on any device that works best for you – web browser, desktop, or mobile.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Coauth Presence in Word Online.gif\" style=\"width: 656px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100446iA342C2379BA1B7F9/image-dimensions/656x335?v=1.0\" width=\"656\" height=\"335\" title=\"Coauth Presence in Word Online.gif\" alt=\"Coauth Presence in Word Online.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><STRONG>Collaborate with your team by using <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/use-mention-in-comments-to-tag-someone-for-feedback-644bf689-31a0-4977-a4fb-afe01820c1fd\" target=\"_self\">@mention</A> and <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Threaded-comments-and-notes-75a51eec-4092-42ab-abf8-7669077b7be3\" target=\"_self\">threaded comments</A> to have a conversation right next to the relevant content in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.</STRONG></P>\n<P>Threaded comments and @mentions ensure that you always have context on what’s going on and enable you to easily have conversations about specific content with collaborators.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"excel modern comments optimize.gif\" style=\"width: 640px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100444iA0D912EEA6CE51E8/image-dimensions/640x427?v=1.0\" width=\"640\" height=\"427\" title=\"excel modern comments optimize.gif\" alt=\"excel modern comments optimize.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To @mention someone, type “@” and the person’s name in the comment. This is an efficient way to get their attention because they will get notified via email to take action. And rolling out to Word, you will be able to <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2018/11/07/collaborate-with-others-and-keep-track-of-to-dos-with-new-ai-features-in-word/\" target=\"_self\">assign tasks</A> to others using @mentions.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"WordiPhoneFrame_6.png\" style=\"width: 298px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100440iC4D1D13D5E1DB3FE/image-dimensions/298x601?v=1.0\" width=\"298\" height=\"601\" title=\"WordiPhoneFrame_6.png\" alt=\"WordiPhoneFrame_6.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\">*Threaded comments is available across Word, Excel, and PowerPoint on the desktop apps, web, and mobile. <BR /></FONT><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\">**@mention is rolling out across Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. @mention is now available in Office Online, Office for iOS, Office for Android, and for Office Insiders on desktop.&nbsp;</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\">***To-dos is currently available for Word on the Mac for Office Insiders (Fast).</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>3. Work together with confidence in a shared document.</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>See what's changed in your PowerPoint presentation <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2019/02/06/5-time-saving-tips-for-powerpoint-in-office-365/\" target=\"_self\">while you were away</A>.</STRONG></P>\n<P>If you’re collaborating on a deck with others, you can see who made new changes, quickly get up-to-speed and start working. You no longer need to scroll through the whole deck to see what’s changed or painstakingly compare slides side-by-side. We’ll tell you if someone has made changes to the slides while you were away and highlight the things that have changed.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"94614_GIFS_FOR_TWINS_CAMPAIGN_WHILE_AWAY_SURFACE_BOOK_V03.gif\" style=\"width: 642px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100441i2C70AAAB6B1609BD/image-dimensions/642x444?v=1.0\" width=\"642\" height=\"444\" title=\"94614_GIFS_FOR_TWINS_CAMPAIGN_WHILE_AWAY_SURFACE_BOOK_V03.gif\" alt=\"94614_GIFS_FOR_TWINS_CAMPAIGN_WHILE_AWAY_SURFACE_BOOK_V03.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\">*This feature is available in PowerPoint client app and on the web now.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Set your file to Read-Only and set the context for how collaborators’ interact with the file.</STRONG></P>\n<P>Want to share a document with a colleague but avoid accidental changes? You can set permissions on a shared document to “<A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Allow-changes-to-parts-of-a-protected-document-187ED01C-8795-43E1-9FD0-C9FCA419DADF\" target=\"_self\">Restrict Editing</A>” or “<A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/add-or-remove-protection-in-your-document-workbook-or-presentation-05084cc3-300d-4c1a-8416-38d3e37d6826\" target=\"_self\">Always Open Read-Only</A>”. By flagging the document as read-only, you are letting collaborators know not to make unintentional edits.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_GIF02_V04.gif\" style=\"width: 636px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100442i2AA9F02A2F4DA406/image-dimensions/636x440?v=1.0\" width=\"636\" height=\"440\" title=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_GIF02_V04.gif\" alt=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_GIF02_V04.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If the file is finalized, you may also want to consider applying “Mark as Final”.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Feel confident making changes in a shared document. Version History lets you see what changes have occurred and revert back if necessary</STRONG></P>\n<P>If a document is being used as a basis for a new document, users should always Save a Copy first to avoid changing the original file.</P>\n<P><BR />If you forget and make changes to the original file while AutoSave is on, no need to worry. You can easily restore a previous version through <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/View-previous-versions-of-Office-files-5c1e076f-a9c9-41b8-8ace-f77b9642e2c2\" target=\"_self\">Version History</A>. To see the list of previous versions of your files, you can go to File &gt; Info &gt; Manage Document.<STRONG><BR /></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_GIF03_V04.gif\" style=\"width: 642px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100443i787C571F98722AD7/image-dimensions/642x444?v=1.0\" width=\"642\" height=\"444\" title=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_GIF03_V04.gif\" alt=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_GIF03_V04.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You also have the option to click on the title bar at the top of your document and select Version History to see who edited your file and how the file has evolved over time. Click on “open version” to see the previous version of the document and compare edits or restore changes.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>4. For existing documents, find and work on them on the web, mobile, or desktop, wherever you prefer.&nbsp;</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG><BR />Find documents you’ve been collaborating on or share them with others from Office.com or the new Office app for Windows 10.</STRONG></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://www.office.com/\" target=\"_self\">Office.com</A> and the recently released <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-Apps-Blog/NEW-The-Office-app-for-Windows-10-Now-Available-to-Everyone/ba-p/353553\" target=\"_self\">Office app for Windows 10</A> are great ways to get started with Office and jump quickly into your work. In the documents section, you can easily find the documents that you have used most recently, pinned for easy access, or shared with others. And, we curate a list of recommended shared documents so that you can spend less time looking for what you need and more time getting things done.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/102554_NEW_OFFICE_APP_GIF3_RECENT_TABS_V02.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"642\" height=\"386\" />&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/open-file-links-directly-in-office-desktop-apps-fe241745-9e05-4142-9ba8-1bb1dc044773?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_self\">Open file links</A> in the Word, Excel, or PowerPoint desktop applications to start working where you prefer<BR /></STRONG>If you are in the Office desktop apps and click on an Office 365 document link that others have shared with you, the file will open directly in the Office desktop apps instead of the web. This option to open files in the Office desktop apps will save you time by taking you to your preferred starting location.<STRONG><BR /></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_IMG01_V05.png\" style=\"width: 645px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100445iE3B2359121B92685/image-dimensions/645x446?v=1.0\" width=\"645\" height=\"446\" title=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_IMG01_V05.png\" alt=\"114956_WXP_COLLABORATION_IMG01_V05.png\" /></span></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">If you prefer using Office on the web, your Word, Excel, and PowerPoint files will continue opening in the browser.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\">*This feature is rolling out to Word, Excel, and PowerPoint desktop applications over the next few months.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>5. Don’t have an Office 365 subscription? You can give Office a try at Office.com.</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>For consumers, you can get started for free with Word, Excel, and PowerPoint on the web by signing in or c<A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4026324/microsoft-account-how-to-create\" target=\"_self\">reating an account</A> at Office.com. <STRONG><BR /></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Once you have an account created, you can get started working in the web browser at <A href=\"https://www.office.com/\" target=\"_self\">Office.com</A> and even <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-gb/article/work-together-on-office-documents-ea3807bc-2b73-406f-a8c9-a493de18258b\" target=\"_self\">work on documents with collaborators</A> (including those who are not using Office).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Find more Office tips and tricks <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/office-training-center/featured-tips\" target=\"_self\">here</A>.</STRONG></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 28 Mar 2019 22:48:46 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/93168_SAVE_DOCS_TO_CLOUD_GIF_EXIT_WITHOUT_SAVING_V03.gif","linkMd5":"d2e55652f8dba12dbb6353574aaf0d87","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn66@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-52-900_9c154fb2c8946b07.webp","destWidth":900,"destHeight":622,"sourceBytes":1300368,"destBytes":869158,"author":"The_Office_Apps_Team","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/93168_SAVE_DOCS_TO_CLOUD_GIF_EXIT_WITHOUT_SAVING_V03.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn66@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-50-52-900_9c154fb2c8946b07.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100432i6C4C42540CA3C7B5/image-dimensions/651x366?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn48@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-50-445_f3a79dd7c45b3398.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100446iA342C2379BA1B7F9/image-dimensions/656x335?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-45-300_d4503d9924d7f674.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100444iA0D912EEA6CE51E8/image-dimensions/640x427?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn88@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-51-586_6146bda2e2255304.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100440iC4D1D13D5E1DB3FE/image-dimensions/298x601?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn63@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-47-390_6203fc31cef47df8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100441i2C70AAAB6B1609BD/image-dimensions/642x444?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn7@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-52-47-178_683c8934a27a3373.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100442i2AA9F02A2F4DA406/image-dimensions/636x440?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn27@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-46-670_90fcda5f3f791224.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100443i787C571F98722AD7/image-dimensions/642x444?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn84@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-52-44-858_ad431cb719f3f44c.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/102554_NEW_OFFICE_APP_GIF3_RECENT_TABS_V02.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn52@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-52-49-621_c9bd6fb39dcf2f21.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/100445iE3B2359121B92685/image-dimensions/645x446?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn44@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-44-840_e48aeb599b002933.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639100},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Admins- welcome to the Microsoft 365 admin center","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/admins-welcome-to-the-microsoft-365-admin-center/ba-p/200696","description":"<P>We built Microsoft 365- a complete IT solution including Office 365, Windows 10, and Enterprise Mobility + Security- to enable organizations to create and work together securely. In that same spirit, our goal is to offer a unified toolset to manage and protect those organizations. In March, <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Introducing-the-Microsoft-365-Admin-Center/ba-p/167392\" target=\"_blank\">we announced the Microsoft 365 admin center</A> as your central location for managing and monitoring applications, services, data, devices, and users across your Microsoft 365 deployment.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today, we are expanding this integrated and intuitive admin experience to users of Office 365. Users of both Office 365 and Microsoft 365 will now have access to the new Microsoft 365 admin center. For Office 365 admins, this means a simpler experience that easily integrates with you other Microsoft services - all without giving up capabilities or control.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>What to expect</H2>\n<P>If you’ve used the Office 365 admin center before, the experience will feel very similar. The navigation is the same, and you’ll have the same granularity of control over your environment. <STRONG>There will be no change to your Office 365 subscription or billing.</STRONG> As you add new apps and services like device management, those will light up in your left navigation pane. Most importantly, you’ll receive all the latest admin center updates and features as they become available.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>New URL, same great experience</H2>\n<P>To access your new admin center experience, point your web browser to <A href=\"https://admin.microsoft.com\" target=\"_blank\">admin.microsoft.com</A>. This is your new front door for managing and monitoring all your Office 365 and Microsoft 365 services. Your new admin center still includes links to all your specialty admin tools for services like OneDrive and SharePoint conveniently linked in the left navigation pane. If you’ve previously created bookmarks for the Office 365 admin center or any of the specialty admin centers, those will continue to work.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Over the next few weeks, we will be updating the admin center links across Office 365 to use the new <A href=\"https://admin.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\">admin.microsoft.com</A> address.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"screenshot.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/35387iE2B2D0490567F033/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"screenshot.png\" alt=\"screenshot.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>More to come</H2>\n<P>In the coming months, we’ll continue to evolve the Microsoft 365 admin center to provide a consistent and intuitive experience across all your Microsoft 365 products. As more information becomes available, we’ll post it here on Microsoft Tech Communities. In the meantime, join the conversation on the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-365/ct-p/microsoft365\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft 365 Tech Communities</A> forums and <A href=\"https://twitter.com/Microsoft365\" target=\"_blank\">Twitter</A>.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 05 Jun 2018 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/35387iE2B2D0490567F033/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"3696396c00e399922d608864324eda61","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn33@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-40-195_3cb6b95b2fc4aa9a.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":688,"sourceBytes":185939,"destBytes":115254,"author":"Brian Besand","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/35387iE2B2D0490567F033/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn33@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-50-40-195_3cb6b95b2fc4aa9a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639103},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Shared Office codebase for Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android means more features for more users faster","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/shared-office-codebase-for-windows-mac-ios-and-android-means/ba-p/150291","description":"<P>Our most-popular Office 365 apps—Excel, PowerPoint, and Word—are designed for the modern workplace, with cutting-edge features like real-time co-authoring, AutoSave, and more. With our newest version of Office for Mac, <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Release-notes-for-Office-2016-for-Mac-ed2da564-6d53-4542-9954-7e3209681a41?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">version 16.9.0</A>, we've extended these capabilities to Apple users; in fact, this release marks the first time in 20 years that Office shares the same codebase across Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android for core functionalities.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This achievement means users across platforms will gain access to new Office capabilities faster than ever. We’ll prioritize the release of these capabilities based on top customer requests and feedback, along with integration and validation considerations for each platform. All Office capabilities will be tailored to the platform’s specific UI, giving them a native feel, and take advantage of certain unique features, like the MacBook Pro’s Touch Bar.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Read on to learn more about new Mac capabilities available with this release, and in our latest release on iPad. Please note, some of these features require an Office 365 subscription. Such features are marked with an asterisk below.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Boost collaboration and ease-of-use across the core Office apps</H2>\n<P>With this release, co-authoring in <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Work-together-on-PowerPoint-presentations-0c30ee3f-8674-4f0e-97be-89cf2892a34d?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">PowerPoint</A> and <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Collaborate-on-Word-documents-with-real-time-co-authoring-7dd3040c-3f30-4fdd-bab0-8586492a1f1d?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">Word</A> is more powerful than ever. You and your colleagues can create a PowerPoint presentation or edit a Word document on Mac in real-time, seeing each other’s changes as they happen. User flags indicate exactly which slide or sentence your colleagues are editing. For <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Collaborate-on-Excel-workbooks-at-the-same-time-with-co-authoring-7152aa8b-b791-414c-a3bb-3024e46fb104?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">Excel</A>, we’re excited to bring basic co-authoring to Excel for Mac users for the first time. In all the core Office apps, presence thumbnails show you who else is currently working in the file. We’ve extended these capabilities to Office Online, too, so you and your team can work together on files from virtually anywhere. Co-authoring is only available in files stored on OneDrive or SharePoint Online.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Derek blog 1.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27680i912603D797C62D3B/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Derek blog 1.png\" alt=\"Derek blog 1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>AutoSave*</STRONG>—All core Office apps are now equipped with <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/what-is-autosave-6d6bd723-ebfd-4e40-b5f6-ae6e8088f7a5\" target=\"_blank\">AutoSave</A> for files stored on OneDrive or SharePoint Online. AutoSave is exactly what it sounds like: Your file is automatically saved every few seconds. Plus, if other people are working in the same file, they can see your changes almost instantaneously. And if you need to roll back, simply check your file’s version history for a list of changes and access earlier copies. AutoSave can be switched on and off using a dedicated toggle button in the ribbon.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Get more data insights faster in Excel</H2>\n<P><STRONG>New chart types</STRONG>—Excel’s multitude of charts and graphs has made it one of the world’s premier data analysis tools. Excel 2016 for Mac now includes <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Chart-types-51043d4c-15bd-46f1-bc87-e81195e5b5e0?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">even more chart types</A>, including sunburst, treemap, histogram, waterfall, and more, to help you visualize your data in new, meaningful ways.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Derek blog 2 (med).png\" style=\"width: 365px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27681iA948BC599B26E70D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Derek blog 2 (med).png\" alt=\"Derek blog 2 (med).png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New worksheet functions*</STRONG>—We’ve introduced a pair of new worksheet functions, IFS and SWITCH, for Excel users on Mac to simplify data calculations. The <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/IFS-FUNCTION-36329a26-37b2-467c-972b-4a39bd951d45\" target=\"_blank\">IFS formula</A> takes the place of multiple nested IF statements, making formulas with multiple conditions easier to comprehend. The&nbsp;<A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/SWITCH-FUNCTION-47ab33c0-28ce-4530-8a45-d532ec4aa25e\" target=\"_blank\">SWITCH formula</A> <SPAN>evaluates one value </SPAN><SPAN>against a list of values, and returns the result corresponding to the first matching value.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Table slicers</STRONG>—Using <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/use-slicers-to-filter-data-249f966b-a9d5-4b0f-b31a-12651785d29d\" target=\"_blank\">slicers</A>, you can filter table and PivotTable data to quickly curate only the information you need. Slicers also indicate the current filtering state, making it easy to understand what exactly is shown in a filtered table.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Faster calculations</STRONG>—We first introduced multithreaded recalculations in Excel 2007, and have since refined it to help calculations in Excel 2016 for Mac run even faster. To speed up formula outputs, Excel tries identifying parts of the calculation that can be recalculated concurrently on different threads. Read the <A href=\"https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/bb687899.aspx\" target=\"_blank\">article on multithreaded recalculations</A> in the Microsoft Dev Center for examples and formula restrictions.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Keep your audience engaged with new PowerPoint features</H2>\n<P><STRONG>Trim media*</STRONG>—The best PowerPoint presentations are those that use powerful imagery, instead of words, to convey a message. But what if that imagery is video or audio that’s too long to sensibility include in your presentation? The <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Trim-a-video-music-clip-or-sound-clip-in-PowerPoint-1fc386f2-8404-43e8-9dbd-fee3a11a1d8f?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">Trim tool</A> in PowerPoint addresses this issue. With it you can cut unwanted content from the beginning and end of video and audio clips. This feature is only available for media you’ve inserted from your computer and not from the web.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Derek blog 3 (med).png\" style=\"width: 365px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27682i6651A4A693EFDD71/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Derek blog 3 (med).png\" alt=\"Derek blog 3 (med).png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>QuickStarter*</STRONG>—If you’re building a research-heavy presentation, using <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Research-a-topic-with-PowerPoint-QuickStarter-4784f273-0b2c-456c-9c89-24e5b977c224?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">QuickStarter</A> is the perfect way to begin. QuickStarter creates an outline for you based on your presentation’s subject. After conducting initial research, the tool builds out several slides—a title slide, a table of content slides, one slide for each sub-topic, and more—that you can choose to keep or delete. The result is a set of slides that gives you a strong foundation for developing a detailed and factually accurate presentation.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Highlighted changes*</STRONG>—Part of the newly introduced co-authoring feature, PowerPoint automatically <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Work-together-on-PowerPoint-presentations-0c30ee3f-8674-4f0e-97be-89cf2892a34d?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">highlights changes</A> others made to a shared presentation while you were away. This way, you can quickly see what was updated, when, and by who.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Laser pointer</STRONG>—<A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Turn-your-mouse-into-a-laser-pointer-77367b36-d25b-4ed2-8c87-358bc216a1e0\" target=\"_blank\">Turn your mouse into a laser pointer</A> to draw attention to specific parts of your PowerPoint while presenting. You can also change the color of the laser pointer to match the style of your presentation or company.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Do more on mobile in Word</H2>\n<P><STRONG>Learning Tools*</STRONG>—<A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Learning-Tools-in-Word-a857949f-c91e-4c97-977c-a4efcaf9b3c1?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">Learning Tools</A> in Word for iPad and Word Online was designed to help you improve your reading skills and word pronunciation. Perfect for students or non-native speakers, Learning Tools comes with a variety of features: Read Aloud lets you hear your document; Syllables breaks down words into syllables; Text Spacing increases the space between characters; Column Width reduces visual crowding so you can just focus on the words; and, Page Color gives you the option to change the background to a softer color.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Derek blog 4 (med).png\" style=\"width: 365px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/27683iA0BA69A65D26AF56/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Derek blog 4 (med).png\" alt=\"Derek blog 4 (med).png\" /></span></P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Your feedback is important to us—it’s the primarily reason these capabilities were chosen for this release. Please visit our UserVoice sites for <A href=\"https://excel.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Excel</A>, <A href=\"https://powerpoint.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\">PowerPoint</A>, and <A href=\"https://word.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Word</A> to submit your ideas for future features. We invite you to follow Microsoft Office on <A href=\"https://twitter.com/office?lang=en\" target=\"_blank\">Twitter</A> and <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/Office/\" target=\"_blank\">Facebook</A> for the latest news and helpful tips for getting the most out of your Office apps. You can also follow the social feeds for Excel (<A href=\"https://twitter.com/msexcel?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor\" target=\"_blank\">Twitter</A> and <A href=\"https://www.facebook.com/microsoftexcel/\" target=\"_blank\">Facebook</A>) and PowerPoint (<A href=\"https://twitter.com/powerpoint?lang=en\" target=\"_blank\">Twitter</A>) for more specific updates.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>* Feature requires an Office 365 on Mac subscription.</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 05 Mar 2018 17:13:03 data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Work naturally and seamlessly while inking</H1>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">OneNote for Android</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;now supports palm rejection for more natural and accurate&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">inking.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI>Use&nbsp;<SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">the&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">l</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">asso</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;tool to&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">freely&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">select</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;your inking</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;and&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">effortlessly&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">move it</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;around or resize&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">it</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">.</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\" data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/O365/2019_05_14_23_16_54.gif\" border=\"0\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Instead of having to select the eraser tool whenever you want to erase, if you’re using an S-Pen, simply press the button on your S-Pen while inking to switch to eraser mode and erase easier.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><VIDEO controls=\"controls\" width=\"95%\" height=\"75% preload=\">\n  <SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/o365/spen_support (1).mp4\" type=\"video/mp4\"></SOURCE></VIDEO></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Capture diverse content in your OneNote</H1>\n<UL>\n<LI>Insert file attachments and PDFs from your Android device. Click the attachment button on your Android command center above the keyboard and select the file you want to add to the page. For PDFs, you also have an option to add as a full-page printout right on the page.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OneNote - Insert file.jpg\" style=\"width: 485px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/115483i8CDD59F5F65A71B7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OneNote - Insert file.jpg\" alt=\"OneNote - Insert file.jpg\" /></span></LI>\n<LI>The camera in OneNote can be a powerful tool in adding content to your notebooks. Try it today with even more capabilities, like inking on images, accessing the photo gallery from camera view, capturing with the front camera of your device, and easily selecting document boundaries and adjusting crop lines to the document’s edges.<BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI>Sometimes, you need to quickly capture a fleeting thought without organizing it. Sticky Notes is a perfect place for those quick notes and now you can access them anywhere through OneNote on mobile devices. Click on the Sticky Notes tab at the bottom right of the screen to access Sticky Notes synced across devices.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233279&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OneNote - Sticky Notes.png\" style=\"width: 562px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/115484i7279CA875EFEE9CE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OneNote - Sticky Notes.png\" alt=\"OneNote - Sticky Notes.png\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Other updates to your OneNote for Android experience</H1>\n<UL>\n<LI>We’ve made some improvements to searching in OneNote for Android. Search results are now highlighted on the page, so you can easily find what you are looking for. On smartphones, use Find on Page to quickly locate search terms on the current page.<BR /><BR /></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Screenshot_20190317-234243.jpg\" style=\"width: 500px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/115606i61CCF7E5F826473F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Screenshot_20190317-234243.jpg\" alt=\"Screenshot_20190317-234243.jpg\" /></span> <BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Screenshot_20190317-234331.jpg\" style=\"width: 500px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/115607iE467715A0277B02B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Screenshot_20190317-234331.jpg\" alt=\"Screenshot_20190317-234331.jpg\" /></span> <BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Screenshot_20190317-234247.jpg\" style=\"width: 500px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/115608i915DECE0F78E3024/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Screenshot_20190317-234247.jpg\" alt=\"Screenshot_20190317-234247.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Right-to-left layouts are now supported for applicable. If your mobile device’s primary settings are set to a right-to-left language, your OneNote will now support a corresponding right-to-left layout.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>The OneNote team is working to bring more and more exciting features to all the platforms so make sure to upvote or add any features you’d like to see in the product on Feedback Hub. As always, we look forward to your comments down below!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 22 May 2019 16:00:00 Other volume licensing customers, except those who have purchased Open licenses, can download OOS with view-only functionality. </SPAN><SPAN>For more information on licensing requirements, please refer to our </SPAN><SPAN>product terms</SPAN><SPAN>.</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\">&nbsp;</SPAN></FONT></P>\n<P><FONT center or </SPAN><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Contact-support-for-business-products-Admin-Help-32a17ca7-6fa0-4870-8a8d-e25ba4ccfd4b?CorrelationId=25670613-9263-4c87-8254-7c4563a1e0ac&amp;ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US&amp;ocmsassetID=HA103836042\"
