+0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"783fd1185ae2fe2e32270d00dab8feb9","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Lorena Huang Liu","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639102},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"New feature: Make changes to Office deployments without changing the version","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/new-feature-make-changes-to-office-deployments-without-changing/ba-p/816482","description":"<P>With the most recent release of the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=49117\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN>Office Deployment Tool</SPAN></A> (ODT) we have implemented a new feature based on customer's feedback. Starting with version 16.0.11615.33602 it is possible to make changes to an existing installation of Office 365 ProPlus while keeping the installed version as is, even when a newer one is available on the Office CDN or in your network share/local folder.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2><FONT size=\"4\"><SPAN>Scenario</SPAN></FONT></H2>\n<P>Let's assume that you want to add e.g. a Language Pack to an installation of Office 365 ProPlus on a certain device in an automated fashion. We also assume, that the device is not on the most recent build of their update channel, e.g. the device is still on SAC 1803. Maybe there is still some testing to be done before SAC 1808 can be deployed across the organization.</P>\n<P>The updated \"version\" handling allows you to add e.g. Language Packs, Proofing Tools, additional products (like Visio or Project) or apps without updating the installed build, even when a newer build is available in the source location (Office CDN or the specified source path).</P>\n<P>In the past the ODT automatically updated the installation to the latest build while installing the specified product, Language Pack or Proofing Tool.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Post1.png\" style=\"width: 694px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/110153i6E4D2520EF3E15C5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Post1.png\" alt=\"Post1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2><FONT size=\"4\"><SPAN>How to use</SPAN></FONT></H2>\n<P>The usage of the new feature is straight forward. Instead of specifying a build number (like 16.0.9126.2356), you just specify \"MatchInstalled\". This instructs the ODT to keep whatever build version is already installed.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2><FONT size=\"4\"><SPAN>Benefit</SPAN></FONT></H2>\n<P>In the past we saw different workaround in order to pin the version. These ranged from manually updating the configuation.xml with the correct build number every time to custom scripts which injected the build number into the configuration.xml on the fly. The new feature allows you to retire such workarounds and use a consistent method across update channels and versions.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2><FONT size=\"4\"><SPAN>Sample XMLs</SPAN></FONT></H2>\n<P>The following XML is an implementation example of the \"<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/fieldnotes/build-dynamic-lean-universal-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">dynamic, lean and universal packaging</A>\" concept, which greatly reduces effort and maintenance costs of install packages. The configuration file will install Project, <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-ProPlus/Dynamically-match-already-existing-languages-when-installing/m-p/716927\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">match the languages to already installed Office products</A> and keep everything else (<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-ProPlus/Insights-into-OfficeClientEdition-and-how-to-make-it-work-for/m-p/767577/thread-id/714\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">architecture (x86/x64)</A>, <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-ProPlus/Understanding-the-Channel-attribute-of-the-Office-Deployment/m-p/813604\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">update channel</A> and version) as is:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<PRE>&lt;Configuration&gt;\n\t&lt;Add <FONT color=\"#ff0000\"><STRONG>Version=\"MatchInstalled\"</STRONG></FONT>&gt;\n\t\t&lt;Product ID=\"<A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/product-ids-that-are-supported-by-the-office-deployment-tool-for-click-to-run-77654e77-aaeb-4ed6-84eb-1d8b0e086590\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ProjectProRetail</A>\"&gt;<BR />\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-ProPlus/Dynamically-match-already-existing-languages-when-installing/m-p/716927\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MatchInstalled</A>\" TargetProduct=\"All\" /&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/Product&gt;\n\t&lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</PRE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The following XML will add the German Language Pack and <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-ProPlus/Insights-into-OfficeClientEdition-and-how-to-make-it-work-for/m-p/767577/thread-id/714\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">keep the architecture (x86/x64)</A>, <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-ProPlus/Understanding-the-Channel-attribute-of-the-Office-Deployment/m-p/813604\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">update channel</A> and version as is:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<PRE>&lt;Configuration&gt;\n\t&lt;Add <STRONG><FONT color=\"#ff0000\">Version=\"MatchInstalled\"</FONT></STRONG>&gt;\n\t\t&lt;Product ID=\"LanguagePack\"&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;Language ID=\"de-de\"/&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/Product&gt;\n\t&lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;</PRE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2><FONT size=\"4\"><SPAN>Prerequisites</SPAN></FONT></H2>\n<P>In order to use the new feature, the following prerequisites apply:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Use Office Deployment Tool 16.0.11615.33602 or newer</LI>\n<LI>The feature is intended to be used when an existing installation is modified or something added to it. If no installation is present, \"MatchInstalled\" for \"Version\" will be ignored and the ODT will go through normal detection to install proper version. No hard error in such case.</LI>\n<LI>If you are not using the Office CDN as an installation source, make sure to have the matching source files in your specified source path. We recommend to leverage the Office CDN.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2><FONT size=\"4\">The Authors</FONT></H2>\n<P>This blog post is brought to you by&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"6347\"></LI-USER>&nbsp; and <LI-USER uid=\"51895\"></LI-USER>, two ProPlus Rangers at Microsoft. We’re looking forward to your questions and feedback in the comments below.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 28 Apr 2020 07:59:19 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/110153i6E4D2520EF3E15C5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"735875b14f24cb6a5251134ea8ee9cee","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn3@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-50-39-742_e45ba4474c6d77e9.webp","destWidth":694,"destHeight":286,"sourceBytes":34784,"destBytes":19776,"author":"Martin Nothnagel","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/110153i6E4D2520EF3E15C5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn3@2020_1/2020/08/25/00-50-39-742_e45ba4474c6d77e9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639090},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Microsoft Whiteboard: now more colorful and customizable than ever","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/microsoft-whiteboard-now-more-colorful-and-customizable-than/ba-p/296947","description":"<P>The Whiteboard team has been hard at work since our announcements at Ignite. A few weeks ago, we announced the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Education-Blog/Introducing-Microsoft-Whiteboard-for-Education/ba-p/289137\" target=\"_self\">preview of Microsoft Whiteboard for Education</A>. And as we gather more and more feedback from our growing customer base, we’ve also been rolling out great new features, with more on the way soon. Let’s take a look at what’s changed.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New pen colors and thicknesses</STRONG></P>\n<P>Responding to popular demand, we’ve added 10 new pen colors and three more pen thicknesses, allowing Whiteboard users to express themselves more colorfully and boldly than ever. To access the new colors and thicknesses, click on the pen you have selected to pop up the palette.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Thick-Color-Pen-on-device.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/62026iCA49B36F4B5407DB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Thick-Color-Pen-on-device.png\" alt=\"Thick-Color-Pen-on-device.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Background colors and gridlines</STRONG></P>\n<P>Just like it’s great to have options for pen color, customizing the look and feel of the board itself can help your ideas stand out – and can make your boards more usable and readable as well. Whiteboard now offers nine options for board color and eight types of gridlines that can be used together or separately to customize your boards’ backgrounds. These options are selectable in the Settings menu for any board.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Page-Background-on-device-noBG.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/62028i9425ECD614DB5BCC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Page-Background-on-device-noBG.png\" alt=\"Page-Background-on-device-noBG.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Type text directly using the keyboard</STRONG></P>\n<P>We know not every device takes pen inputs – and even if it does, not everyone has the neatest handwriting! And though sticky notes are great for typing comments, sometimes you just want something a little more direct. For those who would rather type straight on the board, we now have you covered: just select the text entry option from the contextual menu (right-click/long tap to view), and type to your heart’s content.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Text-Type-on-device-NoBG.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/62054iF71EED85273F2C4D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Text-Type-on-device-NoBG.png\" alt=\"Text-Type-on-device-NoBG.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>All of these features are now available in the <SPAN><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/microsoft-whiteboard/9mspc6mp8fm4?activetab=pivot%3Aoverviewtab\" target=\"_blank\">Windows 10</A></SPAN> and <SPAN><A href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-whiteboard/id1352499399?mt=8\" target=\"_blank\">iOS</A></SPAN> apps, and we’ve got many more exciting updates in the pipeline. Watch this space!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 07 Dec 2018 17:10:45 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/62026iCA49B36F4B5407DB/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"72973de64d98cdd833c50743e0fa1401","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn24@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-50-42-538_4c4fb061eac95c43.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":203360,"destBytes":43166,"author":"Itai Almog","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/62026iCA49B36F4B5407DB/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn24@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-50-42-538_4c4fb061eac95c43.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/62028i9425ECD614DB5BCC/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn43@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-45-941_aee6685b2d4d5d33.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/62054iF71EED85273F2C4D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn64@2020_6/2020/08/25/00-52-43-607_4acc0b240fc1161b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639101},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"How to manage Office 365 ProPlus Channels for IT Pros","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-manage-office-365-proplus-channels-for-it-pros/ba-p/795813","description":"<P><STRONG><FONT color=\"#000000\">We’ve updated official guidance and published it as an article on docs.microsoft.com: <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdeployoffice%2Fchange-update-channels&amp;data=02%7C01%7Cdavguent%40microsoft.com%7C3c570391767e4cd2c86308d779b92222%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637111708467024224&amp;sdata=6wyMGvbxXUqfwClBuPf5hHvcRra3iw8qVoYkZr%2BmCvw%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Change the Microsoft 365 Apps update channel for devices in your organization</A>. We recommend that you follow the steps in that article to change channels.”</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The goal of the blog is to provide clarification around the mechanics on how Microsoft 365 Apps processes channel change requests.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To read more about Channels please see&nbsp;<A title=\"Overview of update channels for Microsoft 365 Apps\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-of-update-channels-for-office-365-proplus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Overview of update channels for Microsoft 365 Apps</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Ideally, minimizing the number of Microsoft 365 Apps packages reduces overall cost of ownership. Therefore, the next step is to develop a process where machines receive standard package placing them on Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel but dynamically move validation machines to faster channel such as Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview).</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\"><FONT size=\"6\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff; box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 32px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">Change the update channel with ODT</FONT></P>\n<P style=\"text-align: left;\"><STRONG>Step 1: Before you begin, make sure the scheduled task \"Office Automatic Update 2.0\" is enabled</STRONG> on the client devices. This task, which updates the assigned channel, is a required part of managing updates for Microsoft 365 Apps, whether you use Group Policy, the Office Deployment Tool, or Configuration Manager (ConfigMgr).</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: left;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: left;\"><STRONG>Step 2: Download the latest version of the ODT (setup.exe)</STRONG> from the <A style=\"background-color: transparent; box-sizing: inherit; color: var(--primary-base); cursor: pointer; outline-color: invert; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; text-decoration: underline;\" href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=626065\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-linktype=\"external\">Microsoft Download Center</A>.</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: left;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: left;\"><STRONG>Step 3: Create a configuration file that specifies the new channel name.</STRONG> In the example below, the&nbsp; &nbsp;channel changes to Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview). For more information on channel names, see <A style=\"background-color: transparent; box-sizing: inherit; color: var(--primary-base); cursor: pointer; outline-color: invert; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; text-decoration: underline;\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/configuration-options-for-the-office-2016-deployment-tool#channel-attribute-part-of-updates-element\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-linktype=\"relative-path\">Channel attribute in the Configuration Options article</A>.</P>\n<PRE style=\"background-color: #f5f5f5; border-bottom-left-radius: 4px; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-image-outset: 0; border-image-repeat: stretch; border-image-slice: 100%; border-image-source: none; border-image-width: 1; border-top-left-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; box-sizing: border-box; color: #3e3e3e; display: block; font-family: Menlo,Monaco,Consolas,&amp;quot; courier new&amp;quot;,monospace; font-size: 13px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.7142; orphans: 2; overflow: auto; overflow-wrap: break-word; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: pre; word-break: break-all; word-spacing: 0px; padding: 11.5px; margin: 0px 0px 12px 0px; border: 1px solid #cccccc;\">&lt;Configuration&gt;<BR />\t&lt;Updates Channel=\"Targeted\" /&gt;<BR />&lt;/Configuration&gt;</PRE>\n<P style=\"text-align: left;\"><STRONG>Step 4: Deploy the configuration file using your standard processes.</STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"box-sizing: inherit; color: #171717; font-family: Segoe UI,SegoeUI,Segoe WP,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; overflow-wrap: break-word; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; padding: 0px; margin: 1rem 0px 0px 0px;\">After execution of Office Deployment Tool (ODT), the Office Automatic Update 2.0 task will automatically run based on trigger definition in scheduled task. After that task runs, it detects the updated policy and updates the assigned channel. After the task runs again, it detects the new assigned channel and Office updates to a new build from that channel.</P>\n<P style=\"box-sizing: inherit; color: #171717; font-family: Segoe UI,SegoeUI,Segoe WP,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; overflow-wrap: break-word; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; padding: 0px; margin: 1rem 0px 0px 0px;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 83px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124652i281F88DAA04E8460/image-dimensions/83x62?v=1.0\" width=\"83\" height=\"62\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"The Office user interface such as the &quot;backstage&quot;, will not show the updated channel name until a build of Office from the new channel is installed.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Office user interface such as the \"backstage\", will not show the updated channel name until a build of Office from the new channel is installed.</span></span></P>\n<P style=\"box-sizing: inherit; color: #171717; font-family: Segoe UI,SegoeUI,Segoe WP,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; overflow-wrap: break-word; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; padding: 0px; margin: 1rem 0px 0px 0px;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\"><FONT size=\"6\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Change the update channel with Group Policy</FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Step 1: Deploy your standard Microsoft 365 Apps package based on Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Step 2: Assign GPO to validation machine(s) or add policy registry key specifying Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview)</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Using <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=49030\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office ADMX files</A>, use Update Channel GPO to set Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview)</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SACT.jpg\" style=\"width: 526px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191300iE452D1CA97B1A230/image-dimensions/526x486?v=1.0\" width=\"526\" height=\"486\" title=\"SACT.jpg\" alt=\"SACT.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>* Group Policy refreshes in the background every 90 minutes by default.&nbsp; Use gpupdate /force to expedite.&nbsp; Alternatively, add registry key manually to policy key</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Policies\\Microsoft\\office\\16.0\\common\\officeupdate \"updatebranch\"=\"FirstReleaseDeferred\"</FONT><BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><STRONG>Step 3: Allow Microsoft\\Office\\Office Automatic Updates 2.0 scheduled task to run</STRONG></P>\n<P>Group Policy will set registry keys, that’s all. <SPAN>Microsoft 365 Apps</SPAN> uniquely leverages a scheduled task named <FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Office Automatic Updates</FONT> to maintain product configuration including channel management. The name itself “Automatic Updates” can cause confusion for IT Pros in enterprise environments where System Center Configuration (ConfigMgr) is used to deploy updates. When&nbsp;you enable management of the Office 365 Client Agent setting in client settings (COM), rebranded in ConfigMgr client setting to \"Management of Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise\", or via domain policy, software updates for Office 365 Client will be delivered <STRONG><U>only</U></STRONG> from ConfigMgr. The Office Automatic Updates scheduled task will fire based on default set of triggers, regardless if COM is enabled or not, or by manually running task you can compress time frame to validate change.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Warning.png\" style=\"width: 59px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124651iF5E3AEE55DD43907/image-dimensions/59x46?v=1.0\" width=\"59\" height=\"46\" title=\"Warning.png\" alt=\"Microsoft recommends Automatic Updates remain Enabled (default configuration) in all update scenarios. This task does more than name implies. By disabling task, you may observe diminished experience in terms of channel management and disable feature to apply updates when SYSTEM is IDLE.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft recommends Automatic Updates remain Enabled (default configuration) in all update scenarios. This task does more than name implies. By disabling task, you may observe diminished experience in terms of channel management and disable feature to apply updates when SYSTEM is IDLE.</span></span></P>\n<P>See 2:00 in <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9lFyyj-V2AA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Managing Office with SCCM (2019) video</A> for more information, applicable for CDN update workflow.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 66px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124655iA13DC531ECEE9CCE/image-dimensions/66x49?v=1.0\" width=\"66\" height=\"49\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"Tip: List of Channels and respective URL identifiers\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Tip: List of Channels and respective URL identifiers</span></span></P>\n<P>CDNBaseUrl represents the channel where product was installed. If no channel was defined in unattend, Monthly is default selection.</P>\n<PRE><FONT size=\"1\">Monthly Enterprise Channel<BR /><STRONG>CDNBaseUrl</STRONG>&nbsp;= <A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/55336b82-a18d-4dd6-b5f6-9e5095c314a6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/55336b82-a18d-4dd6-b5f6-9e5095c314a6</A> <BR /><BR />Current Channel&nbsp;</FONT><BR /><FONT size=\"1\"><STRONG>CDNBaseUrl</STRONG>&nbsp;= <A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/492350f6-3a01-4f97-b9c0-c7c6ddf67d60\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/492350f6-3a01-4f97-b9c0-c7c6ddf67d60</A></FONT><BR /><BR /><FONT size=\"1\">Current Channel (Preview)</FONT><BR /><FONT size=\"1\"><STRONG>CDNBaseUrl</STRONG>&nbsp;= <A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/64256afe-f5d9-4f86-8936-8840a6a4f5be\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/64256afe-f5d9-4f86-8936-8840a6a4f5be</A><BR /></FONT><BR /><FONT size=\"1\">Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel </FONT><BR /><FONT size=\"1\"><STRONG>CDNBaseUrl</STRONG>&nbsp;= <A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/7ffbc6bf-bc32-4f92-8982-f9dd17fd3114\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/7ffbc6bf-bc32-4f92-8982-f9dd17fd3114</A></FONT><BR /><BR /><FONT size=\"1\">Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview)</FONT><BR /><FONT size=\"1\"><STRONG>CDNBaseUrl</STRONG>&nbsp;= <A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/b8f9b850-328d-4355-9145-c59439a0c4cf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/b8f9b850-328d-4355-9145-c59439a0c4cf</A><BR /><BR />Beta Channel<BR /><STRONG>CDNBaseUrl</STRONG>&nbsp;= <A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/5440fd1f-7ecb-4221-8110-145efaa6372f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/5440fd1f-7ecb-4221-8110-145efaa6372f</A><BR /></FONT></PRE>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 67px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124656i5B91CE66C3E1F007/image-dimensions/67x50?v=1.0\" width=\"67\" height=\"50\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"Tip: IT Pros can monitor several registry keys to validate change has occurred after scheduled task has completed. Registry keys of interest when monitoring can be found under the following key: HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration.  Editing key(s) should not be done directly and can lead to unintended consequences. Rather, monitor keys for desired outcome.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Tip: IT Pros can monitor several registry keys to validate change has occurred after scheduled task has completed. Registry keys of interest when monitoring can be found under the following key: HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration.  Editing key(s) should not be done directly and can lead to unintended consequences. Rather, monitor keys for desired outcome.</span></span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>UpdateChannel</STRONG>: This is the channel configuration <STRONG>“winner”. &nbsp;</STRONG>This is dynamically managed by the Automatic Updates scheduled task and should not be edited directly.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In our example where we are using GPO to move Office 365 ProPlus to Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview), Office Automatic Updates scheduled task will discover policy key and then will flip UpdateChannel to new value, in this case from <A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/7ffbc6bf-bc32-4f92-8982-f9dd17fd3114\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/7ffbc6bf-bc32-4f92-8982-f9dd17fd3114</A> (SAC) to <A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/b8f9b850-328d-4355-9145-c59439a0c4cf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/b8f9b850-328d-4355-9145-c59439a0c4cf</A> (SAC-T). Additionally, UpdateChannelChanged will be set to True. Upon next successful Office 365 Client update, UpdateChannelChanged will reset to False. The product can only accept one channel change request at a time with successful update as a prerequisite prior to accepting another change.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you have completed steps above and channel change is still not being reflected, you may be blocked by timers referred to as “Discovery Period” or \"DoFrequentUpdates\". IT Pros may encounter this scenario during compressed time validation in lab scenarios.&nbsp; During this period channel changes and Office downloads will not occur. (default timer period is 24 hours).&nbsp; The Office logs in C:\\windows\\temp\\%Computername%* will provide \"Less than a day since last update run, just trying to apply!\".&nbsp; This is an example where timer is in scope.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>After UpdateChannel has successfully changed, Office 365 Clients pointing to CDN will download latest build from faster channel. Office 365 Clients which have COM enabled for ConfigMgr integration will download newer build next time Software Updates Deployment Evaluation cycle runs based on configuration of Software Deployment within ConfigMgr. IT Pros can expedite testing channel migration by deploying desired build to validation collection (should be a build from Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview), use the Configuration Manager applet from control panel to perform Machine Policy Retrieval followed by Software Updates Deployment Evaluation Cycle.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Applet.png\" style=\"width: 334px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124659i2DF13E885FBB17E3/image-dimensions/334x412?v=1.0\" width=\"334\" height=\"412\" title=\"Applet.png\" alt=\"Applet.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"note.png\" style=\"width: 66px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124661iD16D82FCBEC49C30/image-dimensions/66x49?v=1.0\" width=\"66\" height=\"49\" title=\"note.png\" alt=\"Tip: Office 365 ProPlus behavior – slow to fast vs fast to slow\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Tip: Office 365 ProPlus behavior – slow to fast vs fast to slow</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Slower -&gt; Faster (Example: Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel to Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview)</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Client will always gracefully move forward when now available build number is higher.&nbsp; For example, a client on June 2019 Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel with build v<FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">ersion 1808 (Build 10730.20348) will move to Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview) with build&nbsp;Version 1902 (Build 11328.20318).&nbsp; No other Administrative intervention is required, normal update process\\workflow applies the change.</FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>Faster -&gt; Slower&nbsp;(Example: SAC-T to SAC)</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>In ConfigMgr managed environment where management of the Office 365 Client Agent setting (COM) is enabled, Office will <STRONG>not</STRONG> auto downgrade when channel is changed.&nbsp; It will only move forward once build advertised is greater than what’s currently installed.&nbsp; For example, Office client on Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (Preview) b<FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff; box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">uild June 2019 Version 1902 (Build 11328.20318)</FONT> will have to wait until Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel build number is greater to move forward such as July 2019 <FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Version 1902 (Build 11328.20368).&nbsp; Supported downgrade method is to re-run Office Deployment Tool (ODT) with desired build and channel.&nbsp; Keep in mind during waiting period, Office 365 Client will not receive any updates including security.</FONT></LI>\n<LI>In non COM managed environment such as <U>default configuration</U> CDN, we <U>will</U> downgrade your new version to match the Group Policy assigned. &nbsp;</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>*Since we can’t do binary delta compression (BDC) the download will be larger.&nbsp; As a result, network considerations should be considered when downgrading from CDN.&nbsp; For example, Delivery Optimization should be enabled in Windows to allow clients to share content peer to peer.&nbsp; This also can be combined with features in ConfigMgr such as Connected Cache for further optimization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>FAQ:</P>\n<P><STRONG>How does channel management work when Office 2019 is installed and GPO \"Upgrade Office 2019 to Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise\" is enabled?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Some customers may have a need to have one factory image of Windows which includes Office 2019 and later upgrade a subset of machines to Office 365 ProPlus.&nbsp; The steps outlined above still apply in terms of mechanics and how channel chnages are processed.&nbsp; The only difference is Office 2019 will initially have CDNBaseURL and UpdateChannel will reflect&nbsp;<A href=\"http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/f2e724c1-748f-4b47-8fb8-8e0d210e9208.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">http://officecdn.microsoft.com/pr/f2e724c1-748f-4b47-8fb8-8e0d210e9208.&nbsp;</A> First, the GPO above will set policy key.&nbsp; Second, The Office Automatic Updates 2.0 scheduled task will flip the UpdateChannel to Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel (3114) by default and dynamically convert the product to Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel.&nbsp; In short, Office 2019 is just an older version of Microsoft 365 Apps, so differences in content between the two products will download from CDN or from ConfigMgr Distribution Point depending on your configuration. (Size will be significant for one-time conversion).&nbsp; For CDN, this process is automatic.&nbsp; For ConfigMgr, IT Pro only needs to deploy latest Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel build software update to collection, just like any monthly \"Patch Tuesday\" process.&nbsp; ConfigMgr will find build applicable and upgrade like any other Office update.&nbsp; Licensing\\Activation will switch from volume activation (KMS) to subscription based (Office Licensing Service).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Why does this guidance differ from ConfigMgr page&nbsp;<A title=\"Change the update channel after you enable Office 365 clients to receive updates from Configuration Manager\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sccm/sum/deploy-use/manage-office-365-proplus-updates#change-the-update-channel-after-you-enable-office-365-clients-to-receive-updates-from-configuration-manager\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Change the update channel after you enable Office 365 clients to receive updates from Configuration Manager</A>?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Microsoft recommends customers leverage Group Policy to change Microsoft 365 Apps channels because its easier for IT Pros. Group Policy sets registry key under policy hive and Office Automatic Updates scheduled task to processes channel change.&nbsp; The link above references CDNBaseURL.&nbsp; Notice from the list below this is the 5th item evaluated for priority by the scheduled task.&nbsp; As a result, if the first three priorities listed are not configured and CDNBaseURL doesn't match UpdateChannel, scheduled task will align them resulting in channel change.&nbsp; This blog posting leads with Group Policy where link above requires a direct registry change through Group Policy Preferences or Compliance Item in SCCM.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<PRE><STRONG>1st Priority</STRONG><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>: GPO \"UpdatePath\" - HKLM\\software\\policies\\microsoft\\office\\16.0\\common\\officeupdate!updatepath<BR /><STRONG>2nd Priority</STRONG><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>: GPO \"UpdateChannel\" - HKLM\\software\\policies\\microsoft\\office\\16.0\\common\\officeupdate!updatebranch<BR /><STRONG>3rd Priority</STRONG><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>: \"UpdateURL\" or UpdatePath=\"\\\\Server\\Share\" HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration<BR /><STRONG>*4th Priority:&nbsp;</STRONG>UnmanagedUpdateURL - HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration\\UnmanagedUpdateURL<STRONG><BR />5th Priority</STRONG><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>: <FONT color=\"#000000\">CDNBaseURL - </FONT>HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration\\CDNBaseUrl<BR /><BR /><STRONG>*</STRONG>This value is new May 2020, <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/DeployOffice/other/known-issue-update-channel-move\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">official documentation</A></PRE>\n<P><STRONG>I installed Office initially on one channel and later used GPO to assign a new one, is it normal for the CDNBaseURL and UpdateChannel not to match?</STRONG></P>\n<P>It depends.&nbsp; If a GPO is used to change channel, values will not match.&nbsp; CDNBaseURL will reflect value when Office Deployment Tool (ODT) was run where Update Channel \"winner\" will reflect the GPO.&nbsp; If ODT was used to change change channel, ODT will directly change CDNBaseURL to value defined in Config.XML and if priority order above aligns, UpdateChannel value will match.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>I tried to assign Monthly Enterprise Channel (MEC) to a collection of machines running old builds of Office and operation failed? Why?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Since Monthly Enterprise Channel is a new channel, this information was backported to all channels so older clients would be informed of change.&nbsp; In general, Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel needs to be at least March 2020 to in order to move to MEC using group policy.&nbsp; Alternatively, use the Office Deployment Tool to change channel.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This blog post is brought to you by Dave Guenthner, a Senior Premier Field Engineer and “ProPlus Ranger” at Microsoft. Feel free to share your questions and feedback in the comments below.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 13 Aug 2020 12:14:58 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Use custom domains in Office 365 to build your brand and empower your work force","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/use-custom-domains-in-office-365-to-build-your-brand-and-empower/ba-p/185326","description":"<P>Organizations of all sizes win customers and create trust with a consistent and recognizable brand. Web and email addresses that match your organization’s name build brand equity and establish credibility. If your business is called Fourth Coffee, a web address of fourthcoffee.com makes you easy to find online, and email addresses that end in @fourthcoffee.com reassure your customers that they are dealing directly with you.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft makes it easy to integrate your custom domain with comprehensive collaboration tools like email from Office 365. Let’s look at your options.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Purchase a custom domain with your Office 365 subscription</H1>\n<P>For organizations creating their online presence for the first time, Microsoft makes it easy to purchase a custom domain and integrate it with Office 365. This new domain will instantly be linked with your Office 365 account, meaning that all your email addresses will include your new custom domain where you can also host your website. You can purchase this new custom domain from Microsoft at the same time as your subscription to Office 365 or later.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We’ve posted step by step instructions on <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Buy-a-domain-name-in-Office-365-1561140a-16a9-4a02-822d-a989250e479d\" target=\"_blank\">how to purchase a custom domain directly from Microsoft</A> in our support documentation.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Add Domain.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/32680iEF193F6C712B158C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Add Domain.PNG\" alt=\"Add Domain.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<H1>&nbsp;</H1>\n<H1>Automatically join your own GoDaddy or 1&amp;1 domain with Office 365 (UPDATED)</H1>\n<P>Many organizations will purchase a domain as soon as they have a name. As they grow and implement more advanced IT solutions, it can be challenging to integrate that custom domain. Microsoft makes it easy to join some domains to Office 365 services through an open standard called <A href=\"https://www.domainconnect.org/\" target=\"_blank\">Domain Connect</A>. Domain Connect automates many of the manual processes typically required for configuring web hosting and email service. Microsoft has enabled this standard in Office 365 to make it easy to integrate your Domain Connect enabled domains with your Office 365 subscription.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We’re excited to announce today that <A href=\"https://www.1and1.com/\" target=\"_blank\">1&amp;1</A>, a leading domain provider, has integrated the Domain Connect standard. This new partnership makes it easy to integrate your custom domain from 1&amp;1 with your Office 365 subscription. <A href=\"https://www.1and1.com/\" target=\"_blank\">1&amp;1</A> and <A href=\"https://www.godaddy.com/\" target=\"_blank\">GoDaddy</A> are the first domain providers to offer compliance with the Domain Connect standard, with more on the way.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you’re currently using another provider for your organization’s email service, it’s easy to migrate those email addresses and messages to your Office 365 subscription.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Check out the support documentation for more on how you can <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/add-a-domain-to-office-365-6383f56d-3d09-4dcb-9b41-b5f5a5efd611?wt.mc_id=o365_portal_mmaven&amp;ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN>automatically join your existing </SPAN>domain</A><SPAN> to your Office 365 subscription</SPAN> and migrate your messages.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1>Manually join your domain with Office 365</H1>\n<P>You can still join your custom domain with your Office 365 services if you did not purchase it from Microsoft or a Domain Connect compliant provider. There are a few more steps to take, but it’s straight forward. The outcomes and benefits are the same.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The support documentation contains a step by step procedure for <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/create-dns-records-at-any-dns-hosting-provider-for-office-365-7b7b075d-79f9-4e37-8a9e-fb60c1d95166?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\">manually joining your domain</A> to your Office 365 services.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Add Domain Verify.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/32681i07796380B158328D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" more and more Office 365 customers adopt Microsoft Teams, we’ve heard from many of you that you want to deploy and manage Teams the same way you deploy and manage other Office 365 apps. To streamline that process, we made Teams available through Office 365 ProPlus alongside Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and OneDrive. We first provided this option to customers on the monthly channel</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-365-Blog/Teams-is-coming-to-Office-365-Business-amp-Office-365-ProPlus/ba-p/725481\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">several months</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">ago. With that date approaching, we want to remind you how to configure Office 365 ProPlus and Teams updates to meet the needs of your organization.&nbsp;&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN to</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">adopt Teams&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/adopt-microsoft-teams-landing-page\" installed.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;<BR /><BR /></SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG><I><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">C</SPAN></I></STRONG><STRONG><I><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">ustomize&nbsp;</SPAN></I></STRONG><STRONG><I><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Teams deployment&nbsp;</SPAN></I></STRONG><STRONG><I><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">as a part of&nbsp;</SPAN></I></STRONG><STRONG><I><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Office 365 ProPlus</SPAN></I></STRONG><SPAN to grow, we recognize that not all customers are ready for Teams to be automatically deployed on their users’ machines.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">You can manage your preferences and Policy</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;or the Office Deployment Tool.</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Learn more about</SPAN><SPAN ProPlus</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\">&nbsp;<BR /><BR /></SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG><I><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Send us your feedback</SPAN></I></STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.</SPAN></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 10 Jan 2020 14:00:00 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"b38bfaf345f12a59a2a64e1ed6cfec27","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Office_365_Team","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639096},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Excluding and re-including applications within the Office 365 ProPlus Suite","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/excluding-and-re-including-applications-within-the-office-365/ba-p/1250367","description":"<P>When installing Office 365 ProPlus using the Office Deployment Tool (ODT), the standard configuration includes the entire suite of applications by default. In some cases, IT Pros need to exclude one or more of the apps or add back previously excluded ones. The article will go over the various scenarios and provide guidance on how to implement them. These scenarios include:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Exclude apps during initial install</LI>\n<LI>Remove specific apps after initial install</LI>\n<LI>Re-including apps that were previously removed</LI>\n<LI>Adding Visio and/or Project after initial ProPlus installation</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>So, let’s look at each of these scenarios:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Exclude apps during initial install</H2>\n<P>There are two main ways how admins can control which apps are excluded at the initial install of Office 365 ProPlus. First, using the Office Customization Tool (OCT) at <A href=\"https://config.office.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://config.office.com</A>, admins can simply toggle the buttons for the apps they wish to exclude from the initial install:</P>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorEric_Wayne_0\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"apps.png\" style=\"width: 211px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179203i2CA092BAE31C7E52/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"apps.png\" alt=\"apps.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This will craft the configuration file with the necessary exclusions for you. You can either export and save the file locally or <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/Save-your-Office-deployment-configurations-to-the-cloud/ba-p/671806\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">to the cloud</A> and reference this file during setup.</P>\n<P>A second way that admins can control which apps are installed at the initial install of Office 365 ProPlus is to leverage the &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"APPNAME\" /&gt; attribute in the ODT configuration file directly. The names of all the app values are as follows:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>ID=\"Access\"</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"Excel\"</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"Groove\" (This is the old sync client for on-Premises SharePoint)</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"Lync\" (Skype for Business)</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"OneDrive\"</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"OneNote\" (OneNote 2016, Win32 app. NOT the UWP Windows 10 app)</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"Outlook\"</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"PowerPoint\"</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"Publisher\"</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"Teams\"</LI>\n<LI>ID=\"Word\"</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>A sample configuration file with Groove and OneNote excluded from the install would look like this:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"markup\">&lt;Configuration&gt;\n  &lt;Add OfficeClientEdition=\"64\" Channel=\"Monthly\"&gt;\n      &lt;Product ID=\"0365ProPlusRetail\"&gt;\n        &lt;Language ID=\"MatchOS\" /&gt;\n        &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\" /&gt;\n        &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"OneNote\" /&gt;\n      &lt;/Product&gt;\n  &lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><BR />With either method at install time, Office 365 ProPlus will be installed with the selected apps excluded. You can verify by looking at this registry key:</P>\n<P>HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Office\\ClickToRun\\Configuration<BR />O365ProPlusRetail.ExcludedApps <BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"registry.png\" style=\"width: 489px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179205iE9EC59A53653134A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"registry.png\" alt=\"registry.png\" /></span><BR />Or simply by checking the start menu and noticing those applications are not present. &nbsp;&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Remove specific apps after initial install</H2>\n<P>If Office 365 ProPlus is already installed on a device or devices and you need to remove one or more of the apps, you can use the same method as above. However, there are a couple things to keep in mind.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>You can use <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/new-feature-make-changes-to-office-deployments-without-changing/ba-p/816482\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Version=”MatchInstalled”</A> to eliminate the need to keep track of the Architecture and Servicing Channel as this attribute will read the existing values and honor them. This can cut down on the number of configuration files needed in environments with multiple Office 365 ProPlus configurations.</LI>\n<LI>Setup.exe and the configuration file will need access to the Office source files. Either from the Microsoft CDN (Recommended) or internally by including them in a Configuration Manager application. Click-to-Run Office does not cache source files like the MSI version did in the MSOCache location.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"warning.png\" style=\"width: 59px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179206i59007C95B871235D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"warning.png\" alt=\"warning.png\" /></span><BR /><EM>If you had previously excluded an app or apps at initial install time, <STRONG>and wish to keep them excluded</STRONG>, you must continue to exclude them via the &lt;ExcludeApp…/&gt; section of the new configuration file you create along with whichever app or apps you now also want to exclude. Failure to do so will result in those applications being present and usable by your users.</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The below example configuration file, leveraging “MatchInstalled” would remove Access from the device after initial install:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"markup\">&lt;Configuration&gt;\n  &lt;Add Version=\"MatchInstalled\"&gt;\n    &lt;Product ID=\"O365ProPlusRetail\"&gt;\n      &lt;Language ID=\"MatchOS\" /&gt;\n      &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Access\" /&gt;\n    &lt;/Product&gt;\n  &lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Like the warning pointed out, running the above configuration will result in Access excluded and <STRONG><U>ONLY ACCESS EXCLUDED</U></STRONG>. If you had previously excluded apps such as Groove or OneNote 2016 from your initial install and now wish to exclude Access while keeping Groove and OneNote 2016 <U>also excluded</U>, you must have all three applications called out like in this example:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"markup\">&lt;Configuration&gt;\n  &lt;Add Version=\"MatchInstalled\"&gt;\n    &lt;Product ID=\"O365ProPlusRetail\"&gt;\n      &lt;Language ID=\"MatchOS\" /&gt;\n      &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Access\" /&gt;\n      &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\" /&gt;\n      &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"OneNote\" /&gt;\n    &lt;/Product&gt;\n  &lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Re-including apps that were previously removed</H2>\n<P><BR />This is very similar to the above scenario. Since Office 365 ProPlus does not include or exclude applications in the traditional sense, but rather asks “what do you want the suite to look like after this configuration?” So therefore If you excluded an app at initial install or post install and now wish to add it back in, you will use a similar configuration to the above example leaving any other apps still excluded you want to remain that way.</P>\n<P>Consider this scenario: The IT Pro excluded Access, Groove and OneNote 2016 at initial install and now wishes to add OneNote 2016 back into the suite but leave Access and Groove still excluded. The example configurations would look like this:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"markup\">Initial install Configuration:\n\n&lt;Configuration&gt;\n  &lt;Add OfficeClientEdition=\"64\" Channel=\"Monthly\"&gt;\n      &lt;Product ID=\"O365ProPlusRetail\"&gt;\n        &lt;Language ID=\"MatchOS\" /&gt;\n        &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Access\" /&gt;\n        &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\" /&gt;\n        &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"OneNote\" /&gt;\n      &lt;/Product&gt;\n  &lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</LI-CODE><LI-CODE lang=\"markup\">Second install Configuration:\n\n&lt;Configuration&gt;\n  &lt;Add Version=\"MatchInstalled\"&gt;\n      &lt;Product ID=\"O365ProPlusRetail\"&gt;\n        &lt;Language ID=\"MatchOS\" /&gt;\n        &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Access\" /&gt;\n        &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\" /&gt;\n      &lt;/Product&gt;\n  &lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Adding Visio and/or Project after initial ProPlus installation</H2>\n<P><BR />Visio and Project operate in a different manner as they are different Product ID’s. These products cannot be added or excluded with the &lt;ExcludeApp/&gt; attribute. They can be added after the initial install by using a configuration file with Visio and/or Project as the &lt;add Product ID&gt; value. You must match the servicing channel and version of Click to Run architecture (64/32-bit) to prevent making unwanted changes. Better yet, you can leverage the power of the CDN and the new <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Office-365-Blog/New-feature-Make-changes-to-Office-deployments-without-changing/ba-p/816482\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">&lt;MatchInstalled&gt; attribute</A> to do the heavy lifting here. Deploying Visio and/or Project from the Microsoft CDN after installing Office 365 ProPlus is very bandwidth friendly as most of the shared files are already installed.</P>\n<P>Here is an example configuration of adding Visio and Project to device after Office 365 ProPlus has already been deployed:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"markup\">&lt;Configuration&gt;\n  &lt;Add Version=\"MatchInstalled\"&gt;\n    &lt;Product ID=\"ProjectProRetaill\"&gt;\n      &lt;Language ID=\"MatchOS\" /&gt;\n      &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\" /&gt;\n    &lt;/Product&gt;\n   &lt;Product ID=\"VisioProRetaill\"&gt;\n      &lt;Language ID=\"MatchOS\" /&gt;\n      &lt;ExcludeApp ID=\"Groove\" /&gt;\n    &lt;/Product&gt;\n  &lt;/Add&gt;\n&lt;/Configuration&gt;\n</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"warning.png\" style=\"width: 59px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179208iFDBF122786042093/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"warning.png\" alt=\"warning.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><EM>Notice in the above example I have excluded Groove from both Product sections. Groove, OneDrive and Teams operate slightly different at install time and if not excluded from each product they will get installed along with Office 365 ProPlus, Visio and Project Click-to-Run.</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>The Author</H2>\n<P>This blog post is brought to you by Eric Wayne, a Sr. Office Deployment expert and ProPlus Ranger at Microsoft. Feel free to share your questions and feedback in the comments below.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 24 Mar 2020 19:31:38 +0000","feedId":10337,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179203i2CA092BAE31C7E52/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"c5ca1031b8fc7fa14e13296ffb356b98","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn47@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-50-41-223_0d7a6401f7b94975.webp","destWidth":211,"destHeight":137,"sourceBytes":12504,"destBytes":4530,"author":"Eric_Wayne","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179203i2CA092BAE31C7E52/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn47@2020_2/2020/08/25/00-50-41-223_0d7a6401f7b94975.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179205iE9EC59A53653134A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn59@2020_5/2020/08/25/00-52-40-385_03e91b679ae01dcb.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179206i59007C95B871235D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn60@2020_4/2020/08/25/00-52-40-404_e06039493cb30c2d.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/179208iFDBF122786042093/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/25/00-52-47-077_8f2f9be39937a5c1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598316639091},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 08:50:39","title":"Security Baseline recommendations now available in Office Cloud Policy Service","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/security-baseline-recommendations-now-available-in-office-cloud/ba-p/1097622","description":"<P>We are pleased to announce a new feature in the Office Cloud Policy Service that will allow you to easily find and configure policies that are recommended by Microsoft as security baseline policies.&nbsp; If you are not familiar with Microsoft Office Security Baselines take a look at this <A href=\"https://aka.ms/officesecbaseline\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">article</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To easily identify Security Baseline policies, we have added a new column to the policy table called ‘Recommendation’.&nbsp; If the policy is recommended as a Security Baseline you will see the policy tagged as such in this column.&nbsp; You can also use the column filter to limit the view to only policies that are tagged as Security Baseline.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture1.png\" style=\"width: 975px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164353i6F61662015B9203F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture1.png\" alt=\"Picture1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The experience to configure these policies has also been optimized as the policy is preconfigured with the recommended settings.&nbsp; You can simply review the policy behavior and click OK to accept the recommended configuration.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture2.png\" style=\"width: 884px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164354i475E4920CBC4B20C/image-dimensions/884x625?v=1.0\" width=\"884\" height=\"625\" title=\"Picture2.png\" alt=\"Picture2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If the recommended configuration does not meet your needs, you can select to manually configure the policy and configure the settings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For additional information about the Office Cloud Policy Service please refer to <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/deployoffice/overview-office-cloud-policy-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this 365","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/get-started-at-office-com-with-tools-for-improved-productivity/ba-p/287448","description":"<P>Modern workers are always looking for ways to be more productive, but in today’s always connected world filled with infinite distractions, it is hard to stay focused, find what you are looking for and determine where to get started doing your most important work. &nbsp;Office.com pulls your most relevant apps, documents and places where you and your coworkers are working—all in one place. &nbsp;We are pleased to update you on the new capabilities that are coming to Office 365 in the web.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Get started with Office.com<BR /> We reimagined Office.com last year as the best place to get started, get back to your content and get the most of your Office 365 subscription. Giving you fast access to what’s most important to you, we have rolled out a Recommended Section that helps you discover relevant documents, like the ones your colleagues recently edited or added.&nbsp; We have also introduced new start pages for Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Sway that give you access to recommended and recent files filtered to the specific application you are working in.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Office. com Vertical.png\" style=\"width: 618px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/59890i1C69BAEBF0584D5A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Office. com Vertical.png\" alt=\"Office. com Vertical.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Bringing Microsoft 365 Search, and improved help to your fingertips</P>\n<P>Microsoft is introducing new tools for collaborating and getting back to work that are available across all of Office 365 in the web in a single click—streamlining the ability for users to work more efficiently by reducing context switching.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft 365 Search<BR /> You no longer have to search different applications separately. With Microsoft 365 Search within Office 365 in the web, you can find the documents, people, sites, and apps you need—even third-party apps your company uses.&nbsp;<SPAN>Microsoft 365 Search is available on&nbsp;</SPAN><A tabindex=\"-1\" title=\"http://www.office.com/\" href=\"http://www.office.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">www.office.com</A><SPAN>&nbsp;now, and It will be elevated to the top of the page by the end of the year. In the coming months, it will be rolling out </SPAN>to other Office 365 applications. Learn more about it <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2018/09/24/microsoft-search-cohesive-search-that-intelligently-helps-you-find-discover-command-and-navigate/\" target=\"_blank\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Office.com + Search.png\" style=\"width: 908px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/59891i26C514301E73B981/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Office.com + Search.png\" alt=\"Office.com + Search.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Improved Help and Support</P>\n<P>The services that power help and support in Office desktop clients, are now extended to the web. The new and improved help and support pane gives you tips, access to the latest support articles, and provides contextual help on the top issues for the app you’re using. You can also customize the pane with your company’s helpdesk information. The new experience is rolling out on <A href=\"https://na01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.office.com&amp;data=02%7C01%7Cnogaro%40microsoft.com%7Cdf1ef9ce0e5b40bb97ab08d63a9cbb0f%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C636760842155251267&amp;sdata=FfB1PLVLdv9QSLRD1AKa2vIU%2FSbwasTyUThh8W94Rgk%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\">www.office.com</A>&nbsp;over the next month and will roll out&nbsp;across all Office 365 in the web over the coming months.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Excel .png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/59892i5A2B9F6B34CDD0AB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Excel .png\" alt=\"Excel .png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Visit <A href=\"http://www.office.com\" target=\"_blank\">www.office.com</A> and try out the new experiences. font-size: 1.6em; line-height: 1.5; padding: 0px;\"><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2019/06/18/powerpoint-ai-upgrade-designer-major-milestone-1-billion-slides/\" target=\"_self\">Today we announced</A> that Designer now works with a company or organization's custom branded templates! Now AI recommendations on layout, designs, colors, and fonts can help employees save time and keep them on-brand while adhering to your company's brand guidelines. So how can brand managers, designers, and IT admins make their custom templates work well with Designer?&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #2f2f2f; font-family: &amp;quot; segoe ui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;segoe ui web&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;segoe ui symbol&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;wf_segoe-ui_normal&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;bbalpha sans&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;s60 sans&amp;quot;,arial,sans-serif;
